title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet Octopus who explains that they are really smart and that they have very good senses. They use their ink cloud to defend themselves and distract predators who want to eat them.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Check out how to create the classic origami crane and follow to make one of your own!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Linda Burney is a Labor politician, who is incredibly proud of how she represents the Indigenous community by displaying grace and kindness.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Brianna Davey is an Australian sportswoman, who advises to really love what you do and not care about what others think.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features William McMahon.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Butterfly fish takes some time out from being good looking to tell us all about how they peck at coral with their long snouts for food and how he uses these good looks to confuse and camouflage himself to evade predators.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Book Report by Joel
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Joel reviews 'An Eagle in the Snow' by Michael Mapurgo.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 18 Year 1: Writing a Narrative Text
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to write a narrative. Ms Sheddan demonstrates the important features of a narrative, and she provides the opportunity for you to write your own at home.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Uh, oh! Possum breaks one of Sally's plates and is worried she will be angry. He tries to put it back together. Sally says that it looks a bit like a jigsaw puzzle. What will that lead to?

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Our artist shows how a bit of water can help blend some beautiful colours in your painting!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Say. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 20 A Reflection On Refraction
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Right or left? Aha! Trick question - both! Eric learns how refraction changes what we see. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to hear and identify rhyming words. Mr Meissner demonstrates how to find rhyming words in a book, and he provides opportunities to make your very own treasure box of rhyming things at home.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode is all about capacity. Take two different shaped containers for example: a tall, skinny cylinder and a short wide one. Which one will hold more beads?

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: When Rich has problems with his creativity Matt suggests an unusual solution a Mind Poo. In this Art Blast Rich takes a trip through Surreal Art to see where Art ideas come from.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Have you ever wondered how a kite works? Tag along with Eric to see how symmetry helps kites fly. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric builds his own groovy lava lamp! It's not magic, it's science.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Jemma's farm! They say you can't make an omelette without cracking a few eggs and boy would they be right! Join Jemma at her family's egg farm as they enjoy a meal from paddock to plate. Anyone for a mini doughnut?

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Robbie is an 11-year-old boy who has epilepsy. Robbie suffers from absences where he doesn't know where he is. Although they don't last very long, they have the potential to be very dangerous in certain circumstances.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word From. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 4 The American Independence - 4 July 1776
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The American revolution is sometimes watered down to the point where it can become an almost silent revolution.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are among the very fastest animals in the world - sprinting champions! Your horns sure are beautiful! You are very graceful, and in fact, the name "antelope" means "fabulous animal".

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Brianna from Broome, WA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Nineteen eye operations to be able to see the world.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Join Maddie at an Eco Village as she finds out how we use and can save water.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric learns how the four steps of the scientific method work together to find and test the answers to many questions. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Here, putting on a pretty light show, is a glow worm. We learn that after sundown she and her girlfriends light up to attract both boys and food.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Here among the flowers we meet a wasp! While living in a nest she does really helpful things like eat bugs that eat your plants and drink nectar from flowers but don't mistake her for a bee, you might get stung.

title: War On Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig meets Yume founder Katy Barfield who's on a one woman mission to save commercial food waste from landfill.

title: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
series: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
description: It's the not-so-trashy reality show that takes well-known recyclables where they belong! Follow brave recyclables such as Bernie the Banana, Billie Jeans, and Baxter Bottle on their very different journeys of transformation. Stages 2-4 Science, Geography.
description2: On I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here not everyone is totally convinced on the benefits of recycling. Find out whether Baxter makes the right choice about his future.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HOW. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Start by learning how to fold the paper airplane that won the long distance record. Phil finds out making a giant paper airplane that will still fly is way harder than you'd think. Plus terminal velocity and indoor tornadoes!

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Zhe Wen lives in Shanghai, a bustling and energetic city with a population of over 23 million people.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil builds a balloon powered car in the lab. Then he tries to make one big enough to ride. Plus, Newton's Cradle out of bowling balls, how Guinea Pigs got their name and Newton's 3rd Law.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: A powerful and beautifully animated documentary that uses the first-person testimony of Summer, a 12 year-old living with epilepsy.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava got a new tangram puzzle and she wrote a song about it!

title: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
series: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
description: It's the not-so-trashy reality show that takes well-known recyclables where they belong! Follow brave recyclables such as Bernie the Banana, Billie Jeans, and Baxter Bottle on their very different journeys of transformation. Stages 2-4 Science, Geography.
description2: On I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here not everyone is totally convinced on the benefits of recycling. Find out whether Baxter makes the right choice about his future.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word NOT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Nanna is unwell so Little J and Big Cuz eagerly take over running the house  their way! Fun ways to do housework soon descend into slapstick chaos. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Warlpiri.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 19 The Singular Plural Blues
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wonders why some words, like jeans and scissors, have an "S" at the end while only referring to one pair of something. Turns out, there's a song about that.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Jango is determined to be picked to be in the Hoopla Fire Brigade.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China's military deal with the Solomon Islands, the investigation into the China Eastern plane crash, Jinghua Qian examines China's shifting attitudes towards mental health and Brendan Wan looks at the new generation of wine makers putting Chinese wine on the map.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Arnolfini Portrait' by Jan Van Eyck. Inside the painting she explores the clues that Van Eyck painted into the picture giving us meanings.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: Max learns responsibility by taking a special book with him to school. He looks after it all day, with the help of a special, little friend.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wrote this bouncy, bubbly song about adjectives!

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: How wonderful is Rome! And how amazing is having a guide like Apollodoro of Damascus explaining the ingenious architecture of Pantheon!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Metal Recycling Centre
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is learning about metal and how it can be recycled and used again. Maddie visits a metal recycling centre where they recycle metal from old cars.

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: If it's too much trouble to remember the differences between to, too and two, pick up a tip or two in this video.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: It's the one and only number 1.

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 9 Science Year 3: Day and Night
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Mrs Bhardwaj inquires into the size of the Sun, Earth and Moon. She explains how the Earth's rotation on its axis causes day and night, and she models the revolution of the Earth around the Sun.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: When will the big rain come? Old Stephen has predicted it but everyone and everything else is waiting.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric is racking his brain to figure out how best to place four apple trees so that they are equally far apart. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 2 A Midsummer Night's Dream With Hugh Bonneville
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Hugh Bonneville discusses the enduring appeal of William Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream with Ralph Fiennes, David Walliams and Sheridan Smith.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: When antacid tablets mix with water, you get a chemical reaction. Phil harnesses this to make several variations on rockets! Plus, why acids and bases react and how to use chemistry to make light or instant crystals.

title: Growing Up In The Early 1900s
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 School, Chores and Sleep
description: What was life like for working-class children in Australian cities in the early 1900s? How different or similar was their day to yours? Learn how Jim and Dolly Youngein spent their days in Susannah Place, Sydney.
description2: The Youngein children studied, worked and played very differently to children today. How was school and afterschool different for children back then?

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A city boy named Sam doesn't like the bush. Find out how Sam changes his mind when he visits his nanna.

title: Mixed Up Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Strawberry Milkshake Warrior Princess
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: There is a disaster on the horizon, and we need a super hero to save us. But which super hero is right for the task? Maybe we need to build a new hero...with all the right super units.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie finds out what happens to our bodies when we go to sleep at night.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Caravaggio's studio is full of chiaroscuro! Mati and Dada learn how to paint with dark shadows and light and make very dramatic paintings.

title: Seeking Refuge
episode_name: Series 1 I'll Stop Crying If You Stop Crying
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: Hamid from Eritrea had to flee his country and adjust to life in the UK.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Historical story of how statisticians built the case against DDT as the culprit behind plummeting peregrine falcon population numbers.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Enjo lives in Quinten, a forest glade in the mountains of Switzerland, with his parents and three cats: Tom, Milu and Panther. Enjo is a deep thinker, who enjoys researching new things.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word CHOP. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HUG. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 1 1431: Fall of the Angkor Empire
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: This series tells world history through a few major dates. Driven by the delivery of historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life in an accessible and lively manner.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When little red hen bakes a cake, her lazy friends won't help, so who should get to eat it?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Do you remember the treasure hunt? This time Skip and Possum write a code with instructions for Sally to follow. Read carefully, Sally you have to do just what the instructions tell you.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki and Mo have a new neighbour: a cool psychology streamer named Doc Daphne. Mikki is feeling very threatened, and it doesn't help that Daphne is her sister. Mikki reaches out to popstars, The Veronicas.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric's old kite is broken! In this STEM episode Eric learns how to build an excellent kite! It's not magic, it's science!

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: How Do You Score A Film?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Wondered how film scores evolved over time? Dan composes five scores for five film scenes starring Linda, taking us from silent era to the modern blockbuster.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like having Down syndrome.

title: Create
episode_name: Back To School: Rice Paper Roll
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Brain food is incredibly important especially in the first few weeks back at school and ABC ME will show you an easy to follow recipe to get those brain cells pumping!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Wow your friends with this "magic" trick that uses tumblers. 1, 2, 3, and abracadabra! It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she finds out about trees and how the roots, leaves and bark work.

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: The Australian Parliament borrows an enormous amount of traditions from another Parliament, 17,000 kilometres away. Meet some of the office holders upholding Westminster Traditions in Australian parliament today.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Seveen reviews 'The Boy Who Cried Wolf and other Aesop's Fables' by Miles Kelly.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wizard Jeff asks Wally to house-sit for him while he's on vacation. Wally happily accepts, but he quickly discovers that nothing in a wizard's house is how it seems - it's a pretty wacky place!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: When you go to the doctor, what can you say to describe how you're feeling? Find out more in this Everyday English episode.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Deploying drones to improve safety in underground mines
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Hovermap drone technology using laser signals instead of GPS can be deployed in underground environments like coal mines. Melissa Maddison reports.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza tries to juggle a football, a baseball, and a hockey puck but quickly loses control. Each one of these sports projectiles has a different size and shape.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create a monster mailbox to hold all of your valentine's cards, we promise they won't be scared away!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: In this episode of Everyday English, learn to talk about food and meals from a restaurant.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 36 We Don't need an S
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wrote a little song about words that don't follow the plural rules!

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star Akala explores William Blake's poem 'London' and discusses how power and authority are abused to oppress the weakest in society. Akala discusses the poem and what it can tell us about the present day.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate how wool is grown at a farm near Coonawarra in South Australia.

title: Create
episode_name: Trash To Treasure: Egg Carton Jewellery Box
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Turn a boring egg carton and an old belt into a colourful handy jewellery box. How much can you squeeze in?

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Letter H makes a great sounding start.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Math and music are an awesome twosome. They work together in the coolest ways!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Letter R is right on.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 26 Can't We Get Along?
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey sings about why we use different versions of the same verb, depending on who's doing the doing.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SHE. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Back Roads Kids
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Canowindra is between Orange and Cowra, in the central west region of New South Wales. The name of the town means "home" in the local Wiradjuri language.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Just last year, the Chinese government declared dogs would be classified as pets, not food. Regardless, controversial dog meat festivals are still underway.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum seems to think that the more flowers he puts into the vase the better it will look. Then he learns how to find odd and even numbers and think carefully about the arrangement. How nice they look now!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: All aboard for a riotous railway ride as the Numberblocks try to stop a runaway train.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava estimates the size of different objects using non-standard units like steps, paperclips and even teddy bears!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THIS. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza is determined to find out why so many instruments like flutes and organs are cylinders. To find out, we'll play music with water glasses, and meet "Bubba" Bach, the inventor of flatulent-sounding novelty horns.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Our uses change with the evolution of society. It is the job of designers to support us in this change, how do they imagine tools that could make our life easier?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Six tries to get the cheeky sheep to sleep and discovers that two (or three) heads are better than one. Learn how to share 6 into equal parts with the Numberblocks.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Aha! Has Sally got a new ladder for Possum to climb? No, this belongs to someone else. What new things will Possum learn now?

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: By manipulating the Internet we communicate with "data centers" connected by optical fiber without knowing it. So, is the "cloud" as light and remote as one might think?

title: Social Media Me
description: This three-part series follows three characters' experiences with identity and self-esteem, as they navigate social media and real world relationships.
description2: How can we manage social media use so that it's positive? How can we tell when social media use is affecting us and our relationships in a negative way? We find out in the final episode of this three-part series.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Lawrence and Charlotte talk about their weekend and what's happening in and around the office.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: This fiesty fellow here, is a grasshopper. With his five eyes and extreme jumping skills it's pretty hard to catch this little guy. He's probably pretty happy about that fact, because even people like to eat him as a snack!

title: Social Media Me
description: This three-part series follows three characters' experiences with identity and self-esteem, as they navigate social media and real world relationships.
description2: How can we manage social media use so that it's positive? How can we tell when social media use is affecting us and our relationships in a negative way? We find out in the final episode of this three-part series.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Even though we can see this little snail, he can't see or hear us, good thing he can smell us! As he hangs upsidedown he tells us that most snails actually live underwater.

title: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
series: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 Australians On The Western Front
description: A young woman investigates Australia's remembrance and forgetting of WWI. Stage 5 History, English.
description2: Kate Aubusson takes a thought provoking look at the battles of the Western Front, and identifies key sites where the AIF fought - why have they been so forgotten?

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A six-year-old girl is violently separated from her parents during Nazi occupied Paris, and how she was kept in hiding throughout the war working in an isolated rural farm.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Nas Campanella, newsreader for triple J talks about how she changes the world.

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 The Plants We Use
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she learns how we use plants in our everyday lives.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The sneaky Sheepshead Fish likes to use his sharp teeth to munch on several ocean creatures and to steal the bait off fishing hooks.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to be a refugee.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family travel back to the 1940s when World War Two broke out. Women began to move into the paid workforce and food rationing was enforced. This decade also marked the end of the war.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word LET. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko becomes upset after losing a race against Dog and Bird. Can Dog and Bird convince Keeko that races are just for fun?

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Sardine loves to swish their fins from sea to sea but they have to travel with friends in a school to potect them from predators and Humans.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Bee tells a story about the Loch Ness monster wanting to fly and a dragon who wanted to learn to swim, as the Pencil Pals learn about verbs.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Model, student, and indigineous activist Aretha would tell her 12 year old self to stop worrying about trying to impress everyone.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 2 To Be A 12 Year Old Girl
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: In this episode we hear what 12 year old girls like about themselves, and about their hopes and dreams for the future.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to mash up Jazz and Cha Cha

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1978 - Mike knows a lot about Australian muscle cars from 1968 to 1978 but the other kids think he's odd and he thinks he has only got one friend, Ben. But is Ben a real friend?

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Duncan Stewart looks at one of the most crucial questions that affects us all, how to power entire nations in the 21st Century?

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: In todays program we're going to mash up Disco and Tutting

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Lavender is locked into the library overnight, but there is more to the books than images!

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode targeted at the Primary maths curriculum, Stefan explores alternatives to car use by pedaling a rickshaw across Bristol and constructs simple equations to calculate the carbon cost of a new cycle way.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Lawrence and Charlotte talk about their weekend and what's happening in and around the office.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: A powerful and beautifully animated documentary using first-person testimony from two children, Ben and Izzie, who both suffer with anaphylactic allergies.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Buster sees a duck on his lawn, he sneaks out to try to jump on it, but gets airborne!

title: Mini Lessons: Science Primary
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Years 5-6: Material World - Slime
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn what happens when we combine different materials to make a new mixture or substance. Mrs Carmeli will show you some simple investigations, to determine which materials are best for making slime.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 1 The Battle Continues Part 1
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig Reucassel returns for Season 2 of the series that sparked action across the nation. Craig explores our reliance on single-use plastic items such as bottles and straws that damage our waterways and marine life.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Parrot Fish is the gardener of the ocean, they clean the coral reef and try to keep it all nice and healthy.

title: Weirdy Rhymes
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Round And Round The Phnnty Phnnnt
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: No one likes a Squitsy Fly buzzing round your face. All it ever wants to do is kiss your eyeball. Unfortunately, the shape shifting Phnnty Phnnnt has lots of them, at various times.

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Whether or not you're talking about the weather outside or the wether on the farm, we explain which spelling you should use to make sure you're understood properly.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Have you ever wanted to take a vacation in the first or second dimension? Hamza discovers the world of height, width and depth in this multi-dimensional episode of Look Kool.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Dr Emily Flies joins Bri to investigate why mosquitoes make that high pitched buzzing noise.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: The Threebies show off their 3D shapes in a stylish fashion show!

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: Sheep, cows and... lasers? Hapless Rich attempts to peacefully rest his eyes on paintings of the pastoral countryside. But Matt has other ideas.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: A visit to the University of New Hampshire Survey Centre illustrates how pollsters create accurate surveys. They can then use details from their sample to make inferences about a whole population.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Buzzing around in her usual way, is the horsefly. She tells us all about her troubles with horse wasps and her love of horse's blood.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: What is Empathy and how can we use our brains to practice it? It's called 'Prefrontal Power!' and it helps us to see life from someone else's perspective.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Echidna - Buneen.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Why Aren't We Listening?
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: This episode examines the factors that predispose people not to listen, but also offers an opportunity for some focused guided listening in the first movement of Mendelssohn's Symphony No. 4 "Italian".

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Johanna is aware of a lot of whispering about her parentage and becomes determined to find out who her father really is. She starts to investigate but is unprepared for a shocking discovery.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: A nature preserve that's tracked bird migrations through New England for decades records tons of bird-related data everything from wingspan measurements to arrival dates provides examples of normal distributions.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: David Tennant, whose RSC portrayal of Hamlet was a huge hit, meets other actors who have played the role. He also attempts to unravel the meaning of the play and why it is considered the greatest play Shakespeare ever wrote.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: No one family looks the same, they're all different and it's important for our children to realise other families are different from their own, but no less fantastic.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a curious fish! A fish that does nothing like the others... We recognize you right away, thanks to your raised little head, with a shape reminiscent of a horse - hence your pretty nickname "sea horse".

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks make a new friend: football fan Eleven, who gets them all in training for the big match.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Kadir lives in East Turkey. He has made his own robot, but it doesn't work yet: it needs electricity to move. To make his robot finally move, he builds his very own hydroelectric station in a mountain stream near his house.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: George Seurat shows Mati and Dada the scientific magic of how colors in his paintings are mixed by their eyes!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Seven shows the others how to be lucky: ask a number friend to jump on your head, but how do you know which friend?

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: The Case Of The Missing Fridge
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally's waiting for her new fridge. Jay the deliveryman arrives at Sally's door with the fridge but she cannot hear him knocking. Meanwhile, Possum takes the fridge.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: An exciting adventure in Leonardo's studio discovering his fantastic flying machines.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Raynnan lives with his parents close to the rocket launching site of the European Space Centre in French Guiana. Raynnan experiments with action/reaction and builds his own rocket.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Clare, Dougal, Leo and Mike discover the secrets of ice. On a bobsleigh track in the Swiss Alps, Leo learns about the slippery properties of this frozen substance, whilst Mike explores the devastating power of ice storms.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in using air pressure to create propulsion in rockets, tricky ways to fold paper into mind-bending shapes, creating a moving robot based on uneven weight transference on an axle and much more.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Zap is going so fast he has a big crash whilst delivering the mail and all the parcels lose their address labels. No one in Hoopla gets what they ordered so Zap needs to find a way to deliver everything again.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Culturally sensitive practices combined with disability support has great results
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A Cape York community is combining disability services with culturally sensitive practices with impressive results. Holly Richardson reports.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: It's impossible to keep up with you, Kangaroo! You're able to reach incredible speeds by using your huge hind legs! Kangaroos are marsupials, meaning they have a pouch for their babies.

title: My Life
episode_name: Series 1 The Boy on the Bicycle
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Ahmed, a 16-year-old Syrian boy gives a guided tour through one of the biggest refugee camps in the world - Zaatari in Jordan.

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Pounce and Gemma tell us about their heroes, lifeguards - what they do, how they train, and how you can participate at your own beach.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: In this episode we find out what it takes to become a hairdresser, with a little help from Jake.

title: Rhymes And Songs
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Explore the concepts of beat, rhythm and texture in music in this atmospheric modal song.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in forced perspective in trick photography, the transformation of kinetic energy into potential energy in a bouncy ball, contamination and purification in the water table and lots more.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is having fun outdoors. First, she's in a playground learning how we keep swinging on a swing, and how gravity helps us slide down a slide.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to an umbrella factory to see how umbrellas are made using waterproof material.

title: Create
episode_name: Plant Life: Potting Up A Plant
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Sometimes a plant will grow out of its pot and sometimes you just want it to grow even bigger! If that's you then this episode of Create shows you how to pot up a plant in it's new home and provide a healthy environment.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Matisse in person teaches Mati and Dada about the funny Art of paper cut-outs.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum notices that Sally gets letters but he doesn't. He thinks maybe it's because the postman doesn't know where his tree is. Sally suggests it's maybe because he doesn't write any letters.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Equilibrium And Advanced Thermodynamics: Balance And Chemical Reactions
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Some chemical reactions happen spontaneously while others are non-spontaneous and need to absorb energy to occur. Using Thermodynamics, and the calculation of Gibbs free energy scientists predict which reactions will occur.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: It's time to count what's in the piggy bank...maybe just enough to buy a new piggy bank!

title: Get Into Textiles
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 CAD/CAM In Textile Manufacturing
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource looks at how CAD/CAM is transforming all sections of the textile industry, from digital printing and embroidery to knitting and laser cutting.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Today we're getting the angle on angles. Hamza is really excited about his birthday present for Koolkatt - but all of the right angles in his brand-new Kitty Kastle are, well, wrong.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: When different measurement standards are used in different countries, big mistakes can happen!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Hoopla is in a mess after a big storm and Jango thinks it's too hard to clean up. So he pretends to be sick and tricks his friends into doing his work for him.

title: Mini Lessons
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: With a torch, Mrs Bhardwaj explains how shadows can change in direction and size. She encourages you to complete an investigation into how tree shadows change in length and direction during the day.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie lets Bop borrow her favourite plant for a few days to brighten up his workshop, but in the morning the plant looks sick. Bop doesn't want to return the plant until it's better so he needs his friends to help.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: It's a bird, it's a plane, no it's Planey McPlane Plane. It won't take long before you get the hang of this one!

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids explore experiments in how sense and sensory deprivation affects the human body, creating musical instruments by manipulating air vibrations, how ballast is used to keep ships upright and much more.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada at the Royal Academy! Incredible. Even more incredible if you think that William Turner in person is painting there and friendly brings the two children to his wonderful atelier.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: The Great Sandy Desert animals nervously hide from the dingo but what will happen when those animals come face to face with dingo?

title: Create
episode_name: Marbling: How To Marble With Dishwashing Liquid
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: It turns out dishwashing liquid isn't just for cleaning dishes! Find out how you can use it to create some really fun bubble patterns with marbling!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Sickle cell disease is an example of binomial distribution in families with two parents who are carriers for this genetic trait.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: In their very first Quiz Show, The Stickie Gang friends try their best to listen to the clues and name-the-shape before the buzzer sounds!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Does holding a heavier clipboard make you estimate that a jar of coins has more money in it than if you're holding a lighter clipboard? Psychologists use One-Way ANOVA to analyse the data from this experiment.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Do you know that today we use Artificial Intelligence in many areas? But by the way, what is an AI?

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, cook, and work in the 1940s? This decade commences with the world at war. Daily life on the home front changed significantly.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum loves to throw things, but he must throw them in the right place. He learns more about Reduce, Reuse and Recycle. Where did all those things come from, Possum?

title: Stargazing Live
description: Recorded over three nights at Siding Spring Observatory (SSO) in NSW, this series immerses the audience in a celebration of the night sky, with a focus on features that are best experienced from Australian soil.
description2: Brian Cox and Julia Zemiro are joined by thousands of Australians to break a stargazing world record while Madga Szubanski tours the moon.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Rachael feels like a 'Brave' superhero in this episode, ready to try new things and share her strength with her friends.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You live in the water but you are not a fish, nor a mammal or a crustacean. You belong to a very special family, the Cnidarians! At first, humans thought you might be an underwater plant!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Meet the artist known as Seventeen, who likes to paint 17 of everything.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out how maps are made. She meets a surveyor at a new housing estate who uses a special satellite to mark new roads and houses on a map.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This episode looks at how companies in the UK are working to meet government targets to reduce their environmental impact, by using state of the art water recycling plants and by making better use of their waste streams.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A very funny and charming story which uses the sounds of animals to relay an incident as it unfolds.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Your plumage is striped and you have a nice crest on your head! Wow! It looks like a crown! Your little ones know how to defend themselves by projecting their droppings onto intruders - what an education!

title: My Little Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Au Clair De La Lune
