description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Au Clair De La Lune is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Twelve helps the Numberblobs work out how many tokens they need for each fairground ride.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Tyra, Truc and Rhys. Has a Skiing Race with Dad
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Ghana, Tyra learns how to sell in her grandma's clothes shop in snowy Canada Rhys shows off his skiing prowess by beating his dad and in Vietnam, Truc learns how to pick carrots and turn them into a delicious salad.

title: What Is Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Can you make it as a musician on YouTube? We get deep in the niche, look at the history of the platform, and talk to YouTubers themselves about how video streaming has changed the ways we make and listen to music.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 14 Angel, Rhys and Tyra. Helps Mum Cook Lunch
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Peru, Angel plays football with his cousins - once he has finished his chores, in Canada, Rhys plays games in school where it's warm, and outside in the chilly snow. And in Ghana, Tyra helps her mum cook lunch.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a Bharatanatyam-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet the shy Boxfish hiding in the reefs near Australia. She explains their unconventional shapes, sizes and what they like to eat.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Learn how to use cause and effect language in this episode of Everyday English and pick up some environment-related vocabulary along the way.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to the beach, where she uses her thermal imaging camera to see how hot air and cold air make wind.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: How is writing to a friend different from writing a formal letter? Sarah and Jack explain in the latest episode of Everyday English.

title: Tell Your Story, Change Your World
episode_name: Tell Your Story, Change Your World
description: Only you can tell your own story, but getting started isn't always easy. Here are four unique stories from around Australia to help you find the words. Stage 5 English, PDHPE.
description2: Only you can tell your own story, but getting started isn't always easy. Here are four unique stories from around Australia to help you find the words. Stage 5 English, PDHPE.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a breakdance and disco-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Emmanuel Asante is a visual artist, originally from Ghana. Watch as he speaks of his experiences as an immigrant and of his struggles to become an artist and to win the approval of his family.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, Mrs Jegers teaches you how to ask questions to identify information from images. She demonstrates the "See, Think, Wonder" routine to help you ask great questions.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: In this space experiment, imitate the surface of the moon using flour and cocoa which has a similar consistency to the fine powder of rock dust found on the actual moon!

title: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
series: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
description: Tailored for a younger audience, these special classroom editions of YCAT provide unique insights into the lives of diverse Australians. Stage 5 Geography, English, PDHPE.
description2: In this special classroom edition of YCAT, a diverse mix of African Australians are asked outrageous questions about racism, poverty, and hair. Their answers are anything but black and white.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Jax Jacki Brown is a writer, performer, and Disability & Queer rights activist, who encourages people with disabilities to find their pride.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In the waters of South America we meet the misunderstood Piranha who explains that they are more than just scary monsters as the films make them out to be.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Travelling barber getting more men to chat about mental health
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A mobile barber shop created from scratch by a Canberra family is taking on the missions of getting more men to talk about mental health. Donal Sheil reports.

title: Minibeast Heroes
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing superpower. You'll find it hard to swallow these fun facts about a bug that may do more for the planet than any other animal.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Why some stars are red, and some are blue? Why comets have tails, but asteroids don't. Astronomers try to answer some of the biggest questions that we can possibly ask, all by just looking up!

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Flood Update, Flood Recovery Kids, NATO History, Aussie Astronauts, Tassie Tiger Return and Dorothy Hill.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Show your valentine that you think they are out of this world by making some adorable alien lollipops that are almost too cute to eat!

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 Years 1-2: Writing a Retell
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to write a retell. Alex demonstrates the important features of retelling a story, and she provides the opportunity for you to write your own at home.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: International comedian and children's book author David Walliams reflects on his experiences as a 12 year old, and offers advice to 12 year olds today.

title: What Makes Me Me?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer Who owns the sky?

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Shape an ancient calculator that never needs recharging.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric makes a number of parachutes in his quest to find the right sized one that will prevent his egg from smashing on the ground! It's not magic, it's science.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Three does magic tricks with apples to show the others who goes first, who's biggest and how to surprise your number friends.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: What a pretty bird! There's no mistaking who you are - you are very unique! Your plumage is blue and green with lovely reflections, and you have a looooong train of colourful feathers.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Robert Simpson and Caroline West explore the nature of free speech and the role of censorship.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric learns how sound travels and builds a unique musical instrument.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: New app gives local bands alternative to Spotify, Apple
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Two Perth musicians have created a music streaming app they say will provide more direct benefits to performers than the dominant streaming platforms. Nic Perpitch reports.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Robots roam restaurant to serve customers and fill staffing shortages
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A shortage of hospitality workers across Victoria has forced some business to look for futuristic solutions. Rebekah Lowe reports.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: A football keeps coming over the fence and it's not like Possum's soccer ball. What will Possum learn about sports balls and who is making this ball appear again and again?

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: Possum Wants To Go To School
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: It's the first day of school and Possum is excited. Sally has to explain that school is only for children, and not for possums. Together they create a great alternative where Possum can learn too.

title: Atom Bond
description: Shrouded in the mysterious world of espionage, Agent Gold is on a mission exploring the complex world of chemical bonds. This reimagining of a classic animation takes a comprehensive look at covalent, ionic and metallic bonding. Secondary Science.
description2: In the hideout, Chlorine is trapped in Carbon's buckyball & Gold is put behind bars. When released, Ethanol takes him on a guided tour of the completed Project D. It's giant DNA molecule which will bring Planet Earth to life.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Heywire puts young Aussies at the centre of the conversations that shape their communities. Meet the winners of this storytelling competition as they share candid and courageous stories of growing up outside the big cities.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Dear mandrill! You are a monkey with extraordinary colours! The harlequin of the tropical forest! A blue and red face surrounded by bright yellow hairs! And not only on the face on your behind, too!

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Lauren tries to save her local pool to benefit her community.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Ilai is an actor and presenter and believes in being true to yourself even when people might not agree with you.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: Investigates how sound is made and how we hear it and explains how sound is caused by vibration.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Alex uses his entrepreneurial skills to deal with a pile of unexpected bills by earning money with a car wash and selling unused items from the family's shed.

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
episode_name: Series 1 Hahndorf - Pioneer Living German Style!
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1850, 12 year old Thekla Staude regularly trekked 26 kilometres from her home in Hahndorf village to sell her handmade produce at market in Adelaide. Will Maeve and Harper complete the long walk to market to make a sale?

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Sporting her well known yellow and black colours, we meet the bumblebee. Despite her peaceful existence she still has all sorts of creatures after her, it's a good thing she's got that stinger to protect her.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Learn how to use air pressure to make your own, home-made rocket out of a plastic water bottle. Phil maxes this out by over-pressurising stronger bottles and finally by building a giant rocket out of plastic bottles.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Interjections are useful words, but sometimes they interrupt and are a little bit rude, like when Interjection Monster comes around...

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Mrs Trotter goes to a garden party, the mischievous wind has a cunning plan in mind.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy orders a a special magic cloak that will make him invisible, but when the cloak doesn't work his friends pretend that they can't see him.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 The Future of Energy
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Dr Lara Dungan takes a look at the technologies that could enable us to eliminate fossil fuels and pollution while growing our economy and improving our lifestyles. From electric cars to ocean energy and new solar panels.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Eating away at the plants of farmers and gardners, we stumble upon a very hungry caterpillar. He tells us that even though he's soft and slow, he can survive using his bright colors and 4000 muscles.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Five is so good at hide and seek, she can find the others without looking up from her book - but how? Learn how to add to five with the Numberblocks.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil tries to make the strongest electromagnet he can. Plus: playing with ferro-fluid. Wizards! And Phil tries to make it to the North Pole using a compass.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 Children of the Revolution
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Over one week in September 2019, more than 7.6 million people across the world walked out of schools in the biggest coordinated climate action effort ever recorded. But why are kids missing school and will it change anything?

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: When Tess was 14 years of age she won the APEX Teenage Fashion Awards for her wearable art piece: a pom-pom dress that she made from 1784 individually-constructed pom-poms and hula-hoops. It was her MY:24.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Will people in China turn to a new generation of wine-makers?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: When you think of wine, you probably don’t think of China. But now a new generation of wine-makers are fast putting China’s wine on the map. Can they convince people in China to drink it? Brendan Wan has the story.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Yangshuo lies on the Li River. Local farmers access the markets via the river.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie is always giving presents to her friends. So they decide they should do something to show how grateful they are by organising a special present for Squidgie.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Robert doesn't want to take a bath his father decides to also never wash again. Pooh!

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a TV Presenter.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What is China's role in the Ukraine conflict?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: The recent Beijing Olympics saw a full display of the close relationship between Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping - but the history of the relationship is full of contradictions.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This special is all about climate change. We take a look at what net zero emissions are and learn more about the controversial fuel source, coal. We also see how climate change is affecting kids living in the Pacific.

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Why Borrowing can Cost you More
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: Planning to get rich quick by investing one day? Before you jump in, let Gen Fricker explain some of the risks involved with different types of investments.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: New generation of feminists in China
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Feminist movements have been facing unprecedented crackdowns in recent years, but there are more Chinese women who'd call themselves feminists now than ever before.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This Threatened Species special looks at plants that are in trouble and the impact the Black Summer bushfires had on koalas. Plus we learn more about the importance of frogs.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Follows Holly McKew, who was left with bald patches when she was burned by a chip pan when she was a toddler. The 12-year-old prepares for her biggest operation to date and meets other youngsters with visible scars at a camp.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: A vase is more than just a flower-holder - it's a piece of art! Make a marble effect with a few different colours and personalise as you wish!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode, Maddie learns what happens to food in our bodies when we eat it and why it's important to eat a variety of different foods from different food groups.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine deal with some problems after their meals are served.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: In this Fierce Earth special, Clare and Leo head to Death Valley in California which is officially the hottest place in the entire world, with record-breaking temperatures of a sizzling 57 degrees centigrade.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Exercise your creativity by designing and decorating your own exercise book! An important tool in going back to school, ABC ME will show you how to personalise yours!

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: When taking part in a fun run, Lily gets tired. In a show of determination, she keeps going and ends up with a magical reward!

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Take a moment to appreciate nature all around you.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Documentary following 13-year-old Kim and seven-year-old Dan, who both have alopecia, as they go to a summer camp that aims to boost their confidence.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Te Rautawhiri travels to school through the city of Christchurch, which is rebuilding itself after an earthquake.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: A big hairy monster with a big hairy tummy who loves puzzles? Find out who is in Big Tum's tum!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out about repeating patterns. She visits a butterfly sanctuary to learn how the life cycle of a butterfly works.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Acids And Bases: The Voyage Of The Proton
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Whether it is manipulating the pH of the soil to control the color of hydrangea flowers or meticulously controlling ingredients to bake the perfect pastry, acid-base chemistry is all around us.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: In Cologne Germany, Finya loves to ride her skateboard to school and feel the wind in her hair. She travels through an industrial area, where large trucks pass by all day.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 2 The Battle Continues Part 2
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig Reucassel examines the growing e-waste problem, fast furniture and continuing the #StrawNoMore movement, takes his new straw mascot, McChokey, to a fast food giant.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Hush, hush! Agent Fifteen is here with a smashing new way to save the day: the Super Special Secret Step Squad!

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: The fruit of the majestic Bunya Pine has been an important part of indigenous culture for thousands of years. Today many landowners consider it dangerous and garden waste but an Indigenous artist believes it deserves better.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is making glue for a papier-mache ball. Thinking that Possum might like to help, she goes to get him but finds he is stuck after eating sticky honey all night.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Code like a bee. The waggle dance is a nature code that bees know. Learn the code to find the flowers.

description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: Karen Pang joins her friends on the Story Time couch to share a delightful & entertaining peek into the life of one very busy wombat! Don't miss Jackie French & illustrator Bruce Whatleys "Diary Of A Wombat" in Cantonese!

description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths

description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: 3, 2, 1... Lift-off! Chemical reactions! A small step for humans, giant leaps for science! Eric creates a miniature rocket engine. It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Vietnam, Truc is helping out at her grandma's market stall in Russia Liza is learning how to go fishing and catching her first fish. And in Canada, Rhys is helping his dad make their favourite supper - meatballs.

title: So You Want To Be A Designer?
series: So You Want To Be A Designer?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Designing For The User
description: See how designers create products that meet user need and are inclusive. We see how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs, and respond to the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: How do designers create products for user needs and are inclusive? Two examples show how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs. And the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design.

description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Order is important! Eric learns about th e coded instructions that make computers and robots work! It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Travel back in time thousands of years ago with Eric to ancient Egypt! Discover and demystify a secret multiplication system. It's not magic...it's math!

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Rachael is feeling 'Lonely' but she soon realises it's her differences that makes her special.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: Stefan explores the maths of scientific discovery using concentrations in standard form, cumulative frequency graphs and interpreting longitudinal data in a unique trial of fungus at Swansea University.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Angel, Hamza and Liza. Makes a Birthday Cake
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Peru, Angel is practising on his favourite instrument in Accra, the capital of Jordan, Hamza is studying maths and playing football. And in Russia, Liza and her twin brother Styopa are helping to bake an apple cake.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Discover a new word to use for twinkle.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Is Image More Important Than The Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What goes into the making of a pop star? We look at music's relationship with image, get the low-down from music industry insiders, and film a music video for our 'hit song' from Episode 7.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Can you follow directions and read a map? If the answer is yes, then the treasure could be yours!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Meet the man trying to bring 60 Afghans to safety in Australia
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: As the situation continues to deteriorate in Kabul, one Victorian farmer offers to sponsor 60 Afghans to come to Australia. But with no response to visa applications, his contacts have been left in a dangerous limbo. Charmayne Allison reports.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza wonders how people do math with numbers so big they take 95 years just to say out loud. And how do you measure something too small to even see? To find out the investigators will make their own solar system.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: Inside the painting she explores Rousseau's use of imagination in painting, the techniques Rousseau used and his placement within the artistic world in Paris during his lifetime and his influence on the art world since.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a jazz-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: When you're writing a formal letter or email, what should you include in it? And what sort of phrases and words can you use? Pick up some tips in our latest episode of Everyday English.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: We often find ourselves in situations where we meet new people and want to make friends. What do you say in such a situation? How can you find out more about your new friends? Jack and Sarah explain how in the latest episode.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments around osmosis in the process of pickling food playing with foregrounds to use forced perspective in photo illusions the classic Erdnase Change card trick and lots more!

description2: This resource provides numerous examples of commercial production methods and systems, including job, batch, quantity/mass production and JIT. It includes examples of both hand and digitized pattern laying.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: The right moment...take the picture now, Mati! Learn how to do a perfect composition with a camera is something easy with Dorothea beside you.

title: Stargazing Live

description2: Can Australia change the known age of the universe? Join Brian Cox and Julia Zemiro to find out as Stargazing Live concludes.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!

title: Mini Lessons
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Learn about three different types of transformations and line symmetry. Ms Szalek demonstrates translation and rotation, and encourages you to make some dance moves. She then explains reflection and line symmetry.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, bathe, cook, and clean their houses in the 1900s? Step back in time to see what daily life was like without electricity, hot running water and with an outdoor bathroom!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: One day Bop sees the most beautiful butterfly in Hoopla, but when he catches it, it begins to look sad. He asks his friends to help cheer up the butterfly.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a large gray-skinned fish with an elongated body and a fin on the back. You have several rows of sharp teeth. If you lose one, don't panic it's the back tooth that takes its place.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: Angie, Eddie and Mia design their very own clubhouse, only to discover that shapes are hidden everywhere! Can you find the triangle, square and rectangle?

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Maddison won't allow autism to define who she is or her future.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Little Bat has never flown before and is very nervous but her mother and friends help her realise that there's nothing to be scared about afterall.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: We are in the arid and desert landscapes to meet the camel! I recognise you right away thanks to your funny bump on your back! Your bump, or your bumps, by the way? Some have two, and others, only one.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Two wallabies criss-cross the country and bring many places and plants into being. But one has to look for a new companion after the other is swept away in a flood.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Heights of third graders in one class. Quality scores for circuit boards at a factory. Taking multiple samples allows us to visualise the sampling distribution of the sample mean.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Hey! What happened to the ice in Possum's drink? Is this another case for Police Officer Possum? Or does Possum need to learn more about how things change?

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In the early 1900s, teenage Afghan Aboriginal cameleer, William Satour, guided his father's camel train through some of Australia's toughest country. Can Ezekiel and Nathaniel deliver their cargo safely and on time?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Things get totally out of hand at a Square Club meeting - until a certain someone arrives to save the day.

title: What Makes Me Me?
episode_name: Series 1 Why Should I Be Good?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer Why should i be good?

title: Managing Populations
description: A series looking at two case studies into the causes, impacts and challenges presented by large youthful populations in the Gambia, and a large ageing population in the UK. Stage 5 Geography
description2: Examines the issues surrounding an ageing population in the UK, using East Devon as a case study, illustrating the causes, impacts and management of the UK's ageing population and changing dependency ration.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Stump your friends with an amazing stick maze.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: With so many paintings on jungles and forests, Rousseau should have been a tireless traveler! Mati and Dada go and visit him in Paris and soon discover the truth!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Dallas Reedman is a presenter and TV host on ABC ME. He has some great advice about fostering your creativity and how to stay focussed!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Come on out at night and meet a centipede, the oldest land animal in the world. Even though she's eaten by both humans and animals, the centipede uses her hard shell, speed, and 20 to 300 feet to try and keep out of trouble.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum loves to study things carefully. Sometimes things are small and hard to see. What a difference a magnifying glass can make!

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Julian Savulescu and Serene Khader discuss the effect of social assumptions on how we view our body, and the science we use to change it.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Twelve-year-old Chelsea saw the Teenage Boss experiment as a once in a lifetime opportunity to buy as much junk food as possible, so her first grocery shop does not go down well with the family.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Determined country girl, Molly, is keeping a tight budget, when a large bill to fix the brakes on the horse float comes in, so she decides to earn some money making the horse treats she's famous for.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Super-speedy Eighteen discovers a faster way to add a number together lots of times.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You're the LARGEST of the monkeys! A giant with a broad chest and very muscular arms! You're quite a gentle, peaceful animal... well, most of the time!

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Little J and Big Cuz are worried when Old Dog goes missing. Surely with Uncle Mick they'll find him. Meanwhile, cheeky Old Dog is safe and sound - causing havoc in Big Cuz's bed! Spoken in the Indigenous language of Gija.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are an animal of the forest you need tall trees that you can build your nest in, and most important, you run from branch to branch, making extraordinary leaps! Your cozy nest is called a drey.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Just how much power can be generated by one human being? Phil tries to find out. Plus: How a generator works, make your own wind turbine and a solar panel described with a bathtub and ping-pong balls!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Innovation helps stop farm run-off into the Great Barrier Reef
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Technology that's used to stop farm run-off into the Great Barrier Reef is now being trialled on the NSW mid north coast.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Mimi is so tired she needs a holiday but can't decide where to go. So her friends take her on three pretend holidays to help her choose.

title: Minibeast Heroes
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: These tiny but mighty bugs have a huge impact on our planet! Each minibeast hero has an amazing superpower. Learn fun facts and discover the importance of these cool little invertebrates to our survival on the planet.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil gives himself super strength using the power of simple machines to move, lift and roll a machine he could barely budge otherwise. Plus, lift yourself with one finger and watch cavemen discover the wheel.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: You can make one word out of two. They're called compound words and Zoey wrote a song all about them. Abracadabra, let the song begin!

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Katya reviews 'Friday Barnes, Girl Detective' by R A Spratt.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Five and friends discover a hole that makes their heads fall off! Learn how to count up and down and how to add to five with the Numberblocks.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Three arrives with a bang and a song-and-dance about her favourite number: 1, 2, 3, Everybody Look at Me! Learn all about the number 3 with Numberblock Three.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey sings a song all about apostrophes. An apostrophe is something really small that packs a big punch. It's so mighty it can even replace letters in some of your favourite words.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Leah Purcell is an actress, director and playwright, who never fitted into the mould of a perfect 12 year old.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Years 1-2: Writing an Explanation Text
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to write a type of explanation text about the life cycle of a caterpillar. Alex demonstrates the important features of writing a life cycle diagram.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop's job is to wind the town clock before everyone wakes up. He decides to move the clock forward so his friends wake up earlier and morning tea will be earlier, but everyone in Hoopla relies on the clock being on time.

title: Minibeast Heroes
episode_name: Series 1 Meet The Predator: Redback Spider
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing superpower. Learn fun facts by visiting the lair of a minibeast who seems like a monster, but has an essential role in our ecosystems.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally prefers to grow her own carrots when she can. She decides to plant some carrots in her garden and Possum comes to help. But what are these? "The smallest carrots in the world!".

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Chemistry is all about the tiny ingredients that make up everything! We use chemistry to bake cakes and cook dinner, or when we take a bath and mix soap and water together to make bubbles.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Kelli Jean Drinkwater is a filmmaker, artist and activist. Her work focuses on body positivity.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 28 Solid As A Liquid
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric discovers that a liquid can also be a solid and explores the phenomenon called Oobleck. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine realise they have no money to pay the bill. In order to settle the tab they must work in the bistro.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Ukraine Refugees, Flood Clean-Up, Women's History Month, Humpback Comeback and Aussie Astronaut.

title: Mumbai - Inside Dharavi
description: Travel inside India's biggest slum and see what it's really like to live and work there. Stage 5 Geography, History
description2: Travel inside India's biggest slum and see what it's really like to live and work there. Stage 5 Geography, History

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Drinking Water
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a reservoir which collects water from our homes, natural springs and the rain.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Think...and think hard! Eric discovers how neurons transmit information between themselves and his brain. It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Joanne O'Riordan was born without any limbs. Never one to refuse a challenge, she agreed to help the British Olympic bobsleigh team in their campaign to get the sport into the Paralympics.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua, Amalia and Nayan discover India is huge, more than ten times the size of the UK. Their first challenge is to explore Patna, the capital of Bihar in north-eastern India. It has a population of nearly two million people.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: At the bottom of the river we meet the Catfish who, with his bony, flat head, is a very successful bottom feeder.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Tonight, Sally is throwing a party. Possum is outside doing exercises with his stretchy resistance band. Sally helps Possum with his workout and explains what stretchy means.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team investigates wildfires. We travel to Colorado and meet one of the youngest female fire fighters in the US, who has tackled wildfires head on after her house and part of her neighbourhood was burnt down.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Are you sitting comfortably? Then we'll begin a bedtime story all about Numberblocks Eleven to Fifteen.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: To is a little scallywag who seems to be shy. He is a smart boy, he wants to become a policeman. To get to school it takes him two hours by foot, boat and tuktuk-bus.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word INTO. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Conductor.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One makes a wish that the magic mirror could make lots of friends at once - and pretty soon it's pandemonium.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Lijiang is situated in the shadow of the foothills of the Himalayas, and a magnet for tourists.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: An underage French schoolboy is full of patriotic enthusiasm at the start of the war. Against the will of his parents he signs up. His romantic dreams of honour soon give way to disillusionment with modern warfare.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Eva is already an orphan when she arrives in the Auschwitz concentration camp. She hopes to find friends there from the Theresienstadt children's choir. Miraculously, she finds Renata, but the former soprano is very ill.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Solar Panel
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a solar panel farm. She uses her special thermal camera to help us see how the solar panel cells collect the sun's energy.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SHOP. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Matter And The Rise Of Atomic Theory: The Art Of The Meticulous
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: This unit explores how chemistry evolved from adapting materials for practical purposes to a science that systematically offers solutions to the world's challenges.

title: Smart Materials
description: With extraordinary access to the latest research and development, the show explores cutting edge smart materials finding out how they are made, how they work and what their potential applications are now and in the future. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: This episode examines the properties, characteristics & applications of some of the smart materials used in the graphics industry. Including labels & packaging that use thermochromic inks, emergency & safety signage & more.

title: Play School Story Time: Languages
description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: ABC News presenter Kumi Taguchi swaps the news desk for the Story Time couch to read Jackie French and illustrator, Bruce Whatley's beloved story about Pamela the cow in "Too Many Pears" in Japanese!

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 What is Compound Interest?
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: Compound interest will be one of the most important things you ever learn. Don't believe it? Gen Fricker will explain why. Learn how compound interest works and why saving now can help you later.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a pottery to find out how mugs are made from clay. We see the big lumps of clay being shaped into a mug shape by a fast-spinning machine.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is looking at useful lights. She shows us how traffic lights work so that vehicles can safely travel through a road junction.

title: Back Roads Kids
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Where Is Violet Town?
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Violet Town is in rural Victoria. It's a small town with friendly people, but the locals tell us there are lots of snakes!

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 3 The Battle Continues Part 3
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: In the final episode, Craig Reucassel goes undercover in a food court to see how much food is being thrown out and explains the big role restaurants, cafes and fast food outlets have in reducing food waste.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: In this special we look at the events that led up to WWII, find out about Australia's involvement and learn about the bombing of Darwin. We meet some people who share their memories and take a look at the impact WWII had.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Is China's 'Zero COVID' policy cracking under Omicron? Plus the ban on binge-eating, a look back at China's rich musical history and why women are angry about being told to make more babies. Presented by Stan Grant.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Wacky Scientist Petri Dishes
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make scientifically spectacular petri dishes filled with fresh fruit juice jelly, all while learning about fractions. Then you can decorate your petri dishes with 'germs'!

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 The Metallic World: Electrochemistry And Coordination Compounds
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Metals often play a key role in redox reactions, which are essential to all aspects of chemistry, particularly in many biochemical processes.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get my job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. And in this episode we meet a Florist who shares a bunch of tips!

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Once upon a time there lived an inch high boy who dreamed of becoming a warrior.

title: Atom Bond
episode_name: Series 1 The Atom With The Golden Electron
description: Shrouded in the mysterious world of espionage, Agent Gold is on a mission exploring the complex world of chemical bonds. This reimagining of a classic animation takes a comprehensive look at covalent, ionic and metallic bonding. Secondary Science.
description2: Agent Gold is assigned to investigate Project D, headed by Carbon who has trained millions of atoms to develop this plan. Together with Oxygen and Fluorine, Gold penetrates Carbon's secret school and finds atoms being drilled.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Learn how to enjoy the things you find difficult.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Researchers and volunteers swing into action to save turtle numbers
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Researchers and volunteers in north-east Victoria are swinging into action to save turtle numbers decimated by foxes over the last decade. Katherine Smyrk reports.

title: Desertification: Causes, Impacts and Management
description: Yahya's nomadic family has been forced off their land on the fringes of the Sahara, because of desertification. Through his story, the impacts of desertification and its causes are looked at. Stages 4-5 Geography
description2: Yahya's nomadic family has been forced off their land on the fringes of the Sahara, because of desertification. Through his story, the impacts of desertification and its causes are looked at. Stages 4-5 Geography

title: Mini Lessons: Science Secondary
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn about how particles behave when they are exposed to higher temperatures. Diana will conduct experiments to show you how a gas, liquid and solid behave differently when they are heated.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: Global Citizenship is the topic of this BTN special. We meet some kids taking part in the World Peace Games, find out more about the history of the UN and learn about the important work the World Food Programme does.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 On the Water Front
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Ireland is home to over 70 thousand kilometres of rivers and over 12 thousand lakes famous worldwide for their beauty, set in the most spectacular natural landscapes. But are people taking this priceless resource for granted?

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
