description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: What do you do if you don't have any green paint? Eric learns how to make the colour green by combining blue and yellow. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Eat your next meal off your own homemade bowl and plate courtesy of ABC ME! We will show you how to easily make them out of clay!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Get creative and create these cute reptiles from clay!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode uses a fixed set of computational steps that use simple arithmetic and basic algebraic conventions (e.g., doubling expressions to generate a known solution).

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Billy Hughes.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 The Era of the Air Pump
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: The Era of the Air Pump. In this STEM episode Eric makes a bottle rocket and uses a bicycle pump to transfer his own body's energy into it. Watch it launch high into the air! It's not magic, it's science.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Charlotte is thinking about taking up a course and discusses her options with her local school counsellor.

title: Physics House
episode_name: Series 1 Why Has My Tea Gone Cold?
description: Join Yanick in the Physics House to take a look at the physics behind everyday phenomena we encounter in our homes.
description2: Why does a glass of ice heat up while a mug of tea cools down? What's making them change temperature? Can Yanick figure out the physics behind heat transfer before his morning tea is a lukewarm disappointment?

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Harold Holt.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Years F-1: Worded Problems with Addition and Subtraction
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss James needs your detective skills to solve some addition and subtraction problems. Look for clue words that will help you to decide if you should add or subtract.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Put heads together to figure out this experiment: we are approximately eight of our own heads tall. It's not magic...it's magic!

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 15 Years 3-4: Partitioning Numbers Using Efficient Strategies
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, you will continue to partition numbers in standard and non-standard ways. You'll also explore how the same problem can be solved in many ways.

title: Convict Kids
description: Australia was a British penal colony between 1788 and 1868 and over 160,000 convicts were 'transported' here. Learn about these child convicts, why they were transported, how they lived in the colony and what became of them.
description2: In 18th and early 19th century Britain, transportation as a form of punishment was used to combat the over-crowded prisons. Children as young as seven could be tried as adults and sent to Australia as convicts.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Inspired by all the cool books they read at the library, Zoey and Lukas decide to write their own stories, casting themselves as superheroes.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Indigenous family builds business around a Cape York mine
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: On remote western Cape York peninsula, an Indigenous family business is forging its own economic future. Charlie McKillop reports.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 31 What Do They Have in Common?
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava creates a Venn diagram with different categories to help her class choose a new pet!

title: What Is Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What parts of the body get used when a singer belts out a tune? We go to a voice lab to find out and some professional vocalists play some singing roulette.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What journalism in China is really like
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: If you live in China, what does the media actually look like? Jinghua Qian looks at journalism is like when your government is in charge of what’s written, and monitors everything that’s said.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Zoey and Lukas conquer the question of why English has so many words from the Viking language Old Norse, as well as other languages.

title: Numberblocks
episode_name: We're Going On A Square Hunt
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The squares explore an ancient temple in search of a really, really big square.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: The Case Of The Missing Potatoes
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum helped Sally dig up some potatoes, but when he goes to bring them inside, they are not there! This is a case for police officer Possum! Surely, it couldn't be anything to do with what Sally is cooking!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Letter J jumps right into your ear.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Our expert is here to show you a handy trick to hide the hair tie in your ponytail!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Amanda brings a trunk full of wonderful things to dress up in. Sally and Possum have a great time trying on lots of different outfits. Their friends arrive to watch the big show they stage with their costumes.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Ken Thaiday Snr is a Torres Strait Island artist renowned for his dance headdresses. Inspired by Darnley island culture, his artworks are often larger than life and mobile. Join him as he prepares to ride his latest creation.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Just coming out of her cocoon, is a beautiful butterfly. She tells us that while she may have once been an ugly caterpillar, she now has bright and colourful wings.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actor Alexander Vlahos reads extracts from 'Refugee Boy' by Benjamin Zephaniah, explaining why he loves the book, how it captured his imagination, and why he loves to read.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava just got a new protractor and she's going to measure every angle she can find!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Discover a simple and speedy school hairstyle that's perfect for short or long hair!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word OUT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Attention to dimension! Ava is going to build the best fort ever!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word BIG. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Saya utilises the resources of the eco village where she lives to save money, and her budget is tracking well until Mum brings home a welcome - but expensive surprise!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word IF. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Timothy from Doubtful Creek, NSW
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Tim wants to follow in his dad's footsteps and keep their farming legacy alive.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Everybody hates mosquitos, but this mosquito tells us she loves humans, and their blood! As a mummy she needs the blood to help her babies, so she's gotta get it from humans, horses, and cows.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a small and furry animal, and you get around on all fours. But the moment you stop walking, you stand up straight and tall on your hind legs. Then, you scan the horizon to make sure that everything is nice and safe...

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Letter Z zips and zooms.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How China keeps control of its people’s social media
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: The ‘Great Firewall’ is a technological barrier to parts of the internet the state fears – Angharad Yeo takes a look.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: A noun is a word for a person, place or thing and there are two kinds: common nouns and proper nouns. Zoey sings all about them.

title: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
series: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
episode_name: Series 1 Tia, T-Shirt, Billy Jeans And Jerry The Jumper
description: It's the not-so-trashy reality show that takes well-known recyclables where they belong! Follow brave recyclables such as Bernie the Banana, Billie Jeans, and Baxter Bottle on their very different journeys of transformation. Stages 2-4 Science, Geography.
description2: These best friends can't wait to be on I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here where they experience different journeys all with the same goal - to find new purpose.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 All Down the Number Line
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Its the School Footy Match this week! Big Cuz reluctantly agrees to be the commentator, while Little J boasts hell kick twenty goals. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Warlpiri.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Jango loses his new pet caterpillar and follows the trail of eaten leaves, vegetables and fruit. He must find him before the others realise his pet has caused all the damage, but Detective Ziggy is close behind.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Lane Cove Public: Reusable T-Shirt Bags
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig visits the inspiring kids at Sydney's Lane Cove Public who are tackling waste in their community.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to identify and use pronouns and nouns. Ms Sheddan demonstrates how to recognise pronouns and nouns in a book and how to use pronouns to replace nouns when writing.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 18 How the Upper Case Lives
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Capital letters are a little snobby, but they are really important. It's sort of tricky knowing when to use them, but Zoey wrote a song to help clear it up.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Ed loves pyramids, but there are lots of other interesting shapes. Let's look at a few of the best.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Number 10 is what we're hoping to see.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word OF. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Year 2: Writing a Non-Fiction Text
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to write a type of non-fiction text about an animal. Mr Meissner demonstrates the important features of writing a factual animal text.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Solid, Liquid, Gas and all things in-between. Phil fills a giant trough with corn starch mud to see if it's solid enough to run across. Plus, makes a giant sledgehammer out of a frozen pumpkin and giant rock candy.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What’s life like for people with disability in China?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: More than 85 million people are estimated to live with a disability in China. For many a culture of shame and stigma persists. Annie Louey looks at some ways that may be changing.

title: Create
episode_name: Indigenous Art Experiences - Grinding and Painting Ochre
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Learn how to grind and paint with a natural earth pigment.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Why is China cracking down on its billionaires?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Beijing has wiped off more than $1 trillion from its biggest tech companies – apparently to bridge the gap between rich and poor.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make a brilliant blue sky with your paints even if the weather outside is terrible!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Georgie Stone is a transgender student, who focuses her activism on changing laws for young transgender people.

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Ramadan: Break-Fast At Mobinah's
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Ramadan is the most important event on the Islamic calendar. Follow two local families to see how this month of fasting and feasting is practiced in Australia. Students will learn about the motivation, meaning and challenges.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: This is the tallest Possum we know. Why does he want to be taller? And why does Sally think that Amanda may have a special way of helping him?

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet the largest and loudest creature in the sea The Blue Whale. Although they're as large as 3 buses and can live for up to 90 years, they're still endangered.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Watch as our artist cleverly turns a simple piece of paper into a chomping chatterbox!

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Alisha is a nine-year-old girl with asthma. She talks about how it affects her life and the things she finds difficult. Alisha's asthma is a serious medical condition and an attack can be fatal.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Join Maddie as she learns about growing and cooking the food we eat.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word School. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Join us for a fantastic Greek Cypriot feast with Elias and his family! Warning - there's a lot of cheese involved and a traditional dinner game at stake!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Chido Govera is an activist, entrepreneur, and mushroom farmer from Zimbabwe who has very inspiring words if you want to change the world.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 31 May The Force Be With You
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric uses static electricity to move an object, without even touching it! It's not magic, it's science!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Gave. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 5 The Fall of Constantinople - 29 May 1453
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The fall of Constantinople marked the end of the Byzantine Empire - a power descending from none other than ancient Rome. Its symbolism has long since transcended its actual significance.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In this episode Crab sideways walks in to tell us that there are nearly four thousand species of crab like him coming from far and wide and living in both the water and on land.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mo is struggling with defining his identity: can he like more than one thing at a time? Meanwhile, Mikki needs to investigate what identity really means because the office is way too chilly thanks to Mo's new ice-cold look.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Book Report by Emily
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Emily is a big fan of 'Blink and You Die' from the Ruby Redfort series by Lauren Child.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric is tangled up with what seems to be a never - ending challenge. How will he make a set of linking rings from one strip of paper?

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: 1492 was officially the year the Americas were 'discovered', marking the end of the Middle Ages. Yet it's possible that Christopher Columbus setting foot on a West Indian beach in October obscures a far more complex story.

title: Author Talk: Leigh Hobbs
description: Meet award-winning author Leigh Hobbs in this interview presented by Sydney Opera House. Hear about his process, how he creates characters, and his illustrations, with questions from school students across the country. Stages 2-4 English, Art.
description2: Meet award-winning author Leigh Hobbs in this interview presented by Sydney Opera House. Hear about his process, how he creates characters, and his illustrations, with questions from school students across the country. Stages 2-4 English, Art.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric figures out who sent him an invitation by analysing its ink. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Gough Whitlam.

title: Many Lands, Many Seasons
description: This series explores six Aboriginal seasonal calendars to find out how the unique knowledge they contain helps the traditional owners to hunt, fish and collect bush tucker at the best time!
description2: Host Rulla Kelly-Mansell heads to the Community of Gunbalanya in West Arnhem Land to learn about the Kunwinjku Seasons calendar and gets stuck into some delicious bush tucker.

title: Back Roads Kids
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Where Is Pine Creek?
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Pine Creek is in the Northern Territory. The locals like the peace and quiet, and enjoy swimming and fishing.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Leiden reviews 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' by Douglas Adams.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Did you know you have millions of microbes on your hands? In this STEM episode Eric discovers how microbes travel from one object to another and how important hand washing is to prevent the spread of germs.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: One-legged pirates Patch and Jolly Joan Jellybean learn how to skate, in a funny way.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric is a master of illusions! Here he shows us how to create an optical illusion, drawing straight lines to make up a curve. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to represent Australia.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Sometimes, when you can't seem to solve a problem, you have to get creative. Eric reads a fable to get some inspiration on how to look at a problem from another angle. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville meet Hattie's toddler sister, Cappie, who starts inadvertently casting spells, putting Hattie to sleep. Can they keep the magical mayhem to a minimum and safely watch over Cappie until Hattie wakes up?

title: Create
episode_name: Back To School: Pencil Case Decoration: Tassel
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make your pencil case a bit more fancy by creating your own tassel decoration! With only a few materials needed, it's easy to make one for every day of the school week!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: What are your dreams and how are you achieving them? What about your goals? If you have some goals in mind, learn how to talk about them in this episode of Everyday English.

title: Mixed Up Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 The Giraffe Ate My Homework
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: In the time you spend thinking up excuses why you didn't do your homework...you could probably just do your homework.

title: Create
episode_name: Valentine's Day: Message In A Bottle
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: ABC ME will make sure your valentine receives their message from you by showing how to protect it within a bottle that also doubles as a colourful decoration!

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: At Easter time, Willow is very excited to eat her chocolate eggs, but when she does something she was asked not to, she learns the importance of honesty.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Slime is made of polymers, which are long chains of molecules that explain how many things are made. From plastics, to fabrics to our own DNA, polymers are everywhere. And we have a lot of them contained in a tub of slime.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Line Painting' by Yinka Shonibare MBE. Inside the painting she explores Sonibare's concept of multiculturalism and his work as a conceptual artist.

title: Bug Technology
description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: The mosquito. This pesky bug is able to suck blood so painlessly its victims don't even notice. Engineers have harnessed the mosquito's technology to design a cutting-edge hypodermic needle.

title: What Is Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What parts of the body get used when a singer belts out a tune? We go to a voice lab to find out and some professional vocalists play some singing roulette.

title: English On The Go
episode_name: Episode 2 Stationary vs Stationery, Principal vs Principle
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Spelling certain English words differently can alter the meaning of a sentence completely. In this video, we look at the spelling and corresponding meanings of a and e words in English.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada find themselves in Paris, during a dance lesson and meet there Degas, while he is sketching live ballerinas for his paintings.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Do You Need To Read Music To Play It?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: NO. But what's the deal behind those squiggles? We try to learn to read basic sheet music in 90 seconds and we trace the evolution of music notation.

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: Get to know a bit more about the amazing building that is Parliament House in Canberra. Your host Annabel Crabb's favourite bits of the building are the very top and the very bottom. Come and see why!

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: David Harewood discusses William Shakespeare's Othello with Adrian Lester, Simon Russell Beale, Ian McKellen, Julia Stiles and Patrick Stewart.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: How wonderful is Rome! And how amazing is having a guide like Apollodoro of Damascus explaining the ingenious architecture of Pantheon!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word PACK. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Sai is an aspiring brain surgeon. She travels to school on the subway in New York, and tells us about the challenges of living in a big city.

title: Water Wisdom
description: Fresh water systems are fundamental to Australia's first people who have nurtured a deep understanding of water. The Water Wisdom series shares this knowledge through the voice of Aboriginal communities.
description2: This episode of the Water Wisdom series shares the knowledge of fresh water systems through the voice of the Barngarla people who have managed water on the Eyre Peninsula for thousands of years.

title: Seeking Refuge
episode_name: Series 1 From A To B And Back Again
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: After settling in the UK and normal childhood, Rachel was suddenly deported back to her country.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Why image quality rhymes with numbers of pixels, and what is a pixel?

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 8 Science Years 3-4: Solid to Liquid
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Explore the change from a solid substance to a liquid. Using chocolates, Mrs Bhardwaj shows you how to plan a fair test to investigate how long it takes for different kinds of chocolate to begin melting.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Can a foreigner make it in China's stand-up comedy scene? Comedian Annie Louey takes a look.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How is it Made? Watering Can
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a factory where watering cans are made. We learn how a watering can starts out as lots of flat metal shapes.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Hmm. Sally is baking a pie for Skip and a friend to share. Is there going to be a piece for Possum, too? Possum will have to learn some more about fractions.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 28 Inference For Two-Way Tables
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Host Dr. Pardis Sabeti's own research examines possible genetic resistance to deadly Lassa fever in West Africa. Using Inference for Two-Way Tables helps untangle potential relationships.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Cody, Napuru, Nangala and Sheila a little blue heeler, are Old Uncle Max's brave shipmates as they all set sail around the island's shore.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word BOOK. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: How do people consume news in the digital age? Lawrence and Charlotte discuss.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a radiator factory to find out how radiators are made to keep houses warm. We see how big flat sheets of metal of pressed to make grooves, like teeth.

title: Social Media Me
description: This three-part series follows three characters' experiences with identity and self-esteem, as they navigate social media and real world relationships.
description2: Social media is often criticised for having a negative impact on self-esteem but doesn't have to be that way. We look closely at how Jules, Nela and Marcus are affected by social media content and popular platforms.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show giving young people a chance to share their experiences in their own words - both good and challenging. In this episode we hear what it's like to have same-sex parents.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Paige Burton, Australia's Youth Ambassador to the United Nations, offers her 12 year old self some words of wisdom.

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Plants Around the World
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she learns why and how plants grow and survive in different climates.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1968 - Sofia is a spy for the yayas and she's determined to get rid of her brother Michaelis's Anglo girlfriend before he leaves for Vietnam.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Breathing new life into medical mask waste
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Used masks are contributing to a worldwide medical waste and pollution problem, which the WHO warns is threatening both human and environmental health. But one Taiwanese company has found a novel way to make use of them.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: A few fractions of a second are enough to have the result of a search on the internet or operate any software. Speed of calculation, relevance of keywords, what is the method to follow to build the right algorithm?

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 37 Remember Like an Elephant
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wrote a song about memory tricks to help remember things. You'll be smarter than an elephant now!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Journalist Virginia Trioli talks about not fitting the same mould as everyone else.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Clown Fish likes to live in a nice and clean home eating the scraps and looking after the children at least until it's their turn to replace the last female.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Bee attempts to tell a story about a hungry manatee but first has to learn how to make it interesting and avoid the story being boring, as the Pencil Pals learn the secret to a good story.

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
episode_name: Series 2 Bright Star By John Keats
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star Akala explores John Keats' poem 'Bright Star' with the poet Daljit Nagra. They discuss how the poem focuses on the transient nature of life and eternal nature of love.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The playful dolphin is one of the cleverist animals on the planet although they have to be really careful when they come up for air to stay out of the way of Humans.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza notices a pyramid of oranges at the grocery store and makes one in the studio. To find out why pyramids are so strong, we arm-wrestle with a crocodile and put a cheerleading stunt to the test.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 27 You Can Quote Me
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wrote a song about those squiggly punctuation marks called quotation marks.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: S is for skunk.

title: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
series: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
description: A young woman investigates Australia's remembrance and forgetting of WWI. Stage 5 History, English.
description2: What really happened at Gallipoli? On location at the Gallipoli Peninsula, Kate Aubusson re-examines the 1915 Campaign in context to the landscape and it's overall significance if WW1.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: To find out about symmetry and why we love it so much, we'll draw giant mystery pictures, get crazy with snowflakes and meet the famous Mona Lisa herself! Even Koolkatt gets in on the act by demonstrating rotational symmetry.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Let's identify the letter I.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate some of the products made from sustainable pine plantations.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: China's young people 'lying flat' to protest against tough work culture
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China's economic growth as come at a huge cost to its workers. But there's a growing movement among young people to reject the overwork culture: 'lying flat.'

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Sporting her brand new summer wings is the cicada. She's one of millions of these noisy little guys, coming out of the dirt for the summer. She thinks she's pretty devine.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Turning to tourism to protect Gippsland bush
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A group of East Gippsland locals is trying to find support for a tourism project to help save high value forest.

title: Create
episode_name: Trash To Treasure: Plastic Bottle Puppy Bank
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Take an everyday object and turn it into a little puppy bank that you can name, save your coins in, and enjoy!

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to beat Cancer.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Be careful! Stay away! This scorpion might not be able to see very well but that doesn't make her any less dangerous. She's got a stinger full of poison and some pretty scary pincers.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Hang on one second! Ava sings a song about the basic units of time.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava explores the many ways we use math on the field, in the pool, and more!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Coming now to a screen near you: the monster tale of a colossal creature who really, really likes bigger numbers.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word US. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Ten promises to take the others on a trip to the moon but blasts off on her own. How will they get there? Find out which pairs of numbers add to make ten with the Numberblocks.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Aliir Aliir is an AFL player from the Sydney Swans who remembers what it was like to still be learning English at 12-years-old, and how sport became his way of connecting with other kids.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: What can you fold besides towels and clothes? Where will Sally put her buttons? Possum, that folding is amazing!

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Isabel lives on a barge, where they still have an old compass. Isabel experiments with magnets.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Jefferson lives in the Atacama desert in Chile. Astronomers from all over the world visit his village. Jefferson wants to make his own telescope all to find out the following question: how can he see as far away as possible?

title: My Life
episode_name: Series 1 Marvellous Messy Minds A Survival Guide
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Following three children, Libby, Oliver and Ethan, to find out how their mental health affects their lives and how they are determined not to let it hold them back.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Davey, a stable boy working for the powerful Owen family, decides that the only way he can save his favourite horse from the tannery is to steal her and become a bushranger.

title: Fall In Love With Music
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: Viewers are asked to think about what are the most basic ingredients of music. Morton Subotnick's electronic music composition Silver Apples of the Moon is used to encourage speculation about what actually can be music.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: The Victorian winery going carbon neutral
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The winery offsets 95% of its emissions without buying carbon credits. Annie Brown reports.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for King Parrot  Billin Billin.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello my little Koala! You are an animal with grey fur  you really look like a stuffed toy with your furry ears and your funny hooked nose! I hear they sometimes call you the "Australian Sloth"  hmmm, I wonder why!

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: Is Art a load of rubbish? In this Art Blast it is! Rich and Matt look at artists who take discarded materials and then upcycle them into art. Hard rubbish must be like Christmas for these artists!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It was a grey day in the big city. One was wondering where her next case would come from when a square silhouette appeared at the door.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: There are lots of different ways to move. Who else comes to Possum School today? What will Sally's special lesson be about?

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Senna often helps her grandfather in his vehicle recycling company in the Netherlands. Senna starts to investigate the power of levers and pulleys among the old cars of her grandfather.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a pretty mammal, which is not very easy to observe, because you are very discreet! You live underground in a family burrow called a village, sometimes over a hundred years old!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally's sink is full of little bubbles and she is doing the dishes. She decides it would be fun to make bubbles with Possum but he is feeling sad today. Sally cheers Possum up, taking him on a hot air balloon ride!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SEE. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: Boxy is making an even number of toast slices... until Tri comes along and eats one!

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: The baby in mum's tummy is making mum "tired and sometimes a little cross". Teeny Tiny Stevies to the rescue! Let us help explain the excitement of having a new baby brother or sister on the way.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Every time Numberblock Nine hiccups, he falls to pieces - until the others find an unexpected cure.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What's behind China's crackdown on the LGBTQI+ movement?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China's government has been busy recently enforcing social change, including a crackdown on the LGBTQI+ movement. Is it homophobia, fear or activism – or a combination of both?

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Let's talk about Mood! Sometimes we feel up and sometimes we feel down. Did you know that recalling a happy memory can make you feel better straight away? Find out how the chemicals in our brains work to make this happen.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Visit the Boston Beanstalks club for tall people. Height is normally distributed and we can use membership cutoffs and population data to calculate z-scores.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Have you ever had hiccups? Join Bri and Dr Emma Beckett as they go on a hiccup hunt to find out where hiccups come from and why they happen.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Floating around from plant to plant is the very thirsty aphid. This little guy needs a special ingredient from plant juice to help him grow big and strong.

title: Rhymes And Songs
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Explore the beat and structure, and the use of a round through this well-known rhyme.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids undertake experiments in ferromagnetic materials in magnetic putty and how they are affected by magnetic fields, the relationship between buoyancy force and surface tension as explained by rubbish and lots more.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a factory where emergency warning lights are made using computer designs.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Deputy Head of Mission at the Chinese Embassy, Wang Xining, joins Stan Grant for an extended discussion about the Australia-China relationship, Uyghur populations, the detention of Yang Hengjun – and what he believes describes the 'China Dream'.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 3 Julius Caesar with Brian Cox
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Shakespeare's Julius Caesar is a play that upholds liberty against tyranny. But what is tyranny? And who decides? Shakespeare doesn't make it simple.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: In this episode we find out what it takes to become a school principal, with a little help from Marko.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Straight and true, this paper plane flies like an arrow. Follow the easy steps and this plane will stay in the air a long time!

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 When Chemicals Meet Water: The Properties Of Solutions
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Solutions are all around us, from the air we breathe to the steel frames of many buildings. Solution chemistry is behind the extraction of materials for a variety of applications, for example, making a great cup of coffee.

title: What's For Dinner? Lunar New Year
episode_name: What's For Dinner? Lunar New Year
description: Welcome to Penny's place for Lunar New Year! It starts with a race around the seafood markets for the freshest fish and veggies and ends with homemade dumplings, a colourful salad tossing tradition and some very cute dragons!
description2: Welcome to Penny's place for Lunar New Year! It starts with a race around the seafood markets for the freshest fish and veggies and ends with homemade dumplings, a colourful salad tossing tradition and some very cute dragons!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Probability is the mathematics of chance behaviour - and can help predict events such as the daily weather, or whether an asteroid will collide with Earth.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Anton wants to join the Hitler Youth like all his classmates, although his father is against it. Only when violence breaks out on Nov 9, 1938, and his friend seeks shelter, he sees what the Nazis are really capable of.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids test out experiments in the basics of forensic evidence collection playing with gallium, a metal with a low melting point how refraction in water can create a magnifying effect and much more.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: After losing her husband in the Great War, a French mother finds she can no longer cope with the family farm. She only manages to do so when a German prisoner-of-war is assigned to her as a labourer.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Mimi is making a beautiful apple pie for the picnic, but the apples keep disappearing. They look so delicious no-one can resist eating them. What will Mimi bake now without any apples?

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: In this episode the team travel 6000 miles to the country of Chile and the Atacama Desert - officially the driest place in the world. Leo skydives out of a plane to reveal why the air is so dry.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Frizzy and Neville talk about staying safe in pools and rivers, so you can enjoy an epic pool party.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati's quest to draw a horse properly leads her and Dada right into a shadow animation adventure with Paolo Uccello's famous painting "Sir George and the Dragon".

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn about the Hula

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet the Koi Fish swimming around a shallow pond cared for by Humans who want them for good fortune, but their good fortune won't save them from the cats and birds.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Zap sleeps in because his alarm clock is broken and none of his parcels get delivered. His friends all have a loud solution so that Zap won't sleep in ever again.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Three billy goats gruff want to cross a hungry troll's bridge, who will win?

title: Weirdy Rhymes
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
