description2: The Phland, a lonely creature with detachable bottoms, goes out for a lazy drift. However, when you're already feeling a little low, the last thing you need is a tickly cough.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A donkey and his friends want a home, but the only one they find is full of bad robbers.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Everyone forgets to water their plants from time to time and this little creation could be just what you need. This self-watering pot will make sure your plant never misses another drink!

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Who is Rene Magritte among all those men with bowler hats? And why is his Art so mysterious? A new intriguing puzzle to solve for our little Art heroes!

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a KPOP-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Physics House
episode_name: Series 1 Why Has My Tea Gone Cold?
description: Join Yanick in the Physics House to take a look at the physics behind everyday phenomena we encounter in our homes.
description2: Why does a glass of ice heat up while a mug of tea cools down? What's making them change temperature? Can Yanick figure out the physics behind heat transfer before his morning tea is a lukewarm disappointment?

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: Take a tour around a home in the 1950s. Where is the fridge, and what is an ice-box?! Why does the meat come wrapped in paper and string? And why did housework take so much longer than today?

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko wants to play on a fallen log but Bird and Dog are already having fun with it. Can Keeko come up with a way for them all to share the log?

title: Pip's Tips
episode_name: Series 2 What To Do If You're The Bully
description: Our very own Pip Rasmussen will give us her take on how to tackle everything in life - from bouncing back from online bullying, to bagging the best bargains when thrift shopping. If you need a tip, hit up Pip! Stages 2-4 PDHPE
description2: Ever been called a bully? Pip has some tips on what to do next.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: On this journey Dr Lara Dungan looks at the environment and health implications of different diets and tastes new replacements to meat and dairy products. Can this go mainstream?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is making a shopping list. When Possum drinks the last of Sally's milk he wonders where milk comes from. To find out, they watch as some real kids visit a dairy farm.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Socially aware Emelie has already set up an ethical sewing business using recycled materials, and now as Teenage Boss, her family are worried she'll give all their money to charity and make them go vegetarian for the month.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode targeted at the Primary maths curriculum, Stefan visits a huge hi-tech greenhouse in Kent to learn how much rain can be collected from a roof using ideas of conservation of volume and calculating area.

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: The news media can be a powerful force for good, but it doesn't always use it's power in the right way. That's why news organisations often have codes of ethics which journalists are expected to abide by.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Vibration is the idea behind a shaky vibrobot - one maxed out enough so Phil can ride it! Plus: spinning an 8-foot coin, suspending water in mid-air and lasers!

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: We look back at some important moments in the history of Indigenous Australians. We join the Freedom Ride 50 years after it hit the road, find out what happened at Wave Hill and why some people think there should be a treaty.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Big Cuz is excited - Nannas taking the class out bush to gather pandanus for weaving. But Nanna is called in to work so Big Cuz takes over, with comically chaotic results. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Djambarrpuyngu.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: Fran Scott and Greg Foot explain how drums work and make their different sounds.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Eva is already an orphan when she arrives in the Auschwitz concentration camp. She hopes to find friends there from the Theresienstadt children's choir. Miraculously, she finds Renata, but the former soprano is very ill.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Little J and Big Cuz are worried when Old Dog goes missing. Surely with Uncle Mick they'll find him. Meanwhile, cheeky Old Dog is safe and sound - causing havoc in Big Cuz's bed! Spoken in the Indigenous language of Noongar.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Christian Barry and Kate McDonald unwind supply chains to consider ethical consumption in a complex world.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: With a treasure trove of nature, explore patterns to celebrate the cycle of nature life.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop promises to build a giant robot but it's more difficult than he thought. Not wanting to disappoint his friends, Bop dresses up in a giant robot costume instead.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy wishes he was just like his favourite super-hero. So he makes himself a costume and goes to find someone to rescue in town.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: "Many" is for things you can count and "much" is for things that can't really be counted. Zoey has so much fun singing this song!

title: What Makes Me Me?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer What Makes Me Me?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Actor Hunter Page-Lochard has played many roles in film and tv, and gives his views on what bravery and being a man mean to him.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Chelsea is the only female fire service cadet in her town.

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: While sorting their toys, Abigail wants to hold on to a lot of things, especially Squeaky, who she's very sentimental over. Abigail gets Judy's help to clean up Squeaky while Davey works on a surprise.

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1912, 14 year old sailor Douglas Bull was awarded the rank of 'Ordinary Seaman' by his ship's Captain. Can Stella and Caitlin prove they have what it takes to match Douglas' achievement?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Journalist Stan Grant is a Wiradjuri/Kamilaroi man who explains the importance of asking questions and celebrating the future.

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2017 Ranim Alkharabeh: Mount Gambier, SA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Leaving the war in Syria for a beautiful life in Australia.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: It's a hard knock life for this daddy long legs, as he tells us from his hiding place about all the creatures trying to eat him. He can hide by sticking things onto himself, and even take his own legs off.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: International Tourism, Battery Recycling, Coping with COVID, Endangered Koalas and Shackleton's Endurance Expedition.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Raymond is growing fish in the outback to help keep his family together.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are one of the largest birds that's able to fly! Your large wings give you a very elegant look, but the first thing that I notice on you is your enormous beak! You hold the record for the bird with the longest beak!

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: From the smallest things like, tiny invisible atoms to the biggest things like the universe itself, physics helps us understand the building blocks of our everyday world.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Four is the new block on the block and he can't wait to share how much he loves to be square! Learn all about the number 4 with Numberblock Four.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Using a different brush can bring a new texture to your painting, let's see how it's done!

title: Minibeast Heroes
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: These tiny but mighty bugs have a huge impact on our planet! Each minibeast hero has an amazing superpower. Learn fun facts and discover the importance of these cool little invertebrates to our survival on the planet.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks make a new friend who likes to roll the dice, and with Six in the mix, everything's a game. Learn all about the number 6 with Numberblock Six!

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Mudskipper is determined to make sure everyone knows he is a fish. He show us how their bodies are designed for them to breath outside of the water and how their arms allow them to slip along the shore.

title: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
series: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
description: Tailored for a younger audience, these special classroom editions of YCAT provide unique insights into the lives of diverse Australians. Stage 5 Geography, English, PDHPE.
description2: What is it like to put your hand up, be elected and serve the nation in the House of Representatives or the Senate? In this special classroom edition of YCAT, eight former politicians go off-script and share their opinions.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: The pupils meet a local expert on rural life in India and learn how India's extreme climate can be hazardous for subsistence farmers due to drought and flooding.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: A majestic swan is only a few folds away thanks to our origami master!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet the earwig this guy likes to sleep all day and then eat things like rotting plants and insects. Don't worry, even though he's got big pincers he says he's not going to go through your ears to your brain any time soon.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Pop star, Dami Im was born in Korea, and went on to win X-Factor, and represent Australia at Eurovision.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Today Maddie's at sea! First, she visits a boating lake and uses her underwater cameras to find out how the hull of a boat is shaped to help it to float on the water.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Yassmin Abdel-Magied is a mechanical engineer, author, activist, and media commentator who never thought she would have achieved so much.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, Mrs Jegers teaches you how to recognise the figurative language of personification. She demonstrates how to visualise an object or animal by giving it a human characteristic.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to hear and identify syllables. Oliver demonstrates how to hear the beat in words and break up words into syllables to decode faster.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Hedayat Osyan is a former refugee from Afghanistan. He and his family were persecuted by the Taliban for belonging to the Hazara ethnic minority group so he escaped and eventually ended up in Australia.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Hmm. What will Possum choose for breakfast today? Sally says that he can't have everything and that he should try to be better at deciding what he wants. She suggests they make a menu to help him choose.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Giant Clam explains what they eat that help them to grow from being very tiny clams to giant ones. They also have a very effective defence mechanism that has helped them to live for up to 100 years.

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Comptine Pour Dessiner is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally and Possum enjoy a wonderful bush walk to learn more about other trees. Possum wants to collect some of the lovely leaves. Instead, they find a way of recreating their memories when they get home.

title: Mini Lessons
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn about probability using percentages and decimals. Ms Szalek explains percentages, and then she explains how to convert expected and actual probability outcomes into decimals.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will learn tapping skills in today's class and tap their way down a cobblestone road.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Koala - Borobi.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Author Yiyun Li on language, mental health and the 'weight' of history
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: A warning, this clips includes mention of suicide. Writer Yiyun Li has lived for more than half of her life in America, but her life in China and the struggle between what she sees as the 'I' versus the 'we' of the two cultures has been an ongoing struggle.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 17 Mario, Angel and Anushka. Tries to Catch a Fish
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Italy, Mario tries to catch some fish himself, in India, Anushka plays an unusual hopscotch game. And on a very hot day in Peru, Angel helps his great-granddad plant some carrots and climbs a giant avocado tree.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, cook, and work in the 1920s? Appliances that we take for granted started appearing as electricity was connected in households.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: In this episode, Rachael teaches everyone how to do a special bubble breath exercise that she uses when she wants to feel 'Calm'.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Strawberry farmer turns berries to bottled jam
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: 'Lend a hand and buy some jam', Strawberry farmer turns berries to bottled jam and asks people to support small businesses until restrictions ease.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Liza Hamza and Truc. Goes Shopping for Goldfish
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Vietnam, Truc takes pity on her lonely goldfish and goes shopping for some companions in Russia Liza and her twin brother Styopa take part in a craft class and in Jordan, Hamza makes a pizza for a picnic with his family.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: A battery manufacturer tests just a sample of its product to verify its claims about battery life. A margin of error and a confidence level help quantify its accuracy.

title: Stargazing Live
description: Recorded over three nights at Siding Spring Observatory (SSO) in NSW, this series immerses the audience in a celebration of the night sky, with a focus on features that are best experienced from Australian soil.
description2: Tim Minchin joins Brian Cox and Julia Zemiro on their live journey through the cosmos and Alan Duffy uses the Parkes dish to listen live for Aliens.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally gets a special present from a friend who lives in Japan. How can she say, "Thank you"? Aha, this present will be just what she and Possum need to make a special thank you card.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource looks at the different tests fabrics and products have to undergo before they hit the shelves. Using examples from high street retailer, New Look and outdoor specialists, Millets and Blacks.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: When Hamza can't get his beloved robot cat to behave, he discovers that his pet is made of all kinds of cool parts, including a computer. To fix Koolkatt, Hamza must learn how to speak to computers. But how?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Finger spelling is good for showing people words. Possum knows Auslan signs and lots of finger spelling words. Now Possum School is on again and he is learning to write some words in English too.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You live at the South Pole, in the frozen landscapes of Antarctica. Dads will wait for weeks for the mothers who leave to feed in the ocean. When they return, each one will recognise her companion thanks to his unique song!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblobs challenge Twenty to a singing count-off.

title: English On The Go
episode_name: Episode 9 Who, Whom, Whose and Who's
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Using who, whom, whose and who's can be very confusing in English. We break down the confusion in this video.

title: Many Lands, Many Seasons
description: This series explores six Aboriginal seasonal calendars to find out how the unique knowledge they contain helps the traditional owners to hunt, fish and collect bush tucker at the best time!
description2: Come visit Nauiyu, Daly River in the top end of the Northern Territory and discover the thirteen seasons of the Ngan'gi Seasons calendar.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a hip hop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Here I go in a sandy desert, in Australia, to meet a lizard like no other... Hello Moloch! You look like a cactus on legs, because your body is covered with thorns!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Detective Ziggy investigates who is eating the cafe food in the middle of the night. He is determined to solve the case of the Midnight Muncher.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: An amazing journey to Noa Noa Islands, among coconut trees and colourful plants .... being in Paris. Possible, with the great painter Paul Gauguin!

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Barcelona! How wonderful is Parc Guell, one of Gaudi's! Mati and Dada are transported directly to Spain by a very big and mysterious Salamander...

title: Water Wisdom
description: Fresh water systems are fundamental to Australia's first people who have nurtured a deep understanding of water. The Water Wisdom series shares this knowledge through the voice of Aboriginal communities.
description2: This episode of the Water Wisdom series shares the knowledge of fresh water systems through the voice of the Kaurna people who have managed water on the Adelaide Plains for thousands of years.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: Inside the painting she explores Wright of Derby's use of a single light source to draw attention to particular elements of the work, and discusses representation of the period of Enlightenment in works of art.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Zap decides he wants to walk on the moon and Bop builds him a set of wings, but they don't seem to work. Zap's friends decide if they can't get Zap to the moon they can bring the moon to Zap.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids take on experiments in turning hydrophilic sand hydrophobic transferring sound through vibration across surfaces how vibrations are manipulated to create different sounds in musical instruments and lots more.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's all about balance as the Numberblocks try to make it across a very wobbly bridge.

title: So You Want To Be A Designer?
series: So You Want To Be A Designer?
description: See how designers create products that meet user need and are inclusive. We see how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs, and respond to the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: With extraordinary access to their car manufacturing plant in Sweden, Volvos environmental experts show how life cycle assessment has enabled them to reduce the carbon footprint of their products.

title: Mixed Up Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 12 Super Cyril's Circus Supplies
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Making a budget to pay for something special, like a party, is always a good idea. So lets make sure we get the most out of our money!

title: Create
episode_name: Marbling: How To Marble Shaving Cream
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Ever wanted to find out how to create awesome patterns on paper? Well in this episode of Create you will find just that, using shaving cream!

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Is China the ‘grown teenager’ of the world? Stan Grant chats to podcaster Kaiser Kuo about the country’s contrast between the weight of history – and the modern nation it’s become.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Andrew Fisher.

title: The Bright Side
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: In Episode 2 of The Bright Side, Sabra Lane takes a look at some of the innovative and quirky solutions to some everyday problems.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Find out how to create a special occassion look by twisting your hair into a beautiful braid! It's also the perfect opportunity to accessorise!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Frank Forde.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: How tall are you? And why do we measure height in feet?

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: The sum of the digits on two opposite faces of dice will always be seven. In this episode, dice are used as fun tools to reinforce fact families of seven, multiples of seven, and subtraction skills.

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 What Is Public Art?
description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Dinosaur tells a story about a group of space kids living on an asteroid together and the Pencil Pals learn the difference between personal and collective.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Three invites the other Numberblocks to her super new go-kart track.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make pretty patterns and unique designs with this simple printmaking technique.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: There are many tools that can be used to measure the size, length, or amount of something!

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Painting at the Bernoulli
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric makes his own airbrush and learns more about the Bernoulli Principle. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Charlotte is an Irish dance champion who isn't planning to make drastic cuts to the family budget  rather she will earn money by busking, cleaning bins, recycling cans and selling an old Irish dance dress.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Mathemagician Eric reveals a cool math trick that will amaze your friends! No matter what numbers are chosen, the answer will always be nine. It's not magic...it's math!

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 33 Get the Big Picture!
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava makes bar graphs to compare her friends' pets, favourite colours, and more!

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This special is all about climate change. We take a look at what net zero emissions are and learn more about the controversial fuel source, coal. We also see how climate change is affecting kids living in the Pacific.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actress & comedian Sarah Hadland reads extracts from 'Nelly the Monster Sitter' by Kes Gray. She explains why she loves the book, how it captured her imagination, and why she loves to read.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Have a nice trip! In this STEM episode Eric discovers how his maple tree spreads its seeds. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The number friends take turns hiding behind each other in a song and dance all about bigger and smaller.

title: Convict Kids
description: Australia was a British penal colony between 1788 and 1868 and over 160,000 convicts were 'transported' here. Learn about these child convicts, why they were transported, how they lived in the colony and what became of them.
description2: Convict kids in Australia suffered a variety of punishments for even the most minor offences. These punishments ranged from flogging to solitary confinement or work gangs.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's time for the grand finale but the number fun doesn't stop here.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One, Two, Three and Four are off on a castle exploring adventure, with a little help from the friends they make along the way. Learn how to make numbers up to 10 by adding with the Numberblocks.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Tyrone likes dirt bike riding and spending money as soon as he gets it, but as Teenage Boss he has to lead by example packing his own lunch so the family can reduce their takeaway and canteen expenses.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Mummy mayhem ensues as Zoey and Lukas explore the many ways we can communicate with pictures, symbols and pictograms, just like ancient Egyptians.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: We're loving the letter L.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum has a lot of fun with cardboard boxes, but they don't move. How do trains move? Skip has something wonderful to show Possum and Sally and then they get to take a special journey.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Years 3-6: Addition with Regrouping
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss White teaches you how to complete formal addition problems involving regrouping. She demonstrates how to set up and solve the addition questions correctly, and provides opportunities to have a go at home.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: B is what you see.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word PLAY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: The fruit of the majestic Bunya Pine has been an important part of indigenous culture for thousands of years. Today many landowners consider it dangerous and garden waste but an Indigenous artist believes it deserves better.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 Modern Materials And The Solid State: Crystals, Polymers, And Alloys
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: In this closing chapter, we see chemistry as not only an excellent entry point to predicting how a new material behaves, but also a continuous process of innovation and discovery.

title: Colourful Weather
episode_name: Series 1 Blue Jets, Sprites and Elves
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: Do you love watching lightning during a thunderstorm? It's a pretty spectacular sight. What you might not have noticed is the colourful light show happening above the clouds!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HIM. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 1 The Battle Continues Part 1
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig Reucassel returns for Season 2 of the series that sparked action across the nation. Craig explores our reliance on single-use plastic items such as bottles and straws that damage our waterways and marine life.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: It's Christmas time and Cody, Napuru, Nangala and Sheila a little blue heeler are off again with old Uncle Max on another adventure.

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: The people of Goulburn Island in the Arafura Sea have been eating and trading oysters for centuries. Now the remote Aboriginal community has set up an oyster farm to grow black lip oysters and create jobs.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Atoms And Light: Exploring Atomic And Electronic Structure
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: In this unit, we will follow the gradual change from considering the atom as a single indivisible particle to a later understanding of the atom composed of its constituent subatomic parts.

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Michael Landy's Unrealised Projects
description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make a creepy, crawly riceball spider, all while learning about shapes, sizes and numbers. Make sure you count all the spider's legs as you assemble this delectable dinner.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: When Rich has problems with his creativity Matt suggests an unusual solution a Mind Poo. In this Art Blast Rich takes a trip through Surreal Art to see where Art ideas come from.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Uh oh! Will Sally's house have to be moved? Possum is fascinated by the big machines and people in hard hats that he can see from the top of his tree. Then he makes his own digging machine.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Personal Trainer who will get you motivated for your career in fitness.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Lucila is twelve and lives in Caraguata, a river district of Buenos Aries in Argentina. She catches two boats to school each day, which can take nearly two hours. Lucila loves to perform and dreams of becoming an artist.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Feeling a bit down? Follow this simple technique to make your brain feel happier.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: A blooming year for sunflowers finds a new way to use harvest
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: It's been a blooming marvellous year for sunflowers in the north of Victoria and flower farmers are finding new ways to put their bright harvest to use.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a compost farm to see how compost is made from things we might throw away.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: A German girl helps her older sister, who is taking care of wounded soldiers. When the senior doctor refuses to treat a poison-gas victim, she decides to help the soldier on her own in secret and manages to save him.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Virtual Reality Animator.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Documentary following brothers Daniel and Jake as they move from Devon to New Zealand, revealing how they feel about their parents' decision to emigrate.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Zhao Zhenhui shows us the beautiful karst peaks and life on the banks of the Li River.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Olivier enjoys playing tricks on people. His lower legs are missing but when he wears trousers & his prosthetic legs, nobody knows. It's a kind of illusion. But why do our senses sometimes get it wrong?

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Frog - Taran.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Samson lives in Kibera, Kenya. He travels to school by bus each day. Samson loves science and wants to become a doctor.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Ruben, Harley and Nicole, three 12-year-olds with Down's Syndrome, pursue their dreams over the course of the summer holidays.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Potato Harvester
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode, Maddie visits a farm to show us how a potato harvester works to pick out and sort the potatoes that are growing in the ground.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Putting It All Together
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: The members of the Amphion String Quartet join Maestro Maull for this opportunity to experience an entire movement of classical music.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Elikanah is 11 years old and lives in Kenya. He loves elephants and gets very angry with the poachers who illegally hunt elephants for their ivory tusks. He comes up with a solution that uses flight to protect the elephants.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team investigates what happens when water becomes our enemy. Mike heads to Southampton to learn all about the most important flood rescue vehicle - the hovercraft.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word TOP. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Dom's MY:24 happened when he was 15-years-old, and his mentors Tim and Tam gave him his first paid gig as a magician. His success on the night made him realise that his magic performances were an important part of who he was.

title: BTN Specials
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 1 World War II Anniversary
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This BTN Special gives a brief history of World War II. We find out about Australia's role in the war and learn more about the bombing of Darwin. We also take a look at the impact WWII had on the world.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is getting ready for a picnic with Jay and Possum. She needs to go to the shop first but needs to be fast to be ready for the picnic. Possum thinks Sally is slow going to the shop and that he'd be faster.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: It's a very hot day and Sally is looking for fun things to do. She finds Possum keeping cool under the shade of his tree. Together they watch children keep cool on a hot day and then decide to go the beach.

title: Colourful Weather
episode_name: Series 1 Blue Jets, Sprites and Elves
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: Do you love watching lightning during a thunderstorm? It's a pretty spectacular sight. What you might not have noticed is the colourful light show happening above the clouds!

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will be practicing their Sautes which means "to jump" in French. They'll be jumping their way into he finale in a cool, mystical world.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 15 Years 3-4: Partitioning Numbers Using Efficient Strategies
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, you will continue to partition numbers in standard and non-standard ways. You'll also explore how the same problem can be solved in many ways.

title: Iceland: Living With Volcanoes
description: Focussing on the 2010 eruption, this film asks why people choose to live in volcanic regions? The prospects for geo-thermal power, tourism & agriculture are considered, exploring the impacts of the Eyjafjallajokull eruption. Stage 4-5 Geography, Science
description2: Focussing on the 2010 eruption, this film asks why people choose to live in volcanic regions? The prospects for geo-thermal power, tourism & agriculture are considered, exploring the impacts of the Eyjafjallajokull eruption. Stage 4-5 Geography, Science

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Chip oil powers the Nullarbor Plain's first EV fast-charger
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The first fast-charger for EVs has been installed on the Nullarbor Plain, opening up the remote region to battery-powered motorists.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SO. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: Bias is hard to avoid, but it can be really damaging - leading us to make poor choices without fairly weighing up the facts. This episode looks at bias in the media and why it can be particularly damaging.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Skip has been working on something amazing and now it is time to see it in action. But Possum has been busy too. Watch carefully!

title: Atom Bond
description: Shrouded in the mysterious world of espionage, Agent Gold is on a mission exploring the complex world of chemical bonds. This reimagining of a classic animation takes a comprehensive look at covalent, ionic and metallic bonding. Secondary Science.
description2: In a secret location, Copper and Silver separate Chlorine from Potassium. Gold & Chlorine return to Carbon's secret school - but cannot find Fluorine & Oxygen. Carbon appears, and Gold and Chlorine flee to a nearby bond shop.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This BTN Special is about religious festivals and celebrations. We meet some kids who tell us about the colours of Holi, the origins of Vaisakhi and about Eid. We also learn about the importance of Lent, Yom Kippur and Vesak.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A king who no longer wanted to rule his kingdom gave his three daughters three tests.

title: Convict Kids
description: Australia was a British penal colony between 1788 and 1868 and over 160,000 convicts were 'transported' here. Learn about these child convicts, why they were transported, how they lived in the colony and what became of them.
description2: In 18th and early 19th century Britain, transportation as a form of punishment was used to combat the over-crowded prisons. Children as young as seven could be tried as adults and sent to Australia as convicts.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: New Brisbane facility providing more donated breastmilk
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The dedicated space at Kelvin Grove will help ensure Queensland can meet future demand. Ashleigh Stevenson reports.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Looking for adventures, Kangaroo, Emu and friends set off to cross the Nullarbor Plain.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 3 To Be A Teenage Boy
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to be a teenage boy.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko makes up a game but when Dog and Bird join in, they find it a bit too scary! Can Keeko change the game so that everyone feels comfortable to play?

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Only a real princess can feel a small pea through a pile of mattresses.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Anja Murray discovers the amazing variety and ecology of seaweed around Irish coasts. Long harvested by local communities along our west coast, Seaweed has now become a valuable resource worldwide.

title: What Is Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Why do we keep on listening to sad music? We study the elements of 'sad songs', look at their appeal and cognitive effects, and try to turn a happy song into a sad one using the dark arts of reharmonisation.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Why Do Humans Love A Good Beat?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What's happening in our brain when we hear a groove? We discover how our brains 'lock on' to a beat - and Dan learns how to dance.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How COVID lockdown changed China's perception of mental health
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Mental health used to be a taboo topic in China, but the enduring toll of numerous Covid lockdowns means attitudes are changing fast. China Tonight’s Jinghua Qian has the story.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Arnolfini Portrait' by Jan Van Eyck. Inside the painting she explores the clues that Van Eyck painted into the picture giving us meanings.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally's dad is really excited to see his favourite band - The Rockin' Trolls - at their big concert tonight. But when the show is cancelled, Wally sets to work making his own rock and roll band to play a concert for his dad.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Binge-eating influencers could face fines for promoting over-eating, as part of a government crackdown focusing on food security.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Learn how to talk about your family in this episode of Everyday English.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Outerspace, underwater, in 3000 years time... When and where will your science fiction story begin?

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Did the first outbreaks occur in China or in the Caspian Sea? Experts still argue. But how did the plague actually spread? After many controversies, it seems that the rat flea was the major carrier of this disease.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn about Swing Dancing and Grooves mash up

title: Back Roads Kids
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Where Is Violet Town?
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Violet Town is in rural Victoria. It's a small town with friendly people, but the locals tell us there are lots of snakes!

title: Create
episode_name: Back To School: Secret Snail Handshake
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Sneakily communicate with your pals with this secret snail handshake! The pace is definitely not slow but with a bit of practice you'll be sure to 'sNAIL it!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Learn how to talk about different types of hobbies using the right verbs and adjectives in this episode of Everyday English.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mo hates trying things for the first time but Mikki loves it. She really struggles to understand why he can't take the leap. I mean, Himalayan hang gliding isn't so scary - you just have to give it a go!
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mo signs Mikki up for a karaoke competition which sends her into an anxiety spiral. She just loves singing but - plot twist! - doesn't want to sing in front of her friends, family or any cool teenagers.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 40 Don't Worry, Keep Writing
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Spelling mistakes, weird sentences, wrong punctuation, rhymes that don't really rhyme... it's all okay because you can rewrite it a bunch of times!

title: Growing Up In The Early 1900s
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Mornings, Baths and Meals
description: What was life like for working-class children in Australian cities in the early 1900s? How different or similar was their day to yours? Learn how Jim and Dolly Youngein spent their days in Susannah Place, Sydney.
description2: What was it like getting up and getting ready when there was no bathroom in your house? And what did children eat for breakfast when there were no refrigerators or supermarkets foods like cereal?

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A story with vibrant illustrations about country.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Caterpillar lived all alone, living in fear of everything around her. She hides in her chrysalis to escape from any danger but gloriously emerges as a beautiful butterfly without fear.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric learns about fossils and dinosaurs that lived over 65 million years ago! It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: Mumbai - Managing a Megacity
description: This program looks at the steps Mumbai is taking to make the city more sustainable and asks can a new Metro system be the answer to the city's traffic problems? Stage 5 Geography, Science
description2: This program looks at the steps Mumbai is taking to make the city more sustainable and asks can a new Metro system be the answer to the city's traffic problems? Stage 5 Geography, Science

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Andrei lives in a village in Romania. He walks to school each day with his younger sister through the fields and country lanes. Andrei loves maths and is the top of his class in school.

title: Create
