description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: This flower card is not only pretty but holds an important message this valentine's day! Our artist demonstrates how you can make your own!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How is it Made? Road Sign
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a road sign factory to learn how they are made. She finds out about the different shapes of road signs and what they mean.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Charlotte is an Irish dance champion who isn't planning to make drastic cuts to the family budget  rather she will earn money by busking, cleaning bins, recycling cans and selling an old Irish dance dress.

title: Carbon Cycles And Climate Change In The Tundra
episode_name: Carbon Cycles And Climate Change In The Tundra
description: Filmed in the Canadian Arctic, this program identifies and explores the physical and human factors, including climate change that affect carbon and water cycles in the tundra. Stages 4-5 Science and Geography
description2: Filmed in the Canadian Arctic, this program identifies and explores the physical and human factors, including climate change that affect carbon and water cycles in the tundra. Stages 4-5 Science and Geography

title: Bug Technology
description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: Studying the extraordinary surface and motion of the dragonfly's wings has enabled the design of a wind turbine suitable for use in areas with the weakest of winds.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Here's how to take an ordinary piece of paper and turn it into a three-dimensional jumping frog. You don't have to be a mathemagician to do it! It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a factory where sofas are made. Maddie follows the journey the wood takes, from cutting the planks to building the frame, and making the upholstery to cover it.

title: Seeking Refuge
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: Ali fled the country with his grandmother, leaving behind his parents who were unable to leave.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You have a small, elongated body, covered with scales with a long tail and you walk slowly, on all fours with your belly close to the ground. You are able to change the colour of your skin and that's almost a super power!

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: How can you balance a potato on a stick and can Phil balance on a tightrope using the same science? What's better for balance, staying put or using something that spins? Phil designs a gyroscopic stabilization backpack.

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: It's not a lie that learning the differences between lie and lay can be difficult. We explain the differences.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: When Elijah's friends help him clean up a mess of books, he learns about being grateful... and about dinosaurs!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word PEOPLE. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Deadly Family Portraits: Crombie Crew
description: Two Aboriginal artists Lillian and Elaine Crombie, share this emotionally driven story that explores the very heart of their being and the very essence of their connection to each other.
description2: Two Aboriginal artists Lillian and Elaine Crombie, share this emotionally driven story that explores the very heart of their being and the very essence of their connection to each other.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THINK. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Making a maxxed out spinning top is just the start. Phil experiments with the Magnus effect, gyroscopic precession, pushing string and Da Vinci's perpetual motion wheel.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy has a new magic trick that he wants to show all his friends. However he needs his magic hat to perfect the trick and his magic hat has gone missing.

title: Hey You, What If?
episode_name: Series 1 The Moon Was Made Of Cheese?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: The moon may look a bit like a piece of cheese but if it was then it actually wouldn't stay cheese for long. The cheese would separate with water and gases boiling up to the surface to create oceans and an atmosphere.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Number 8 is really great.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You have tusks that come out of the mouth and a beautiful mane on the top of the head! You walk on all fours and your skin is gray or brown! You are from the family of pigs and wild boars you look a little like them!

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil starts with a Popsicle stick catapult, then he uses everything he knows about elastic energy to build a full-size catapult that hurls pumpkins! Plus, a maxed out paddle wheel boat and a historical re-enactment (sort of).

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family travel back to the 1940s when World War Two broke out. Women began to move into the paid workforce and food rationing was enforced. This decade also marked the end of the war.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Princess Alexandra Hospital: Fighting Hospital Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig stops by Brisbane's Princess Alexandra Hospital where the team is drastically reducing their waste footprint.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop can't sleep because he's lost his favourite teddy bear, Spanna. Everyone decides to help find Spanna, so Bop can get a good night's sleep.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Tom's family get right behind him as the Teenage Boss with Mum deciding to give up her beloved take-away coffees for the month, while Papa, who lives next door, teaches him to make pasta from scratch.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: As a first step in visualizing data, we use stemplots to understand measurements taken by the U.S. Army when they size up soldiers in order to design well-fitting gear and supplies for modern warfighters.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: This is the mysterious letter X.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word MY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: From the first 'muster' Census of the late 1800's to the first 'digital' Census of 2006, this is a history of the Census in under four minutes!

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Ekhlas lives in a Bedouin community in Jordon, As Sal. Her journey to school is shared by 9 sisters and 4 brothers, a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Master weaver Yvonne Koolmatrie is passionate about preserving the near lost art of Ngarrindjeri weaving. In this episode she shares her process and how she is passing on the tradition to future generations.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Bob Hawke.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava introduces us to four kinds of quadrilaterals in this catchy song.

description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Join Maddie as she finds out how much energy we use planning a party for all her friends.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: It's time to use all the tools in the kit to put together Ted's story. How will it turn out?

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Aidyn thinks you don't have to be a genius to give something a go.

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Theo is a ten-year-old boy with a visual impairment. He does not want to be treated differently because of his disability and he doesn't like it when people are being too nice to him.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word After. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric looks for mathematical patterns in art, architecture and even dance! It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Despite its worldwide fame, Lascaux is no longer considered to be the "Palace of Versailles" or the "Sistine Chapel" of prehistory, and is no longer considered to be the place of invention or creation of art.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric learns that polar bears and other animals have thick layers of fat that keep them warm in the icy waters of the Arctic or other cold environments. It's not magic, it's science!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Mobile hair salon hits the road in the NT
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: In remote parts of the country, having a professional hairdresser in town is a rare treat. But one young Indigenous man is hoping to change that. Jade Toomey reports.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THEM. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: My Life in Hitler's Germany
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Bringing Into Line
description: Told only with archival documents, this is a deeply moving account of stories from people of all walks of life and faiths who fled Hitler's Germany, into exile, before the seizure of absolute power by the Third Reich. Stages 5-6 Modern History.
description2: Through events such as book burnings in 1933 and Kristallnacht in 1938, we look at how daily life in Germany changed as Hitler was proclaimed Fuhrer.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Watch and be amazed! Mathemagician Eric makes a tessellation using a geometric tile in the shape of his head.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric discovers that salt is soluble in water. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Saw. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Farm gives fresh opportunities to people with disabilities
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A Tasmanian farm is providing job opportunities to people with disabilities. Sarah Jane Bell reports.

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Black Power: Indigenous Rights In Australia
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Looking back on pivotal events like the 1972 founding of the tent embassy, Pocket Compass asks has the Indigenous voice been heard on treaty, recognition and truth? And is there such a thing as an Indigenous Nation?

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Mike, Dougal and Leah are on an epic, rain soaked, monsoon journey. The team travel the length of India tracking the monsoon - the world's biggest weather phenomenon as it passes over the country to the World's Wettest Place.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Help keep all your origami flowers together by creating your own origami vase too!

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Gemma and Pounce explain how rip currents are formed, how to spot and avoid them, and what to do if you're caught in one.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum kicks his ball up a tree and climbs up to get it. Meanwhile, Sally is inside washing up her many-shaped kitchen storage containers. Possum spots shapes in the clouds from the top of his tree.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids explore experiments in how visual information and processing order affects how our brain interprets images, finding iron in food using a magnet, how air temperature affects the movement of air currents and much more.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop has giant hiccups causing the whole town to rumble and shake, and making it impossible for him to fix anything. Bop's friends come up with all sorts of suggestions for curing his hiccups.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids explore experiments in sound-proofing that can be done at home, how spreading force over several points works in a bed of nails, how rocket design affects drag and stability and lots more.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: After Mati's saxophone shoots out red floating musical blobs she and Dada find out how music relates to colours.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: A spiteful monkey jumps out of the Recombiner in Mati and Dada's room. Who is he? He belongs to a very famous painter playing different roles with different costumes in Amsterdam.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie takes a car through an automatic car wash to find out how the computer uses sensors to tell the robotic carwash how to wash the car.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Away. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 3 Richard III with Antony Sher
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Shakespeare's Richard III is one of the most infamous villains of all time - and one of the most relished. Sher explains how Shakespeare created both a loathsome and brilliant manipulator, as well as a real man.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: It seems everyone in Hoopla has a hula hoop, everyone except Zap. So Ziggy gives him a beginners model but Zap can't get his hoop to hula.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is re-potting some of her bigger pot plants. Possum helps and they talk about the importance of trees. Then Sally gives Possum instructions on how to move plants into the ground that are too big for their pots.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: When is a banana not a banana? When it's Art! It's not always easy to know what Art looks like. So when Rich boasts about his Art knowledge Matt decides to give him a little test.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: Although children are "just little" and "not the boss of many things", their body is something that they will always be in control of - nobody else can be the boss of that.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie goes to a factory where plant pots are made to find out how clay and shale from a quarry are mixed, shaped and baked into plant pots.

title: Rhymes And Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Man in the Moon
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Explore vocal expression and the concept of pitch through this nonsense rhyme.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Not only do herbs smell great but they are perfect for cooking as well! This will show you how to plant your herbs and also tell them apart!

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: In this episode, we find out how the brain works when we are angry or anxious and how we can re-wire it to relax, reflect and make more mindful choices.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: Tri and Roh are trying to move their new sofa through the front door, but it's too big! Boxy helps them learn how to measure.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Sandrine's family helps persecuted Jews to escape from the Nazi regime. Suddenly her father gets arrested and the situation becomes very dangerous. Should Sandrine betray the Jewish refugees to save her father's life?

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: This paper plane requires just the right throwing technique but once you get it right, this one will take off and spin all around the room!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: The U.S. counts every resident every ten years - or at least tries to. Statisticians use sampling from a population as an alternative to a complete count, as utilised at a potato chip factory.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Even though he's invisible to the human eye, if we zoom in far enough we'll be able to meet the mite. This teeny-tiny fellow is no bigger than a grain of sand, and he might be living in your rugs and carpets.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 1 Henry IV and Henry V Presented By Jeremy Irons
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Jeremy Irons uncovers the appeal of Shakespeare's 'History Plays' - Henry IV and Henry V. He unravels the differences between the truth and the drama that Shakespeare creates.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Charles strikes a deal with an escaped convict who agrees to help him in exchange for food and freedom. However, Charles finds himself being held to ransom by the increasing demands from the convict.

title: Fall In Love With Music
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: Maestro Maull jumps right into creating an "aha" around listening versus hearing and the process of noticing detail in music using the third movement of Bela Bartok's Music for Strings, Percussion and Celesta as the vehicle.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: This Fierce Earth special takes viewers on a journey to one of the world's coldest and most hostile places on the planet - the Yukon Territory in Canada.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: How can we compare sales at two franchises in the Wahoo's restaurant chain? Standard deviation helps us quantify the variability in sales.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Ten riders, ten pedal-powered cars, but only one can lift the trophy. Welcome to the Numberblock Rally!

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are not a fish, but an aquatic mammal. You have no ears, but you hear very well by a hole as small as a needle! You are a very sociable animal and considered one of the most intelligent species in the animal world!

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Britt is a 13 year old Dutch girl & is very good at speed skating. Britt takes science to the ice skating rink & experiments with friction.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word COOL. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to find and use base words and suffixes. Tahlia demonstrates how to find suffixes in a book, and she provides opportunities for you to build new words using suffixes at home.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Butterfly - Banjilamm.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Secondary
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn about how particles behave when they are exposed to higher temperatures. Diana will conduct experiments to show you how a gas, liquid and solid behave differently when they are heated.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Meet Poppie who has Thai and French roots in her family. But what happens when the two cuisines collide? Spring rolls and macaroons, that's what. Ooh la laa!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THEY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: War On Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: In this War on Waste follow-up special, Craig Reucassel returns to again put rubbish on our radar. He looks at whether we've found any solutions and have Australians changed the way they think about waste?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are the largest living animal in the whole world, and possibly the heaviest animal ever! Some might think you're a fish, but no  though you live with them, you are a mammal like me, except you are aquatic.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: A powerful and eye opening animated documentary that uses the first-person testimony of Jasper, a 10-year-old boy with cystic fibrosis.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Maureen is 12 years old & lives at a tulip plantation in North of the Netherlands. She regularly finds water on the surface of the tulip leaves. In Full Proof, she experiments with water drops and surface tension.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode targeted at the Primary maths curriculum Stefan visits a unique grocery in Manchester and learns how to reduce food waste by turning facts and figures into fractions and percentages.

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: What was family life like in the 1970s? In this episode Mum Carol has gone back to work and the children now have to look after themselves after school.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Ten and Two make Twelve, who discovers she is a super-rectangle with amazing special powers.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko is playing alone and discovers a great new game. Can Keeko find a way to show the others so they can all have even more fun playing it together?

title: BTN Specials
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 8 Australian Institute of Sport
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This special looks at the history of the AIS, the important role sports science plays and we meet some sporting superstars who train at the AIS.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a Bharatanatyam and hip-hop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 2 What it's Like - To Have Separated Parents
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. In this episode we hear what it's like to have separated parents.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn about Locking in a Hip-Hop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How singles are looking for love in modern China
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: With more than 250 million single people in China, and the population ageing at an alarming rate, the focus on love and marriage has never been greater. But many young people are moving away from the traditions of weddings and kids – finding love in unusual ways.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Dinosaur tells a story about two princesses who were best friends but also very competitive, and the Pencil Pals learn about superlatives.

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A fourteen-year-old boy survives Auschwitz-Birkenau. He describes the choices he made which enabled him to survive, the cramped & squalid living conditions, the cruelty of the guards & constant battle against hunger & disease

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: The new 'zero' approach aimed at eradicating homelessness
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The 'zero' approach aims to have more people exiting homelessness than entering at any one time and a city in inner Melbourne is seeing measurable change.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Sarah Moran, co-founder and CEO of Girl Geek academy, gives her top tips to girls today.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: To immerse yourself in ever more amazing worlds, simulators and video games rely on new technologies. Do you know the difference between augmented reality and virtual reality?

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1948 - Jen's dad died in the war. Now her mum is planning to marry Wal, who even though he has a car, definitely doesn't match up in Jen's eyes to her war hero real dad.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Simona is the first female full-time Supercars driver, whose advice is to communicate what you're passionate about with those around you.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The matriarch of her family the Killer Whale is no whale but an orca who swims around in a pod and and can find their food by using echo sounding.

title: I'm A Fish
episode_name: Series 1 I'm A Sea Pen Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The radiant Sea Pen is made up of hard working animals who join together to eat, shrink, and shine.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Seahorse shows us his romantic side and explains how he dances for days when he meets his partner and carries his babies until they are born.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: The way I inquire can partition me in my comfort zone. How can I be sure that I do not miss out on new ideas and knowledge without getting lost?

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode uses the concept of probability to explore how likely something like sharing the same birthday will be in a group.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Gus "Goose" Ronald is one of the hosts of Good Game Spawn Point, and knows his 12 year old self would be very excited to know he gets to play games for work!

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate how wool is grown at a farm near Coonawarra in South Australia.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Diet cola and mints! A fun experiment that's even more awesome when maxxed out. Air pressure bubbles through this episode, including marshmallows in a vacuum chamber, pulling an egg into a flask and carbonating pickle juice!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode is about the concept of a measurement unit non-standard measurement units non-standard measure and, indirect measure.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One wonders if anyone could be bigger than One Hundred.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua, Amalia and Nayan meet children who have been given a unique opportunity to escape poverty and receive a first class education. They meet Puneeth, Vijayalakshmi and James.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: Possum Draws A Picture Of Sally
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Hmm. Possum loves to draw, but is he really looking carefully at what he is drawing? Wait till you see how much better he gets when he learns to look for details.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Ten turns up to tell the team what it's like to be a perfect ten-block. Learn all about the number 10 with Numberblock Ten!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Welcoming us to his swamp is the handsome and bright firefly. Putting on a fabulous light show is all in a night's work for this beetle. Normally he and his friends only light up to mark out their territory.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Moving to a new country can involve dealing with a lot of legal jargon. Learn about the important terms you need to know.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One of the bottles in Ten's collection accidentally falls off the wall, setting off a spectacular numbery hullabaloo. Learn to count down from ten by taking one away with the Numberblocks.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 25 Alone in a Crowd
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Parentheses are just a little extra spice for your sentence. They can make a sentence just right.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: This song isn't going to sing Zoey! Zoey learned about the subject and object in a sentence and wrote a song about it.

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: Take a tour around a home in the 1950s. Where is the fridge, and what is an ice-box?! Why does the meat come wrapped in paper and string? And why did housework take so much longer than today?

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: Meet Linda Burney, federal Member of Parliament for the Sydney seat of Barton. Join Linda as she enters parliament as a new MP and prepares to give her very first speech in the House of Representatives chamber.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: The Case Of The Muddy Footprints
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Did Sally make those muddy footprints in the kitchen? Well, who did? This looks like another case for Police Officer Possum, and what a clever way he has to find out who made them.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: It's cold today, so Hamza snuggles by the window with his quilt. Hamza likes to do crafts on "indoor" days like this, and decides to replicate the patterns in his quilt with geometric shapes.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: Angie, Eddie and Mia learn to share out their snacks at a birthday party. Whilst they're trying to be equal and fair, Ruffles the dog has another idea for the ideal snack.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Keeping your plants safe is going to be a real challenge with this locust around. He and a few billion of his friends are ready to come and devour some food.

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
episode_name: Series 2 Stealing The Boat By William Wordsworth
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star Akala visits the landscapes of the Lake District and discusses with poet, Helen Mort how they inspired Wordsworth's poem 'The Prelude'.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello rhino! You are a huge, very heavy animal with gray skin... But above all, you wear big horns on your muzzle!

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a large animal, walking on all fours you are even an excellent runner! You are part of the same family as donkeys and zebras and it shows - you look very similar!

title: Create
episode_name: Indigenous Art Experiences - Grinding and Painting Ochre
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Learn how to grind and paint with a natural earth pigment.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word JUMP. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word ENJOY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is having fun by the beach! She is finding out how waves are formed far out to sea when the wind blows, and how some waves are made by the tides.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Valeria is 12 years old and lives in Arequipa in Peru. She walks to the bus stop each day with her mother, and attends a German/Peruvian school. Valeria is interested in the environment and social equality.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 2 King Lear With Christopher Plummer
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Christopher Plummer discusses William Shakespeare's King Lear with Jonathan Miller, Ian McKellen and Simmon Russell Beale.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What’s driving China’s approach to climate change?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China has made much of its commitment to contribute to a solution for climate change, as well as other environmental causes. But unlike many other countries, the reform is not being driven by popular campaigns or pressure from political opponents.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Learn the numbers 1-12 featuring some delightful and adorable dinosaur characters.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie discovers a suspension bridge uses lots of really strong cables that use forces to carry all the people and traffic across the river, and she heads underground to see how the cables are buried.

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Whether or not you're talking about the weather outside or the wether on the farm, we explain which spelling you should use to make sure you're understood properly.

title: Bug Technology
description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: The silk worm produces an extremely fine silk thread that rivals steel in strength. This protein thread is being used to produce artificial blood vessels for use in humans.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family go back to the 1930s during The Great Depression which saw the introduction of the 'susso'. The Sydney Harbour Bridge was opened and Australia celebrated the 150th Anniversary of the landing of the First Fleet.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Tom Tom is a warm story about a small boy who lives in an Aboriginal community in the Top End of the Northern Territory with his large extended family.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie wants to take photos of all her friends to hang on the walls of Mimi's cafe. So she borrows Ziggy's camera, but taking photos isn't easy.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Hoopla is having a dance party and everyone is excited except Ziggy who thinks he is far too clumsy to dance.

title: Back Roads Kids
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Roebourne is in the Pilburra, in Western Australia. The locals are connected to the land and their culture. Favourite things to do include swimming and fishing in the local watering holes and beaches.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville are surprised to discover that Cake Monster now works at the bakery! But when Barbara Baker gets called away for a baking emergency, Wally has to help the mistake-prone monster run the bakery alone.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Find out more about the vocabulary and grammar you need to know when talking about your holiday.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Keep your readers in suspense and make every character a suspect!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: In this episode of Everyday English, we take a look at verbs related to money and key terms you need to use when talking about saving.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: How do you max out a dome made of gumdrops and toothpicks? Well, how about trying to build one with oranges? Still not good enough? How about pumpkins!? Phil also gets the record in maxxed-out cup stacking.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: New swim program launched for refugees and migrants in ACT
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: After the tragic death of their friend in 2020, a group of young Canberrans have banded together to create the ACT's only dedicated swim program for refugees and migrants.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like being Aboriginal.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Bananas are a brilliant back to school snack but which one should you select for your lunchbox? ABC ME will help you pick the one that is just "ripe"!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: These bugs are anything but creepy and crawly, instead they have a lovely message for your friends and family this Valentine's Day!

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: Charlie and her sister make a new friend at the park, and together they use their kindness and confidence to win over an unlikely creature.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Not having clients is really getting Mikki down and she might have to give up her psychology practice. Can she learn how to be resilient during tough times with a little help from gymnast and Ninja Warrior, Olivia Vivian?
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Why Does Music Give You Goosebumps?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Why does that song give you shivers? We ask experts about the alchemy of music, emotion and memory - and Linda and Dan try to give each other 'skin orgasms'.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Petunia goes to visit her aunt, but the house is covered with plants...and she can't find her aunt

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Taiwan: a brief explainer on a long history
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: The story of Taiwan goes back thousands of years, and much has happened in that time. But tensions over the island continue, as Beijing looks to reunify.

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Mahomet's first year in Medina, in the year 622 of the Christian era, marks the beginning of the Muslim era and the birth of a new religion, civilization, empire and calendar.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki is a bit addicted to her phone, trying to get likes and shares is ruling her life, and not in a good way. She has even started to troll sister Daphne which Mo really doesn't think is cool.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The expression "Spring of Nations" inspired the more recent "Arab Spring" of 2011. Also known as the Springtime of the Peoples, the period was characterised by a cascade of national claims.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Is a picture really worth a thousand words? Ted E. Bear asks some local authors and illustrators what they think.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: A short history of the invention of plastic, why we started using it and how it's now gotten a little out of hand. Let's all do what we can to leave less plastic lying around.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a wellie factory to see how wellies are made. She uses her special cameras to see how the PVC material is injected into the wellie moulds - a bit like making a jelly!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Our famous mathemagician wants to show you how you too can reach the stars! All you need is a piece of folded paper and some scissors to create a perfect five-point star. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Who can afford a house in China?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Despite government policy to cool the market, the average price of a new home in China has been increasing every month this year, showing no signs of slowing down. Annie Louey took a look.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Recycling is important! Eric discovers how to make new paper from old. It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 22 The Colour Of Heat
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: It's a beautiful sunny day! Eric learns how the colour of his clothing can make him feel very warm or much cooler! It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode introduces paper engineering: the art of following a specific sequence of origami folding instructions using a standard sheet of paper, a few cuts and reverse folds to construct a 3D object.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: Angie, Eddie and Mia learn to share out their snacks at a birthday party. Whilst they're trying to be equal and fair, Ruffles the dog has another idea for the ideal snack.

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: We meet Alexandra, a seven-year-old triplet who unlike her other two sisters has Down's Syndrome. We see how Alexandra's sisters, Felicia and Eleanor, play a big part in her life, helping her with everyday things.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Feminism: Whatever Happened To Women's Lib
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Before the #me-too campaign, there was a much bigger women's movement in the 1960s. They were fighting for equality and liberation from predefined roles in society. It became known as the Women's Liberation Movement.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Malcolm Fraser.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: James is the Teenage Boss when he's at his mum's (which is half the time) and finds it hard to curb his family's spending on going out, particularly with new girlfriend, Riley and brother, Ashton's birthdays coming up.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric uses 4 of his 5 senses to identify a mystery object. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Did you know that some things can appear far away - as though they were disappearing - when you look at them on a level surface? It's an optical illusion known as the "vanishing point." It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will be practicing their Sautes which means "to jump" in French. They'll be jumping their way into he finale in a cool, mystical world.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word At. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: We look at some famous women in history, from those who fought for the right to vote to the female politicians that followed. Learn about changes to the rights of women and find out about some inspirational Indigenous women.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Y makes a yeah, yeah sound... you know?

title: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
series: I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here
description: It's the not-so-trashy reality show that takes well-known recyclables where they belong! Follow brave recyclables such as Bernie the Banana, Billie Jeans, and Baxter Bottle on their very different journeys of transformation. Stages 2-4 Science, Geography.
description2: In this episode of I'm Recyclable Get Me Out Of Here, we meet Bernie, an eco conscious Banana who has decided that he is destined for something more than just going to the tip. Follow Bernie on his journey of transformation!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Number 9 is a favourite of mine.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Add a bit of abstract to your paintings and create some cool shapes using only a bit of tape!

title: Hey You, What If?
episode_name: Series 1 You Could Go On Holiday To Mars?
