description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: If you were able to go to Mars on holiday then you'd need to be prepared - for the horrendously long journey, bad weather and lack of facilities. But if you can cope with all that, there are some very special places to see!

title: Hot Deserts: Opportunities and Challenges
description: Using Morocco's Sahara desert as a case study, the challenges and opportunities of hot desert environments are considered. Stage 5 Geography, Science
description2: Using Morocco's Sahara desert as a case study, the challenges and opportunities of hot desert environments are considered. Stage 5 Geography, Science

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
episode_name: Series 1 Inertia And Newton's First Law
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil builds a small drag racer in the lab that uses the inertia of its wheels to move, then tries to max it out. Plus, Newton's laws, pulling a tablecloth without breaking the dishes and a caveman trying to break down a door.

title: The French Revolution
description: Travel back in time to late 18th century France and follow the development of the French Revolution. What were the underlying causes for the revolution? What was the Reign of Terror? Who was Maximilien de Robespierre? Stage 4 History.
description2: Travel back in time to late 18th century France and follow the development of the French Revolution. What were the underlying causes for the revolution? What was the Reign of Terror? Who was Maximilien de Robespierre? Stage 4 History.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Take a boring square piece of paper and turn it into a beautiful butterfly in only a few folds!

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 PonyUp For Good: Solving the E-Waste Problem
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig visits the social entrepreneurs at PonyUp for Good who've found a clever way to use e-waste to help food charities.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil starts with a balloon powered hover disc, then tries to make a maxed out version big enough to ride. In fact, why not make 2 & then race them! Phil also tries to use the power of friction to climb the walls & even to fly

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Said. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode, Stefan heads into the woods of Sussex to explore sustainable energy and meets a group of students who use algebra to compare different types of energy.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 14 A Step in the Right Direction
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava is on the hunt for buried pirate treasure. Luckily, she has a map and compass to get her pointed in the right direction!

title: Weirdy Rhymes
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 The Gasset Had A Little Flot
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: The patient Gasset eventually deals some justice on his little snotty friend the Flot.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Ruben, Harley and Nicole, three 12-year-olds with Down's Syndrome, pursue their dreams over the course of the summer holidays.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Nakita is growing up with a dad that has dementia.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: In this BTN Money special, we take a tour of the Royal Australian Mint, learn more about the history of currency and find out what the future looks like for money.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Join us for a fantastic Greek Cypriot feast with Elias and his family! Warning - there's a lot of cheese involved and a traditional dinner game at stake!

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: Burnside City Council in Adelaide offers activities to its senior community to combat social isolation including a very successful knitting club.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 20 Truc, Hamza and Rhys. Has a Snowball Fight
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Vietnam Truc sets up a sunflower seed shop, in Jordan Hamza learns some new skills in his Taekwondo class and tries them out on his sister. And in Canada Rhys has a snowball fight with his grandad.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: CGTN news anchor, Liu Xin (full interview)
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: What's it like to be the face and voice of China to the world? Stan Grant chats to Liu Xin, star anchor for the English language news channel, CGTN.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Meet Liam whose family Christmas dinner is a celebration of east meets west! With shrimps on the BBQ and an Asian twist on a pavlova, this festive feast will be one to remember!

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The daring Swordfish displays his skills with his sword like nose against his enemies small and large.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How the Chinese government sent education into a tailspin
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: In recent years, the pressure to succeed academically in China has fed a billion dollar tutoring industry. Annie Louey looks at what happens when you stop it.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: Melissa explains what HIV is, how she was diagnosed, the medication she takes & the physical effect of the virus. Melissa is scared to tell even her closest friends that she is HIV positive.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Equality's the Name of the Game
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Carbon And Water Cycles In The Rainforest
episode_name: Carbon And Water Cycles In The Rainforest
description: Filmed in the Amazon and Borneo, this film illustrates and explains the key environmental and land use changes occurring in tropical rainforests and explores the effect they're having on the carbon and hydrological cycles. Stages 4-5 Science and Geography.
description2: Filmed in the Amazon and Borneo, this film illustrates and explains the key environmental and land use changes occurring in tropical rainforests and explores the effect they're having on the carbon and hydrological cycles. Stages 4-5 Science and Geography.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word MUM. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THAT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: In this episode we find out what it takes to became a vet, with a little help from Lachlan.

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Gemma and Pounce tell us the importance of staying calm and floating, while the real life cadets show us their floatation techniques.

title: Pip's Tips
description: Our very own Pip Rasmussen will give us her take on how to tackle everything in life - from bouncing back from online bullying, to bagging the best bargains when thrift shopping. If you need a tip, hit up Pip! Stages 2-4 PDHPE
description2: Pip offers her best advice on how to score a bargain in a 2nd hand store.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids master experiments in using the forces of inertia for some simple magic tricks, how chroma-keying is used to fake photos, turning white flowers multi-coloured through capillary action and lots more.

title: Deadly Family Portraits: Sansbury Sisters
description: Sisters Taree and Caleena Sansbury move seamlessly together as they dance across the stage, with connection to culture and a strong female energy present in every step.
description2: Sisters Taree and Caleena Sansbury move seamlessly together as they dance across the stage, with connection to culture and a strong female energy present in every step.

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: Step into a home in the 1960s! Students can take a look at what everyday life may have looked like for their grandparents.. Why is there only one phone for the whole house and why is it connected to the wall?

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will learn a Bharatanatyam routine and work together to keep their balance on a stage made up of floating rocks!

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko has spotted a very beautiful leaf, up on a high branch in the forest. Keeko tries to reach it, but Keeko is too short! Can Keeko, Bird and Dog all work together to find a way to get the leaf?

title: China Tonight
episode_name: President of Kiribati, Taneti Maamau (Full Interview)
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Kiribati is one of the most isolated countries in the world – and facing increasing risk from climate change. President Taneti Maamau talks to Stan Grant about the region's priorities – and what Australian decision took him by surprise.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a Hula-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: This plane has more than one point but don't let that fool you. With its extra wings it will stay in the air a long time. Learn how to make it here!

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids trial experiments in how simultaneous contrast can be used to create illusions why sugar content affects cola density, causing it to sink or float crafting a basic mechanised hand and much more.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a clock factory and uses a special time-lapse camera to show how the hands on the clock move around.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop has a lots of things to fix so he needs to go fast. However, the faster Bop goes the more things he breaks. Mimi has an idea to Bop-proof Hoopla.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Trying to solve one of the great mysteries of the art world, our two intrepid detectives venture into Velasquez's greatest painting, "Las Meninas."

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Legendary director Trevor Nunn, (who has directed 30 of Shakespeare's 37 plays and is determined to complete them all), takes us through the magical and mysterious world created in The Tempest, Shakespeare's last complete play.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The team travel to avalanche country and the French ski town of Tignes in the Alps. Clare and Dougal go skiing in the shadow of the biggest avalanche threat in the mountains and test-out the latest survival technology.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Mimi decides to make an extra large pizza for everyone in Hoopla, but when she tosses the sticky pizza dough high in the air in lands all over her. The others mistake her for a monster, a dough monster.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum doesn't know the meaning of 'treasure', so Sally teaches him. Then they decide to plan a treasure hunt for Sally's friend Amanda. Together they write the plan and choose what treasures to put in the treasure chest.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Koala - Borobi.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Twelve shows the others how to put their blocks into columns and rows to master the way of the rectangle.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum tries to help Sally set up a tent up in the backyard. However, he doesn't follow the instructions and doesn't assemble it properly. Sally finds the instructions and Possum sets up the tent.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Tornadoes are rare, but there's nothing more frantic or explosive in nature. The team investigates where that awesome power comes from and what happens when it's unleashed.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Stargazing Live
description: Recorded over three nights at Siding Spring Observatory (SSO) in NSW, this series immerses the audience in a celebration of the night sky, with a focus on features that are best experienced from Australian soil.
description2: Tim Minchin joins Brian Cox and Julia Zemiro on their live journey through the cosmos and Alan Duffy uses the Parkes dish to listen live for Aliens.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out about things that go up and down. She shows us how a lift works, when it carries people up and down, between floors of a building.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Alice and her friend George decide to stage a piglet race and they'll stop at nothing, including pig swapping and doping, to win.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello polar bear! You are a big, powerful animal and you live on the ice floe around the North Pole. Your fur isn't really white  it's the light bouncing off of surrounding snow that reflects on it and makes it look white!

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Fritjof's village is occupied by the Germans. When his father enlists for war, Fritjof has to support his family as a fisherman boy. At first, he works for the occupiers, but what he is paid can scarcely feed his family.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada enter directly into a Paul Klee's dream, with strange puppets, flying fishes and a funny walzer to sing along all together!

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: The Threebies are breaking it down on the dance floor while learning about fractions.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Aung lives in Bagan, an ancient temple city in Myanmar. He often wonders why the huge domes on top of these temples never collapse. He wants to know how they were made and if he can make a dome himself.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: When Five and friends go missing from the five-star ball, Six to Ten discover they are all Five-and-a-friend!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Tasmania initiative helps refugees obtain drivers licence
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: One of the biggest challenges refugees face when they arrive in Australia is getting work, and in a regional area that can be even more difficult without a driver's licence. But a initative in Tasmania is driving change.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Discover a new word to use for twinkle.

title: Maddie, Space And You
description: Maddie takes us on a journey into space to explore the planets in our solar system, astronauts, rockets and robots.
description2: Join Maddie in space as she explores a spacecraft called the International Space Station.

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: Meet Linda Burney, federal Member of Parliament for the Sydney seat of Barton. Join Linda as she enters parliament as a new MP and prepares to give her very first speech in the House of Representatives chamber.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Using the example of hot dog calorie counts, we use boxplots to visualise the five-number summary and make comparisons between different types of frankfurters.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: It's free and easy and it's a way to not only make yourself feel good, but the world around you too.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: Matt is hungry, but don't dismay, Rich is about to take him to a real feast...for the eyes. Will Matt be satisfied? Find out in Art Blast- the show that dunks art nuggets into the bbq sauce of your mind!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: We move beyond observational studies - like one of marine life in the remote Line Islands - to designing experiments that manipulate various subject groups - as in the case of a medical study about osteoarthritis treatments.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SOCK. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: To come to meet you, the elephant, we go to Africa! You walk on all fours and your skin is grey and thick. Your cousin from Asia is a little different because he has a bump on his head and is more hairy.

title: Growing Up In The Early 1900s
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 School, Chores and Sleep
description: What was life like for working-class children in Australian cities in the early 1900s? How different or similar was their day to yours? Learn how Jim and Dolly Youngein spent their days in Susannah Place, Sydney.
description2: The Youngein children studied, worked and played very differently to children today. How was school and afterschool different for children back then?

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet silverfish. This sneaky fellow is on a very important mission to obtain... snacks! Sitings of him are pretty rare because of how swift and silent he can be.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SAY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Disappointed at the loss of his dinner, this fearsome predator shares with us that, despite his name, he is not a lady or a bird, he's a beetle. Underneath his colorful, spotted shell are a nice pair of wings.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: It's Hamza's birthday, and cones are the life of the party! Hamza realizes that a cone is like a spinning right triangle and sends the Investigators out on a quest to find things that are cone-shaped.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: College makes shift to Indigenous curriculum
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A former public school principal in South Australia founded the Ngutu College to integrate Indigenous culture and knowledge into the formal curriculum.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Every noun - that's a person, place, or thing - can be replaced by something called a pronoun. Pronouns are words like it, they, those, him, and so on. Listen to this!

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: After losing her husband in the Great War, a French mother finds she can no longer cope with the family farm. She only manages to do so when a German prisoner-of-war is assigned to her as a labourer.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Whoa, did you smell that? Meet the stinkbug. Despite his name this guy doesn't actually want to make everything smelly, it's just his way of defending himself. He'd rather eat veggies and sit in the sunshine all day.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: If we could remember to be friendly and gentle, to share and be courageous, imagine what a wonderful place the world would be.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 24 Every Story Needs Them
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Remember the five W's with the help of Zoey's song and you'll tell some awesome stories.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza wonders why so many structures, like bridges, are made of interlocking triangles. To find out why, Hamza interviews a bridge troll and the Investigators test the strength of a spaghetti bridge.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: It is only a little bit of water dripping from the tap. But what happens when it keeps going drip, drip, drip. Possum and Skip to the rescue!

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she learns about flowers of all different shapes, sizes and colours.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to experience a disability.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Are you sitting comfortably? Then we'll begin a bedtime story all about the first five Numberblocks.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1958 - Michaelis's family is from Kalymnos. He wants to be Australian not Greek but even more he wants a television so he can watch Robin Hood.

title: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
series: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 The Commemoration Of WW1 And The Anzac Legend
description: A young woman investigates Australia's remembrance and forgetting of WWI. Stage 5 History, English.
description2: Kate Aubusson tracks the history of how Australia commemorates the First World War and the significance of the ANZAC Legend - when we say lest we forget, what is it really asking us?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Sarah Ayoub is a journalist and author, who advises her 12 year old self not to stress about not being popular enough or not getting friendships right.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: It's Round Day! Roh teaches Boxy and Tri about the calendar.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One's idea of fun is singing, dancing and making friends by adding One! Learn to count to 10 by adding one with the Numberblocks.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: The ABC's Leigh Sales offers up some advice for girls today, including concentrating more about what's on the inside than what's on the outside.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Our exchanges on the Internet sometimes need to be confidential. What is cryptology and how can it help us?

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Use this indigenous technique to create a piece of art just using ochre and glue.

title: Social Media Me
description: This three-part series follows three characters' experiences with identity and self-esteem, as they navigate social media and real world relationships.
description2: This episode introduces us to characters Jules, Nela and Marcus, who use and respond to social media in different ways. Jules blogs about positive self-esteem and body image.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: To entrust content on social networks is to entrust, without protection, its contents to the whole world. How to manage your reputation on the Internet?

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A thirteen-year-old boy sees the rise of the Nazis near Nuremberg and feels the effects of anti-jewish legislation on his education and social life.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Using non-standard measurement units and anthropometric proportionality ratios, this episode reinforces the notion that reliable units can be derived from representational objects in the everyday world.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Behold, a centuries-old  math trick that uses a lattice grid to multiply two-digit numbers. The mystery is straight and simple.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One Hundred shows us what she's made of in a big song about being big.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: How do people consume news in the digital age? Lawrence and Charlotte discuss.

title: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
series: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
description: Tailored for a younger audience, these special classroom editions of YCAT provide unique insights into the lives of diverse Australians. Stage 5 Geography, English, PDHPE.
description2: What does being deaf feel like? What do deaf people wish they could hear? Through sign and speech, eight profoundly deaf Australians give a unique insight into their lives in this special classroom edition of YCAT.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In Australia we meet the friendly Rainbow fish who tells us that they are schooling fish and that their colours become brighter when they are with their friends.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Russia Sanctions, Ukrainian Australians (Rookie), Australian Antarctic, Marine Sounds, Clean Up Australia Day and Women's History Month: Edith Cowan.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Blobfish shows us that despite his unusual looks he has a fascinating life in the deepest parts of the ocean and can survive at a depth humans can not withstand.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Do you know that today we use Artificial Intelligence in many areas? But by the way, what is an AI?

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 Year F: High Frequency Words
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to find and recognise a selection of high-frequency words. Oliver demonstrates how to search for high-frequency words when reading, and how to recognise high-frequency words quickly.

title: Minibeast Heroes
episode_name: Series 1 Meet The Ecowarrior: Dung Beetle
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing superpower. Hold your nose to learn fun facts about this bug's disgusting, but very important, role in cleaning up our environment.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Star of 'Tomorrow When the War Began', Molly Daniels talks about what it's like to be a funny girl, surrounded by funny boys.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: Possum's The King Of The Castle
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: When Sally tells Possum a story about a king and his castle, you can be sure that he will want his own castle. Sally has lots of cardboard boxes ready to be recycled. Wait and see how well Possum uses those boxes.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua, Amalia and Nayan are in Patna. They meet a local scientist as they travel along the river, and discuss how the river is deemed sacred to Hindus and a lifeline to local people who use the river to irrigation.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How much does Hollywood adapt to China?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Pre-COVID, China was the biggest box office in the world – what's that done to how Hollywood makes its movies? And what about the local scene? Wenlei Ma takes a look.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Dai Le is a former refugee of the Vietnam War and spent years in refugee camps before being resettled in Australia. She speaks of her experiences in the camps, and then of arriving, settling and thriving in Australia.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 1 The Trial of Socrates - 399BC
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Why was Socrates condemned by the city of Athens? Was the figure of the master thinker, who could subvert the youth, really a danger to a Greek democracy that was more idealised than it was understood?

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The tropical Frogfish shows us how they walk across the sea floor and what they do to stay out of harms way.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, Mrs Jegers teaches you how to monitor your understanding when you're reading. She demonstrates how to be a syllable surfer, breaking down larger words by identifying vowel sounds and syllables.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a farm to find out how carrots grow from tiny seeds into big carrots we can eat.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Project aims to replace homes for Glossy Black cockatoos that were lost in bushfires
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The black summer bushfires cost many native animals their homes, among those displaced was the threatened glossy black cockatoo. A project in the NSW Southern Highlands is working to monitor the bird's return, but it's been more challenging than expected.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Anne Aly is a politician, who was born in Egypt and grew up feeling different to everyone else.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is very interested in the thread Sally is knitting with and compares it with other threads. He is amazed when Sally explains that wool comes from sheep and wants to know more.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make someone a bouquet of origami roses and they'll last a lifetime!

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Big Cuz learns that her teacher has never seen kangaroos or emus up close. She's delighted when Ms Chen accepts the invitation to go camping out bush. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Gija.

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: While sorting their toys, Abigail wants to hold on to a lot of things, especially Squeaky, who she's very sentimental over. Abigail gets Judy's help to clean up Squeaky while Davey works on a surprise.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Twelve-year-old Latifa has a novel approach to saving on the grocery budget by organising for her family to have dinner with relatives nearly every night.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet the Angler Fish who lives in the deepest, darkest parts of the ocean. She shows us how they're the only ones who catch food using a bright Lure which hangs from the top of their spine.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Indigenous communities look to solar to end energy poverty
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: First Nations communities want to team up with governments and industry to develop more renewable energy projects on Indigenous land. Sue Lannin spoke to Karrina Nolan from community group Original Power about the First Nations Clean Energy Network.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: Greg Foot and Fran Scott explain how woodwind instruments work and make all sorts of different sounds.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Hot and Cold. A home-made hot air balloon gets turned into a giant floating monstrosity! Plus: dry ice, the coldest temperature possible and Phil wears a suit of blubber and gets into a tub of ice water.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: It's a busy time for 11-year-old Jayden to be in charge, with the Vietnamese New Year festival in full swing as Jayden's mum gives 16 of his cousins an envelope with 'lucky money'.

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: To avoid gardening and play, Poppy claims a storm is coming! She tries convincing everyone but they see through her. Then it does begin to rain, and she can keep playing with her miniature garden.

title: Managing Populations
description: A series looking at two case studies into the causes, impacts and challenges presented by large youthful populations in the Gambia, and a large ageing population in the UK. Stage 5 Geography
description2: This film covers issues and implications associated with managing a youthful and growing population. The Gambia, having one of the most youthful populations in the world, is used as a case study.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Little J and Big Cuz are worried when Old Dog goes missing. Surely with Uncle Mick they'll find him. Meanwhile, Old Dog is safe and sound - causing havoc in Big Cuz's bed! Spoken in the Indigenous language of Djambarrpuyngu.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Take everyday objects and turn them into stamps to help your painting turn into a masterpiece!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Hard at work for his colony we meet a soldier termite. He may not be able to feed himself, thanks to his big head, but he's got to protect the workers, the king, and the queen.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 12 As Easy As A.B.C.
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Time to sing like a bird about similes with Zoey!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Sporting her well known yellow and black colours, we meet the bumblebee. Despite her peaceful existence she still has all sorts of creatures after her, it's a good thing she's got that stinger to protect her.

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: Bias is hard to avoid, but it can be really damaging - leading us to make poor choices without fairly weighing up the facts. This episode looks at bias in the media and why it can be particularly damaging.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Alexander has pectus excavatum, and is embarrassed by it.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Emerging as the lights go out, we meet a cockroach, coming to take some food. This survivor, tells us how he can go without air, food, water and even a head.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Hyperboles are an exaggeration so extreme nobody would believe they're true, and Zoey wrote the most amazing song in the universe about them! Get ready to hype it up with Zoey!

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Luke Russell, John Tasioulas and Mick Dodson show how punishment can be a form of communication and examine if there is ever an unforgivable act.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Spend time with a tree and make a map of your discoveries.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Opera singer Deborah Cheetham is a Yorta Yorta woman who tells stories through her music.

title: Making Media
description: We go behind the scenes on the creation of a short film, music video, film trailer and website to cover shooting styles, interview techniques, approaches to editing, and concepts of web design. Stage 5 English and Arts
description2: We go behind the scenes on the creation of a short film, music video, film trailer and website to cover shooting styles, interview techniques, approaches to editing, and concepts of web design. Stage 5 English and Arts

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Ben Quilty is an award-winning Australian artist. His advice to his 12 year old self is to think about what he loves doing, and then ignore everyone else and keep doing it!

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: 12 year old artistic roller skater Tammy Bryant trained hard to master the routines that won her the 1989 Australian National Championship. Can Charli and Matthew learn the signature moves that made Tammy a champion?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Today, I'm going down to the depths of the ocean... to try and find a marvel of the animal world... a sea angel! That's what you're called - a sea angel or butterfly, because it looks as though you are beating your wings!

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, bathe, cook, and clean their houses in the 1910s? See how people bought and stored their groceries in an era without supermarkets and refrigerators.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Meet the really big square who always gets the party started: Sixteen!

title: Mini Lessons
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Learn how to use fractions to describe probability outcomes. Ms Szalek explains some of the words used in probability, and how you can investigate using fractions to find expected and actual outcomes in an experiment.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: The Stickie Gang attempt to deliver a party invitation to their friend Jack but there's a problem. Every second house number on Stickie Street is missing! How will they solve the mystery of the runaway numbers?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Five arrives to get the band together - and the party started - with a big High Five! Learn all about the number 5 with Numberblock Five.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: This quality control method helped Quest Diagnostics streamline and improve their system for processing and testing lab samples so they could meet their nightly deadlines.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Can Sixteen to Twenty sneak past the robot guards at the Museum of Numbers?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a big bird the largest in the world! But you do not fly... You are a runner bird! Your head is often close to the ground, because you feed on it and sometimes bury your eggs.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You live in cold regions where it snows in winter time. During the warmer seasons, you are brown on top and white underneath. And then, during winter, your fur turns totally white!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's a rainy day for a picnic, but when lucky number Seven appears, everything comes up rainbows. Learn all about the number 7 with Numberblock Seven!

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a very original animal and even extraordinary! For starters, you are not a bird and yet, you can fly!

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids undertake experiments in coin tricks that play with physics a classic card trick that relies on memory how spreading the force of impact over time can reduce breakage and lots more.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: Inside the painting she explores Warhol's fascination with celebrity and the notion of celebrity as product. We explore techniques Warhol used to create his works ansd his placement within the artistic world.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy loves music and is sure that if he had the right instrument he would be a fantastic player. He orders several musical instrument in the mail, but all of his friends seem to be able to play them better than he can.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Half an hour is a long time for Possum to wait for food. What a good time to learn about telling the time and about clocks. The pie must be ready by now!

title: Mixed Up Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 What's In A Year?
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Do you know which time of the year each season arrives and leaves in Australia? And which season is sometimes called "fall?". And why? These questions, and more, are answered in this episode!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Always fast, but also classic in design, the Zippy Zoomer is your go-to paper plane. Learn how to make one!

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Bateau Sur L'eau is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada, whilest chasing a rooster, come and visit Brancusi's studio and learn how he realizes his sculptures.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers are going to express ourselves today through Ballet and Creative Movement and showcase our skills in a snow covered forest.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is good at counting, but sometimes he needs to record just how many he has counted. Sally teaches him how to tally. Now, what about all those tools in Skip's shed?

title: English On The Go
episode_name: Episode 8 Emigrate vs Immigrate, Eminent vs Imminent
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: They might look very similar and sound almost the same but beware of these words: emigrate vs immigrate and eminent vs imminent. Take a look at how you can remember them.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Watch Rachael as she reveals what she does when she is being 'Kind' to herself and how you can share kindness with others.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Ed loves pyramids, but there are lots of other interesting shapes. Let's look at a few of the best.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn about locking in a hip hop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource provides clear explanations and footage of: dye recipes being developed and tested in the laboratory industrial printing methods including flat-bed, carousel and roller screen-print.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Mario, Liza and Tyra. Builds Sand Castles at the Beach
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Italy, Mario is cleaning prawns for his dad's fish shop on a hot day in Ghana, Tyra cools off at the beach and builds a massive sand castle. And in Russia, Liza and her twin brother Styopa build a giant plastic tower.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza can't figure out why Koolkatt always wins when they play Flip-the-coin. Can you use probability to predict the future? Hamza interviews a real-life playing card and find out what's so 'lucky' about the number seven.

title: Convict Kids
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Daily Life and Work
description: Australia was a British penal colony between 1788 and 1868 and over 160,000 convicts were 'transported' here. Learn about these child convicts, why they were transported, how they lived in the colony and what became of them.
description2: Convicts sent out to the penal colonies in Australia were expected to work as a part of their punishment, and convict kids were no exceptions. They also lived under the same harsh conditions as the adults.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Jango pretends to be a genie and grants Bop a wish in exchange for a basket of apples, but how is Jango going to make Bop's wish come true?

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Team GB & England Women's Football team player Eniola Aluko explains why she loves the book. Extracts from the book are read by England & Manchester City star Gareth Barry, with Dan Edwards demonstrating some football skills.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Natalie Seiz's father and paternal grandparents arrived in Australia as refugees of both Russian and Chinese communist regimes. Watch Natalie describe the experiences of her parents and grandparents in 50s and 60s Australia.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Twenty tens, ten twenties - there are so many ways to add up to $200!

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Muse Thalia is having fun kidding Dada...but she escapes from the Parnassus of Rafael, and Mati and Dada have to bring her back!

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Fourteen-year-old, Prabh's family have just moved into a new house so the Teenage Boss is finding it hard to keep a lid on Mum and Dad's shopping for new furnishings.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava cuts a snowflake out of folded paper and sings a song about three types of symmetry.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 16 Angel, Rhys and Truc. Goes on an Expedition
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Peru, Angel and his cousin go on an expedition up a mountain in Canada Rhys spends the day with his dog. And in Vietnam, Truc shops for her mum's favourite lunch and cooks it with her granddad.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Years 3-6: Addition without Regrouping
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss White teaches you how to complete formal addition problems without regrouping. She demonstrates how to set up and solve the addition questions correctly, and provides opportunities to have a go at home.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word OVER. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks find a magic two-tree and play an action-packed game of throwing twos. Learn all about adding and taking away in twos with the Numberblocks.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: While dreaming of international stardom, Zoey and Lukas explore all kinds of fun wordplay used in songs, raps and stories.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: M is for move.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Oops! That was the last of the butter, Possum. "It doesn't grow on trees, does it?" Possum might amaze you when he learns about where butter comes from.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: As Teenage Boss, Tahlia takes over the cleaner's job to save money, but when she finds herself over budget at the end of the first week the boss decides to clean out the spare room and sell some old gym equipment.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. In this episode we hear what it's like to be transgender.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks rescue a friendly alien who helps them build a tower to the stars.

title: Water Wisdom
description: Fresh water systems are fundamental to Australia's first people who have nurtured a deep understanding of water. The Water Wisdom series shares this knowledge through the voice of Aboriginal communities.
description2: This episode of the Water Wisdom series shares the knowledge of fresh water systems through the voice of the Boandik people who have managed water in the South East of South Australia for thousands of years.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features John Curtin.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
