description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Guys can have long hair too and our stylist shows how to make 5 easy and speedy looks for all different occassions!

title: So You Want To Be A Designer?
series: So You Want To Be A Designer?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Product Design & Mass Manufacture - Design Optimization
description: See how designers create products that meet user need and are inclusive. We see how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs, and respond to the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: This programme takes a high volume, low unit cost product and follows the design process from concept to manufacture. It shows how good design means using less material, simpler components, ensuring easier assembly.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: C is for cow.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HER. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: reIMAGINED: Romeo & Juliet
description: 27 music students and 8 dancers from schools around NSW come together to work with London Symphony Orchestra animateur Paul Rissman to recreate Prokofiev's Romeo and Juliet. Stages 4-5 Music and Dance.
description2: 27 music students and 8 dancers from schools around NSW come together to work with London Symphony Orchestra animateur Paul Rissman to recreate Prokofiev's Romeo and Juliet. Stages 4-5 Music and Dance.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This special is all about science! We learn more about the work epidemiologists are doing to understand COVID-19, look at the ways robots will continue to change our lives and look into the future of food.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Inside the world of Chinese soap operas
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: In China, the weekly soap operas draw millions of viewers – but they’re a delicate balance between dramatizing a version of China its leaders are enthusiastic about - and being seen to criticise the state.

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: Burnside City Council in Adelaide offers activities to its senior community to combat social isolation including a very successful knitting club.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 14 Wind Beneath Your Wings
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Are you ready for takeoff? Eric learns how to make the perfect paper airplane! Let's go! It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric learns that Bernoulli's Principle can explain how planes fly! It's not magic, it's science...it's STEM!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features George Reid.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko is disappointed when Dog and Bird leave to do something else. Can Keeko find a way to invite Dog and Bird back to play together?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Has the Sun slept in? Sally explains the way that shadows change as the Earth moves and the Sun appears to change position through the day and they set up an experiment to find out more.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Twenty and chums find out what happens if you go past bus stop 20.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get my job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. And in this episode, we get to meet a police officer on duty!

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This special looks at the effect WWI had on Australia and the world, find out what life was like in the trenches and take a look at how the war came to an end.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we discover how to make an ancient recipe... Sausage Mummies! We learn about time and proportion, and we even have time for a dance break!

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 The Many Sides Of Triangles
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: The emphasis is on the right angle, right triangle and equilateral triangle. Triangles are inherently strong because they form a fixed rigid shape that's been used in architecture and design through the ages.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A miller's daughter is given the impossible task by the king of spinning straw into gold.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Get crafty and create these flightless birds from clay!

title: Atom Bond
description: Shrouded in the mysterious world of espionage, Agent Gold is on a mission exploring the complex world of chemical bonds. This reimagining of a classic animation takes a comprehensive look at covalent, ionic and metallic bonding. Secondary Science.
description2: Gold finally meets the mysterious Chlorine. They try bonding with no success. Suddenly Carbon and his heavies arrive on the scene. Gold and Chlorine are able to escape, but wait - Chlorine has ionically bonded with Potassium.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: A poor Flemish girl is caught stealing. The German occupying forces punish her severely: four months in prison or an impossibly large fine. She flees in secret and passes an electrified security fence at the Belgian border.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong return for a new season of China Tonight. China and Russia are closer and more powerful than ever before but where does China stand on the war in Ukraine? The real reason WeChat cancelled Scott Morrison. Plus the banned but booming business of fortune-telling.

title: Colourful Weather
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: Have you seen what looks like a rainbow ON a cloud? Its not really a rainbow, even though it looks a little like one. Its called iridescence. It appears when sunlight shines on tiny moisture droplets in the cloud.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Show your friends you care by making them a bunch of flowers from clay - they will last longer than the real thing!

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: In today's class, dancers will be combining Breakdance with Ballet and will perform the finale on a cool spaceship!

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Lara explores ocean energy and what it means for Ireland's future. Lara investigates the latest in Ocean Energy technology and the innovators behind it. Lara discovers the vast wealth of energy sitting just off our shores.

title: Play School Story Time: Languages
episode_name: Emma Alberici: Guess How Much I Love You (Italian)
description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: Emma Alberici takes to the Story Time couch to read Sam McBratney's timeless story "Guess How Much I Love You" in Italian. Beautifully illustrated by Anita Jeram, don't miss the story that has captured the hearts of all.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 12 Kinetics And Nuclear Chemistry: The Need For Speed
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Controlling rates of reactions has implications for a variety of applications including drug design and preventing corrosion. The latter half of this unit introduces nuclear reactions.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Behaviour Of Atoms: Phases Of Matter And The Properties Of Gases
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Fundamentally, chemistry is the science of interacting particles. This unit covers the properties of solids, liquids, and gases in terms of the behaviour of invisible particles of matter that interact at the atomic scale.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn how to Breakdance

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: Meet members of a respected Indigenous farming family helping Indigenous youth get their life in order, and discover their own remarkable backstory.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team encounters a most feared event in weather the hurricane. Stormchaser Mike takes us on a wild ride into the eye of the storm and Zoe learns how we're designing buildings to cope with their awesome force.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Joy is a 12-year old Masai girl living near the salt lake Magadi in Kenya. Joy investigates the special characteristics of salt, making a necklace with salt crystals & explains why you can never drink the salty water.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word RUN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Stan lives for the wind. The slightest bit of wind and hes out on a Dutch beach, kite-surfing. He turns the beach into his laboratory and discovers that the wind is all about air pressure.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Alphonsine N'da lives in a village called Amelekia in the Ivory Coast. On her way to school, she stops by her aunt's place and helps with bringing food to the school to sell. She doesn't go to class which makes her unhappy.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Tree - Tullei.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Luka is the oldest child in the family living on beautiful hill Katarina with an incredible view on the capital of Ljubljana. He is a born environmentalist and leader, helping around the house with essential work.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine sing outside the bistro to attract customers and pay their bill.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: When you're in the kitchen, dont forget the most important ingredient - math!

episode_name: What Goes Up Must Come Down
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally finds Possum high up in his tree. He has climbed up to the top and wants to fly down. Sally thinks Possum should climb down and instead go for a pretend fly.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is busy painting but Sally notices he is not letting the paint dry properly. Sally teaches Possum how to let the wet paint dry first before touching it.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Explores the life of 13 yr-old Leo who was born a girl but has strong masculine feelings. He recalls some of his life experiences in a video diary as he attempts to have the gender he identifies with printed on his passport.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: If a picture of yourself is called a selfie, then surely a picture of someone else is called a Someone Elsie, (and a picture of a butt is called a smellfie?). Well that's what Matt reckons anyway.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Free beer for 'tinnie heroes' who rescued families from flood
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Two men who used a tinnie to rescue families from their flooded homes in northern New South Wales have been rewarded with 'free beer for a year'. The Murwillumbah community thanked brothers Chad and Josh Curtis by giving them the beer in recognition of their heroics. Cathy Border reports...

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Every Day In Every Way
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: If you feel disappointed because you can't get all the things you want, we've found a way to clear your mind and lift your spirits.

description2: It's Christmas time and Cody, Napuru, Nangala and Sheila a little blue heeler are off again with old Uncle Max on another adventure.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How does China's video game curfew work?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.

Video games are hugely popular in China – so much so, the government’s gone to extra lengths to keep people’s game time at a reasonable amount. In fact… it might just be every parent’s dream?

Tech journo Angharad Yeo takes a look.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English

series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: When writing a paragraph, just think of a hamburger and you'll have the perfect recipe for a tasty, juicy paragraph! Now, who's hungry?

episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 Years 3-4: Find Missing Numbers on a Number Line
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.

description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.

description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science

title: What Makes Me Me?
episode_name: Series 1 Am I Always Responsible For My Actions?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer Am i always responsible for my actions?

description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Zoey and Lukas channel their inner spies as they delve into secret ways of communicating.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Make sure you've got a clearance pass if you're gonna meet up with this hornet. He'll use any means necessary to protect his nest so that nothing happens to his queen.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: It's a busy time for 11-year-old Jayden to be in charge with the Vietnamese New Year festival in full swing as Jayden's mum gives 16 of his cousins an envelope with 'Lucky money'.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is eagerly learning more about shapes when Jay arrives dressed as a School Crossing Guard. He is helping at a school for a week, and shows Possum that he must pay careful attention and follow the instructions.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Presenter and actor Ceallach Spellman reads extracts from 'Wolven' by Di Toft as part of the 'Bringing Books to Life' series. He explains why he loves the book, how it captured his imagination and why he enjoys reading.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 27 How Much Will It Hold?
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava measures how much different containers can hold by figuring out their capacity, all while singing a groovy song!

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava takes a walk around the neighbourhood, pointing out all the ways we use math in everyday life.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Vox shows Eric a clever experiment that	explains the concept of density. Eric learns that liquids that are less dense can float on top of one that is denser! It's not magic, it's science!

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Twelve-year-old Latifa has a novel approach to saving on the grocery budget by organising for her family to have dinner with relatives nearly every night.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Edmund Barton.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 A Tornado In A Bottle
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Winds in a tornado are some of the fastest in the world and can reach over 300 km per hour! In this STEM episode Eric creates his own tornado in a bottle. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Rhymes And Songs
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Move and chant along with this quirky arrangement that features wind and percussion instruments, exploring self-expression.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word DO. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Maddie, Space And You
description: Maddie takes us on a journey into space to explore the planets in our solar system, astronauts, rockets and robots.
description2: Join Maddie in space as she explores the solar system, the Sun, the Moon and the planets.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word TO. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The speedy Tuna fish introduces us to a variety of her tuna friends and shows us what they like to eat. Even Tuna have to be careful as are hunted by bigger preditors and humans.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Oh dear! Looks like all 60,000 branches of the weevil family are coming over for dinner, with things like grain and nuts on the menu. You better make sure you seal up the food and keep your lids tight.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Earle Page.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: China pledges aid to Taliban-run Afghanistan
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China’s made one of the first pledges of financial and resource aid to the Taliban-run Afghanistan – but that’s likely to be just the start.

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One, Two, Three, Four and Five come with Fifty to a stage. Fifty rocks out and then shows a device that can make anything 10 times bigger.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: By folding a sheet of paper in half, over and over, the number of layers and the thickness of the paper doesn't just double - it increases exponentially. Find out how many times a sheet of paper can actually be folded!

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 How Tall Is A Tree?
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: How can you find the height of something tall - like a tree or a basketball net - without using a ladder? All you need is to follow the rule of thumb. It's not magic...it's math!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
episode_name: Series 1 Our Advice To Our 12 Year Old Selves
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: "Be nicer to your mum!", "Step outside your comfort zone", "Don't drop out of maths!"... Well known Australian women offer some advice to their 12 year old selves.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Grandpa and Grandma make a huge pancake, but trying to toss it over proves difficult.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: It is never easy to find the right book for Crocodile, first you have to make him behave!

title: Physics House
episode_name: Series 1 How Do I Hear My Stereo?
description: Join Yanick in the Physics House to take a look at the physics behind everyday phenomena we encounter in our homes.
description2: How do we hear music coming from a speaker? Join Yanick as he investigates how vibrations are made in a speaker and how sounds travel through different mediums to bring the sweet sounds of music to our ears.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Minna Gilligan, an amazing Australian artist, talks about embracing your passions and not worrying about trying to be 'cool'.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Our stylist shows how to make a hair knot of the good variety! Start off with a simple ponytail and the end result will be a smooth bun perfect for school!

title: Pip's Tips
episode_name: Series 1 Bouncing Back From Online Bullying!
description: Our very own Pip Rasmussen will give us her take on how to tackle everything in life - from bouncing back from online bullying, to bagging the best bargains when thrift shopping. If you need a tip, hit up Pip! Stages 2-4 PDHPE
description2: Online bullying can hurt us for much longer than we think, and Pip has some tips on how to bounce back!

title: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
series: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Interconnectedness Of Land And Sea
description: Focussing on marine life, interconnectedness of land and sea, and ocean protection and restoration, this series is hosted by Rad Yeo and combines segments from Australia's Ocean Odyssey alongside interviews with experts.
description2: Emily Jateff from Australian National Maritime Museum discusses how our plastic waste impacts sea birds and how DMS gas released from plankton creates a circular connection between land and sea.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The elegant and graceful Sea Angel Fish is a fast swimmer which would be useful in getting away if their sticky coating didn't already keep away predators.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: If you want to keep your ponytail but add a subtle braid, this is the style for you! Work in some strands of hair and the result is a pretty but practical look!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Trial program providing apartment support for young people in care
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The program is hoping to make the transition to adulthood easier. Gabriella Marchant reports.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine have difficulty understanding the menu and food choices in French.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team investigate the terrifying giant waves of the tsunami. Zoe and Dougal travel to Japan to meet child survivors of the 2011 disaster and test ride the brand new tsunami escape pod.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: We meet the charismatic, music and drama-loving Ben who is certainly no ordinary 10-year-old. Living with two languages - one of speech and sound, the other a silent world of signs - is only part of Ben's story.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Jaffer's a smart young boy. His road to school is a hard one, but at the same time an interesting one. He passes through various natural and historical places a desert, oasis with green orchids as well as a historical place.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: An introduction to Tian Chang, a city in eastern China in the province of Anhui.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Time for the Electric Car
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Over the last few decades, technology has radically changed the way we live. But the way we drive hasn't really changed at all. Dr Lara Dungan looks at how electric cars can improve the future of our planet.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Luniko lives in the second largest township in South Africa, Khayletisha. It is a colourful place, but also very dangerous. Travelling to school can often be frightening.

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Why Investing can be Risky
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: Think credit cards are basically free money? Gen Fricker will make you think again. Learn how interest rates and fees affect the money you borrow and why they may be more expensive in the long run.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: In this special about Indigenous leaders, we learn more about the life of Eddie Mabo, find out about Indigenous activist Charlie Perkins and meet some school kids who tell us about Indigenous women who have inspired them.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Secondary
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Years 7-8: Classification and Constructing Dichotomous Keys
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn why scientists organise living and non-living things in a logical order. Diana will show you how to construct a dichotomous key for classification, and give you a chance to try it yourself.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet an Astrophysicist.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Ryan is a hip-hop dancer from the country town of Taree. His MY:24 started with a nervous solo plane trip from Taree to Sydney to attend a dance workshop, and ended with him meeting inspiring and talented indigenous dancers.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
episode_name: There's A Hippopotamus On Our Roof Eating Cake
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A wonderful classic story about an imaginary hippopotamus friend who is on the roof eating cake.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Think about the people who love you the most.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word FEET. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Checking Assumption Of Normality
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Production at Pete and Gerry's Organic Eggs provides a number of distributions that look normal - but are they?

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: A twelve-year old American girl flees with her parents from the war in Europe. They board a Dutch freighter which is to bring them to America. On board, the girl discovers a stowaway. The captain wants to catch him.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 The Energy In Chemical Reactions: Thermodynamics And Enthalpy
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Thermodynamics- the study of how and why energy moves- governs what can happen in a chemical reaction. By applying thermodynamics, chemists can measure and control the heat and energy of chemical reactions to solve problems.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids take on experiments in how telescopes use lenses to focus light, and periscopes use mirrors to bounce light involuntary eye movements that create the illusion of movement in the brain and much more.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word FISH. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Play School Story Time: Languages
episode_name: Adam Liaw: Little Red Hen And Grains Wheat (Mandarin)
description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: Join the fun as Adam Liaw reads the classic tale of "The Little Red Hen and the Grains of Wheat" by author L. R. Hen and Illustrator Jago in Mandarin.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: The wonderful Fuji mountain's series and the technique of printing taught to Mati and Dada by the old crazy Japanese painter Hokusai.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum's door and Sally's draw are both sticking and need to be fixed. Amanda the handyperson arrives with some sharp tools and fixes Possum's door.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Casinos are as well versed in probability as statisticians and probability models help them maintain the house advantage over gamblers.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a whistle factory to see how they are made. She sees big, strong stamping machines cut shapes out of brass and finds out how the cork ball gets put inside.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make fun and fresh fruit kebabs, all while learning about shapes. Have a fruit themed party with these colourful snacks!

title: Colourful Weather
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: All thats needed for one of the most colourful things youll see in the sky is raindrops and sunlight. What is it? A rainbow, of course, arching high in the sky...or does it?

title: China Tonight
episode_name: 'Made in China' is getting a rebrand
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: For decades, China's been the place to go if you want something made – and cheaply. But as comedian Annie Louey's discovered, in recent years the country has been trying to shake off that image.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Triple J newsreader Brooke Boney is a Gamilaroi Gomeroi woman who always wanted to tell stories.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's time for the grand finale but the number fun doesn't stop here.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Natalie Seiz's father and paternal grandparents arrived in Australia as refugees of both Russian and Chinese communist regimes. Watch Natalie describe the experiences of her parents and grandparents in 50s and 60s Australia.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Julie Bishop says her 12 year old self would be very surprised she ended up in politics.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: China's military deal with the Solomon Islands, the investigation into the China Eastern plane crash, Jinghua Qian examines China's shifting attitudes towards mental health and Brendan Wan looks at the new generation of wine makers putting Chinese wine on the map.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids take on experiments in the well-known Cafe Wall Illusion, how sundials and pendulums were used to tell time in the past, creating a disco ball out of a dodecahedron and much more.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Year 2: Reading Comprehension using Inferencing
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to infer when reading a book. Annaka demonstrates how to comprehend a story by putting together the word clues, picture clues and what you already know.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 16 Year F: Decoding Words by Segmenting Individual Sounds
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: You will learn how to segment words into individual sounds to decode unfamiliar words. Ms McAlister demonstrates how to segment words into individual sounds, blend the sounds together and re-read while enjoying a book.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mantegna gets help from Mati and Dada to trick a putto back into his most realistic eye-tricking work of art.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum learns about weaving and helps get the table ready for a dinner guest. Sally shows Possum how to make placemats with paper. When the table is ready everything looks good, but will Possum be the perfect waiter?

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Paleontology is the study of everything that lived on Earth before humans were around. Dr Nij explains how paleontologists dig to uncover fossils, and learn how life on planet Earth has evolved over billions of years.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Boy. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Human rights lawyer, Gillian Triggs chats about finding your voice and standing up for people without a voice.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The fast swimming European Eel tells us about their journey from the Atlantic Ocean to European rivers where they stay until they are big enough to return to the sea.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Book Report by Alicia, Nia and Cassandra
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Alicia, Nia and Cassandra share their thoughts on 'Weirdo 8: Totally Weird!' By Anh Do.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Electric Car
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits an electric car factory. She learns how an electric car uses batteries and electricity to make the energy it needs to move.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Get. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The aggressive and pushy Lionfish shows us what he's made of and why few fish would dare to mess with them and to those that would, he's a kitten.

title: JUNK: Flying Fruit Fly Circus
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Art Of Play
description: See Australia's world famous circus for young people transform a 1940's rural junkyard into a magical landscape. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, Drama, English
description2: A look behind the scenes to how the show came together, and we chat with the cast.

title: Minibeast Heroes
episode_name: Series 1 Meet The Pollinator: European Honey Bee
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing superpower. Take to the skies for fun facts about this incredible bug that supplies a third of the world's food!

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1932, 9 year old Lennie Gwyther and his pony Ginger Mick travelled 1,000 kilometres from South Gippsland to Sydney to see the opening of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Can Gracey and Mikey complete 24 hours of his journey?

title: River Valley Civilizations
description: A close look at how we moved from simple nomadic lifestyles to create flourishing river valley civilizations across Mesopotamia, Ancient Egypt, Indus Valley and China. Stage 3 HSIE and Stage 4 Geography, History.
description2: A close look at how we moved from simple nomadic lifestyles to create flourishing river valley civilizations across Mesopotamia, Ancient Egypt, Indus Valley and China. Stage 3 HSIE and Stage 4 Geography, History.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: "I don't want to lose the only connection between me and China".

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is boiling water in the kitchen to cook eggs for breakfast. Possum wakes up and is confused because there are no puddles from the rain he thought he heard last night. Sally teaches Possum all about water.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Jimmy Barnes is a rock and roll singer, who talks about growing up being told to not show his true feelings.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Sculpt sand to build a castle fit for a crabby sea ruler.

title: What Makes Me Me?
episode_name: Series 1 Am I Always Responsible For My Actions?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer Am i always responsible for my actions?

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Ebony is saving endangered marsupials, the opportunity she always wanted.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Liz Anderson and John Thrasher examine how society should be organised and wrestle with conflicting libertarian and egalitarian points of view.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Here, flying around a pond, we meet a newly grown up Dragonfly. While she may have spent two years growing up underwater, she's only going to be an adult for two weeks.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava explores what makes a polygon, a polygon. She wrote a song about it!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One discovers it's tricky to play tennis when you're the only block in the world. She bumps into a magic mirror and meets Another One. They join forces to make Two. Learn a thing or two about adding with the Numberblocks.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Tally up! Ava learns how count by fives using tally marks.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Wearing those fast stripes on his back, comes the super speedy tigerbeetle. He tells us that he can chase after and eat almost anything that crawls, even if he doesn't have any teeth.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word OFF. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: As Teenage Boss, Tahlia takes over the cleaner's job to save money, but when she finds herself over budget, the boss decides to clean out the spare room and sell some old gym equipment that's no longer being used.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Using synonyms helps Zoey write better stories and songs. Why just sing when you can chant, serenade, vocalise or harmonise?

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: It's an adventure going to Mutton Bird Island, and Little J can't wait to show B Boy the rookery with Uncle Mick. After B Boy sees a snake, Little J takes him under his wing. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Palawa Kani.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: My friend, the toucan! I recognise you right away thanks to your long, wide and very colourful beak. Your beak is made of horn (like our nails), and it's as long as the rest of your body!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Three cheers for the number 3.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word IN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Zap and Bop are best friends and decide to celebrate with a special day - but 'Best Friends Day' does not go as well as expected.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil tries to bend the power of sound to his will by making the loudest sound he can. Plus: make cornstarch mud dance, shatter a wine glass and make patterns with sand - all with the power of sound!

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Fourteen-year-old Prabh and his family have just moved into a new house, so the Teenage Boss is finding it hard to keep a lid on Mum and Dad's shopping for new furnishings.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: What do Florence Nightingale, trekking through the Gobi Desert and snow plows in New York have in common? They all use maths to help save lives! Find out more in this episode.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: From spheres to cylinders to cubes to prisms, Angie and Eddie discover some new words as Mia turns everyday games into exploring the world of mathematical language. Even Ruffles the dog gets involved!

title: Get Into Textiles
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 ICT In Textiles: Design, Practice And Process
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource looks at the impact of new technology on the global fashion and textile industry. A top fashion design house shows how ICT, CAD and CAM has revolutionised the way they communicate.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: It is the Lantern Festival and Bop needs help to make the lanterns. If Zap helps Bop make lanterns then who will do his deliveries? If Mimi does deliveries who will make the dumplings? Soon everyone in town has traded places.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada meet Berenice and discover the technique of strobe and scientific photographs.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil tries to max-out a boat that propels itself using just water and gravity. We pour over water specifically and fluids in general. Heavy air, fluid sand, Archimedes and the metric system this overflows with science!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks show us what they are made of in a song and dance all about the parts that make a whole. Find out how to split numbers into smaller numbers with the Numberblocks.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Schaukeln' by Wassily Kandinsky. Inside the painting she explores Kandinsky's role in the birth of abstract art, his discovery of his synaesthesia.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada discover how Michelangelo was an excellent sculptor - even an unfinished sculpture of his may seem alive!

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: How come some sound combinations are pleasant and others sound like a cat with a screw loose? To find out, we'll make guitars out of shoeboxes, cut up a pizza, give Koolkatt a tune-up, and meet the original Otto Tune.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Have you ever wanted to take a vacation in the first or second dimension? Hamza discovers the world of height, width and depth in this multi-dimensional episode of Look Kool.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Zoey With a Zed
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 7 Science Years 3-4: Living and Non-living
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Mrs Bhardwaj demonstrates sorting and classifying. She discusses the characteristics of living things and shows you how to classify things as living, non-living and once living.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: What's your favourite colour? This cool printing technique uses just one colour to create an original masterpiece.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: When One's balloon flies away, only Step Squad can save it - but what if there's more than one Step Squad?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello my little barn owl! I recognise you right away thanks to your heart-shaped head... We also call you the Ghost owl... how mysterious...

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie invites her friends to go camping in her garden - everyone is excited except Ziggy who does not like the idea of camping. Ziggy's friends decide to change his mind and show him how much fun camping can be.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Jefferson lives in the Atacama desert in Chile. Astronomers from all over the world visit his village. Jefferson wants to make his own telescope all to find out the following question: how can he see as far away as possible?

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Join Rachael as she explores what she is grateful for to help her when she is feeling 'Jealous'.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki and Mo are excited to play their first ever gig with their new band but the drummer has quit on the eve of the show. Mikki finds a replacement, Jade, who identifies as being on the autism spectrum.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 The Word On Problem Solving
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Look closely and listen well! Eric the mathemagician learns that problem solving is much like watching an illusionist. You have to pay close attention to every move! It's Not Magic It's Math

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Petit Escargot is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Managers have no clue what conditions actually motivate their workers best, as shown by research conducted by Teresa Amabile, host of the original Against All Odds.

title: My Little Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Dans Sa Maison Un Grande Cerf
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Dans Sa Maison Un Grande Cerf is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Mario, Anushka and Hamza. Makes a Kite
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Italy, Mario makes a birthday card for his dad with a beautiful poem in India Anushka goes on a journey to meet her family in the countryside and in Jordan, Hamza makes a kite with his family.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You belong to the large family of primates, like us humans, and like monkeys. You are sort of... distant cousins! You use your smell to communicate with other lemurs you even do odour fights!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Look at this! Possum's hand is going in this direction, but the egg-beater is turning a different way. What wonderful things cogwheels are!

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 Hamza, Truc and Mario. Dresses Up
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Jordan, Hamza makes lunch with his mum in Vietnam, Truc makes paper butterflies and wins a relay race. And in Italy Mario, his brother and sister spend the day at their grandma's house, dressing up and eating ice cream.

title: Bug Technology
