description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: The mosquito. This pesky bug is able to suck blood so painlessly its victims don't even notice. Engineers have harnessed the mosquito's technology to design a cutting-edge hypodermic needle.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 3 To Go to Boarding School
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to go to boarding school.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: New Numberblock Nineteen discovers she's a one-off with a hidden talent for shape-shifting.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally meets a garden gnome named Zach, who doesn't think that 'z' is a very fun letter. When Wally decides to show Zach just how many fun words 'z' can make, Bobgoblin convinces Wally to make a zillion zombie zucchinis!

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 1 20 June 1789: The Birth of the French Republic
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: This series tells world history through a few major dates. Driven by the delivery of historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life in an accessible and lively manner.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a ballet and hip hop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A spoiled princess loses her golden ball in a pond, when a frog offers to help for a reward.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a country and tap-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Tiny Shrimp shows off some amazing abilities to escape danger and to communicate with their friends.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko gets hurt but when Dog and Bird try to comfort Keeko, Keeko doesn't seem to like it. Can Dog and Bird find a way to help Keeko so they can all have fun again?

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will learn how to dance Country and perform it in the wild, wild west!

title: Create
episode_name: Back To School: Pinky Twist Handshake
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Introduce a new friendship handshake for the new school year, it's the best way to bond with your bestie!

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Amy reviews 'The Peasant Prince' by Li Cunxin.

title: I'm A Fish
episode_name: Series 1 I'm A Blue Dragon Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The strange Blue Dragon Fish uses the colours of its' body to hide from predators above and below.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Bee keepers help boost bee recovery following black Saturday bushfires
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Backyard bee keepers are playing a key role in boosting bee stocks.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Magpie - Kulamburran.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to mash up Hip Hop  and Tap

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Ben's one wish is for his family to be able to celebrate a proper Thanksgiving dinner. But his efforts to earn the money to buy a turkey plunge him into escalating rivalry with a local boy, Leck.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode, Stefan visits a vast recycling plant to explore how 2-D and 3-D shapes are used to sort and reuse rubbish, and visits a school that uses recycled objects in many different ways.

title: Weirdy Rhymes
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: The Fotatto is a counting creature who knows exactly what it is, just not how many it is.

title: The Bright Side
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: In Episode 2 of The Bright Side, Sabra Lane takes a look at some of the innovative and quirky solutions to some everyday problems.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 1 Twelfth Night And As You Like It
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Six Shakespearean actors and directors research the revered dramatist and reveal the stories behind and the wonders within some of his greatest plays. This week Joely Richardson investigates Twelfth Night and As You Like It.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 How Listening Affects Us
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: What happens to us, psychologically-emotionally, when we listen to classical music? Open-mindedness and flexible thinking as prerequisites are explored using visual puzzles and musical examples.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: 14 year old Zoe is an acrobat. She lives with her parents in a Dutch circus & the aerial silks are her favourite discipline. She falls because of gravity. Zoe wants to know more: how does gravity work?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello little puffin! You are a pretty sea bird, of the same family as penguins! But you, the atlantic puffin, I recognise you right away thanks to your pretty beak full of colours!

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: 11-year-old Jacob lives on the coast of Sweden & loves sailing his boat on the sea. Jacob does all kinds of tests in the water and around it. He discovers that floating and sinking are all about density and upwards pressure.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Hypersonic missile test reports have China watchers on high alert
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Dean Cheng, expert on China’s military and space capacities, says the country has been carefully studying other spacefaring nations to understand the opportunities in space.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: When a little boy, Mung, goes missing, Barangaroo and Mani are forced to follow his trail into a scary gully ruled by the legendary monster: the Mumuga.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You're a tiny little fox, the smallest in the world. You live in North Africa, in the vast sandy desert of the Sahara, and in large plains of short grass. Some people call you the "pocket-size fox" because you're so small.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Can you hear that? That lovely singing can only be a cricket, rubbing his wings together for some new lady friend. Even though he's easy to hear, this guy is not easy to find, if he senses danger he'll get really quiet.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Twin studies track how similar identical and fraternal twins are on various characteristics, even if they don't grow up together. Correlation lets researchers put a number on it.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Zoo Keeper.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: As a first step in visualizing data, we use stemplots to understand measurements taken by the U.S. Army when they size up soldiers in order to design well-fitting gear and supplies for modern warfighters.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Squarey, we're not in Numberland any more! Four visits Flatland, where the flat shapes live, and becomes a real square.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: Can you get dressed on your own? I hope so (seeing as you can read this). Enjoy this funky little number designed to make you move and children to appear from their bedrooms magically fully dressed.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: Boxy and Tri get creative to compete against Roh in a game of bowling.

title: Art Blast
episode_name: Series 1 Teeny Tiny and Biggie Wiggie
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: Art comes in all shapes and sizes, from the massive to the micro. In this Art Blast Rich and Matt explore ideas of scale in Art. Rich has big fun, Matt is a little confused.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Join Bri and Robyn Duell from the Bureau of Meteorology as they do some serious fluffy cloud watching.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Clouds and Rain
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out about the weather. She discovers why we have clouds and rain and how the water cycle works.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Being kind is free and easy but it's funny how often we forget to show kindness. In this episode, we learn why helping someone else also makes our own selves feel really good.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Uh-oh. Unlucky Thirteen falls apart whenever anyone mentions his name.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 3 The Merchant of Venice with F. Murray Abraham
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Centuries before The Merchant of Venice was written, England became the first country in medieval Europe to expel its Jewish population. Abraham addresses the anti-Semitism that characterised Europe in Shakespeare's time.

title: JUNK: Flying Fruit Fly Circus
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Art Of Play
description: See Australia's world famous circus for young people transform a 1940's rural junkyard into a magical landscape. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, Drama, English
description2: A look behind the scenes to how the show came together, and we chat with the cast.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Justus is delighted to become a "soldier" defending Germany. He and a handful of other young boys are to hold a village street against the Americans. When the tanks arrive, all of Justus' hero fantasies are destroyed.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: It's got to be pretty hard to survive when the assassin bug is hanging around. This guy tells us he's so talented at catching other bugs that farmers and gardners use him as pest control.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How Does it Work? Hearing Aid
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode Maddie is listening for sounds. First, she discovers how wearing a hearing aid can help us hear more clearly.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in the Bernoulli Principle, and how objects will move from areas of high air pressure to areas of low air pressure turning solar energy into a fan by using by air currents and much more.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 3 Richard III with Antony Sher
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Shakespeare's Richard III is one of the most infamous villains of all time - and one of the most relished. Sher explains how Shakespeare created both a loathsome and brilliant manipulator, as well as a real man.

title: Rhymes And Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 The Song of the Bee - More
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Further explore this song to understand structure in music and enjoy singing along with the recording.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Mike Theiss travels into the heart of the Boston Blizzard of February 2013. He witnesses first-hand how a major city in the US comes grinding to a halt after 36 hours of winter chaos.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a Blacksmith's workshop to find out how a decorative steel gate is made.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally and Possum are working in the yard. Sally leaves Possum to push a box in a wheelbarrow. Jay delivers a large, locked wooden crate. Possum imagines what's inside.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids take on experiments in using sound waves to control the behaviour of a stream of water, how the size of vibrations affects the pitch of sound, how to use pencils to manipulate polymer strands and lots more.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Maya loves cars and off-road driving with her dad. In this episode, she meets Louise who gives her some tips on what it takes to be a Mechanic.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy wants to take a photo of everyone in Hoopla, with the tallest at the back and shortest at the front. Squidgie is the shortest but she doesn't want to stand at the front, she wants to find a way to be taller.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie finds out how electricity is made on a wind farm. She visits a wind turbine to see how it turns wind energy into electricity.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: All of Jango's friends are too busy to play so he tricks them into stopping work, but Jango's tricks create even more work for his friends.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate chickpeas at harvest time. Did you know that chickpeas have superpowers?

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
episode_name: Series 2 When We Two Parted By Lord Byron
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star Akala discusses with poet, Mark Grist, the ideas and emotions in Byron's poem, 'When We Two Parted'. Byron's feelings of bitterness and sorrow towards his former partner are explored.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 21 Every Sentence Has to End
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Even though we don't read punctuation out loud, we have to use it at the end of sentences we write to help everyone understand what we mean.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada help the eccentric Toulouse Lautrec select a costume for an exciting night at the Moulin Rouge as Toulouse teaches Mati how to draw dancers in action.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Unfortunately Zoey can't undo what her dog Keona did to her homework, but she can redo it and sing about prefixes in this song!

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Our Look Kool gang finds out why wedges are one of the most important tools ever invented, the split logs like lumberjacks, meet a legendary cheese-cutter, and channel their inner cave man.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza literally bends over backwards in this episode to find out why arches are so strong. To find out how it works, we'll meet a medieval mason, build an arch out of cheese, and sing the praises of buttresses.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Fold, pinch, fly! Learn how to make a long flying paper plane ready for all challenges.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Look real close and you may find a praying mantis, getting ready to catch her dinner. She may look like she's saying her prayers, but she's no angel. With her five eyes she's always on the look out for her Prince Charming.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features John McEwen.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
episode_name: Series 1 Going to the Local Library
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: When Charlotte makes a trip to her local library, she finds out how to get a library membership.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Here in the bathroom we meet, the spider. This arachnid tells us she can eat more insects than birds and bats combined with her scary looking, poison filled, fangs.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One explores the Double Dungeon of Doom in search of the golden apples, doubling herself all the way up to Octoblock. Learn how to double and halve numbers up to 8 with the Numberblocks.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: James is the Teenage Boss when he's at his mum's (which is half the time) and finds it hard to curb his families spending on going out, particularly with new girlfriend, Riley and brother, Ashton's birthdays coming up.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Welcome to the fabulous fun fruit factory, where Three's super fruit-sorting machines aren't giving her any fruit.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Today thanks to digital, there's no need to be a virtuoso to make music, but how does artificial intelligence and software accompany the sound designer in their art?

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Stanely Bruce.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: Sally And Possum Write A Book
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Where is Possum? That looks like the start of a book. Sally and Possum begin from there to put together a wonderful book. Let's get some friends in to celebrate the first reading!

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Today, a robot may be able to explore a volcano, make cars and even go to Mars! But what defines a robot and how does it work?

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: With a little help from his friends, Alien tells a tale about a dragon's tail and the Pencil Pals learn about homophones.

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 The Plants We Eat
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she finds out how many plants give us food we can eat.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Rush, rush, rush. Possum is in such a hurry today, he doesn't even stop for breakfast. He may run out of energy. What can Skip do to help?

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Find the Culprit! Detective Eric learns about fingerprints to discover who took a bite out of his yummy cake! It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In the deep, dark caves of the world we find the Cave Fish who may live in a cave and have no eyes but they can sense light and smell food nearby even in complete darkness.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1888 - Victoria and her family have just moved into the terrace house that her father has built. She'll do anything to ensure that they stay there forever - including witchcraft.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: Ember and her three sisters often help out with jobs around the house, but when they have to join forces to clean up a monster of a mess, they learn what it means to cooperate.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Susan Carland is an academic, author, and feminist, best known for her academic speciality of women in Islam.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Brothers' journey to a renewable energy precinct for QLD
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A small town in QLD's central west has big plans for the country's first industrial hub producing zero net emissions. Leonie Mellor reports.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer, Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to plate journey of wheat at Farmer Lachie's farm near Lucindale, South Australia.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The spiny Triggerfish uses their two spines to keep away from predators and their sharp teeth to attack anyone who dares to enter their territory.

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A five-year-old girl's escape over the mountains from East Germany into Czechoslovakia, and her mother's determined efforts to keep the family together.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1988 - Lily's cousin Phoung arrives with her parents from Vietnam. But the trophy cousin turns out to be a real threat to Lily's status at home and at school.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Karlie Noon changed the world by being a female, indigenous scientist who looks at how our universe works!

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family travel back to the 1900s when the widely supported Federation took effect, the white Australia Policy legislation was introduced and the Women's Suffrage movement finally enabled women to vote.

title: English On The Go
episode_name: Episode 4 Practise vs Practice, License vs Licence, Advise vs Advice
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: When certain words are spelt with 's' rather than 'c', they change from a verb to a noun. Then again, it depends on whether you're using Australian, British or American English.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to recognise and use alliteration. Tahlia demonstrates how to hear alliteration while reading, and she provides the opportunity for you to write your own book using alliteration at home.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 1 To Have A Brother Or Sister With A Disability
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to have a sibling with a disability.

title: Create
episode_name: Trash To Treasure: Milk Carton Shoe Box
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Help keep your shoes organised with this funky way of reusing old wrapping paper and milk cartons!

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Who'd have thought something as simple as a wooden ramp could teach so much about science? Of course, it's helpful when it's 2 stories tall. Explore friction with frogs, rice, one detective and two books stuck together!

title: Seeking Refuge
episode_name: Series 1 Please Don't Let Me Go
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: Juliane spent years in a Zimbabwean orphanage before being reunited with her mother.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Ekhlas lives in a Bedouin community in Jordon, As Sal. Her journey to school is shared by 9 sisters and 4 brothers, a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world.

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: Wherever you live in Australia, you have a local Member of Parliament. That's the person your neighbourhood elects to come here to Canberra and represent you. Get to know some of the rules that guide the Lower House.

title: Titch And Ted Do Maths
description: This live action comedy series introduces odd couple Titch and Ted. Perennially fired and always on the lookout for work, their next three jobs will unwittingly teach them about Measurement, Fractions and Geometry.
description2: Titch and Ted learn about Geometry on their day out at the beach and on the job at the sweet store.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word DRINK. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Two, four, six, eight - how can you make numbers great? Hamza learns just how quickly doubling can make numbers grow from tiny to astronomical.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 2 Romeo And Juliet With Joseph Fiennes
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Joseph Fiennes discusses William Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet with Orlando Bloom, Condola Rashad and Stephen Sodenheim.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a factory to discover how a book is made.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: China’s bid to be one of the great sporting nations
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Chinese society might be starting to embrace a fitter lifestyle – but as comedian Annie Louey discovers, the CCP has been harnessing the political power of sports for decades.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SPOT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Based on a true story, The Shy Mala celebrates the traditions of the Warlpiri people and the survival of an Australian native animal.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Who can stop the invasion of The Terrible Twos?

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Numbat had two hearts one a feather and the other a stone. He decided it better to only have one, so which heart will he choose?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Super-rectangle Eighteen shows the others how to ride the rays on the super-duper looper.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: Everyone has this superpower - the power that means you can stay in charge of how you feel. You can use it all day if you need to (and some days you will need to)!

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki's cooler sister Doc Daphne is loving all things French and both Mikki and Mo are desperate to keep up. Mikki's psych senses start tingling so she decides to investigate what peer pressure is all about.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, La Neige Tombe is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric builds his own groovy lava lamp! It's not magic, it's science.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Can you decipher Eric's writing? Here, he reveals the mathemagical mystery behind mirror writing. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally uses a word to power up Gina Giant's toy, making him a real working robot! Ricky Robot can do all kinds of amazing things, but he can only do one thing at a time or he'll malfunction.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 1 323 BC: Death of Alexander the Great
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Alexander's death marks the loss of the greatest conquerors in history, the only man who managed to extend the Empire to Eurasia, the Mediterranean and India.

title: Many Lands, Many Seasons
description: This series explores six Aboriginal seasonal calendars to find out how the unique knowledge they contain helps the traditional owners to hunt, fish and collect bush tucker at the best time!
description2: Come visit the Fitzroy Valley in Western Australia and discover three seasonal calendars of the Walmajarri, Bunuba and Gooniyandi people.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: In this episode of Everyday English, take a look at how you can talk about the weather.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Learn how to find funny ideas all around you and then supersize them until they become hilarious.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Ruby has a passion for making things with her hands, and in this episode she gets tips on how to hammer, sand and saw with a Carpenter.

title: Back Roads Kids
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Robe is on the south coast of South Australia, between Adelaide and Melbourne. It's a beach town and fishing is a key local industry. Surfing is also very popular.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Getting back into the swing of school can be tricky but we have the answer to feeling energised in your classes! These easy to make energy balls are the perfect lunchbox addition and will keep your brain ticking all day!

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: How Do You Write A Hit Song?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What does it take to write a 'hit song' in a day? Dan and Linda work with Kota Banks and ARIA-nominated hit producer Simon Cohen at Studios 301 to produce a pastry pop song.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally lets Norville decide what words starting with 'n' to make, and Norville wants to play ninjas. Their ninja skills get put to the test when they conjure a naughty noodle, who teams with Bobgoblin to serve up mischief.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Ben has a beautiful blue bike, but it has a very naughty mind of its own.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Adelaide students claim top prize in national competition
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The students used Minecraft to look at how their school can use First Nations knowledge to heal country and build a more sustainable community. Sara Tomevska reports.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to beat Cancer.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: In this episode of Everyday English, find out more about the Australian currency denominations and the words you need to know when you want to make bigger purchases.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Millie is hungry she gets help from a woman with a magic cooking pot, but be careful!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Look. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Become an origami master by following our artist carefully as they craft a realistic looking frog!

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Have lots of little ideas but not sure how to turn them into a story? Ted E. Bear will show you how in The Storybuilding Toolkit.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 27 What's Up With Water
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric learns how capillary action works in plants! It's not magic, it's science!

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Meyron's place, where we see that food can be fun as well as delicious with a special volcano ga'at. What better way to top dinner than with a traditional African musical performance from uncle Taki!

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 3 Sacking of the Summer Palace in Beijing - October 1860
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The capture and looting of Emperor Qing Xianfeng's two summer palaces was the culmination of the Second Opium War pitting the colonial powers of France and the United Kingdom against China.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Join Maddie on an adventure to discover how we can build houses in different ways.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word After. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 Costume Kit by Sam
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Sam is a big fan of 'The Maze Runner'. Let's find out how to put together a costume from the book by James Dashner.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Take a moment to appreciate nature all around you.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Ahoy there! Unearth the key to reading maps with gridlines and join Eric in his search for a hidden buried treasure. Arrrr!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: The online comedy series helping kids and adults learn an Indigenous language
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The series featuring two puppets' offbeat adventures on Wiradjuri country is not only promoting the language but it's giving Wiradjuri people a unique platform to speak Wiradjuri in film.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Russia Media Freedom, Coral Bleaching, Daylight Saving, Goldilocks Birds, Evonne Goolagong Cawley for Women's History Month

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Henry believes he's a brilliant inventor. When he accidently blows up the school house he's expelled and has to find a way to get back in. The trouble is, his plan involves more inventions.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric builds a big house of cards and a super strong bridge using triangles made of paper straws! It's not magic, it's science!

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 A Nut For A Jar Of Tuna
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: The episode demonstrates how all numbers can be converted into palindromes using a reverse and add rule (algorithm).

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: This catering company gifts meals to families living with a disability, making their lives a little easier one meal at a time.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Hope for return of giant kelp forests
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Giant kelp selected to withstand warmer temperatures is being regrown in a trial off Tasmania's coast after climate change wiped out most of the state's kelp forests.

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Dillon from Broome, WA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Making family memories trekking through the mangroves.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Uh oh. Ava has an odd number of socks! Ava sings about the difference between even and odd numbers.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This BTN Special about refugees and migrants looks at the waves of migration in Australia and meets some refugees and migrants that call Australia home today.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Wuhan’s underground music scene gets a moment in the sun
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: The city of Wuhan has become synonymous with COVID, but as Jinghua Qian explains – it’s actually home to a thriving punk music scene. But as fame grows – are some selling out?

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Tick tock. It's letter T time.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Tom Ballard is a comedian and TV presenter who thinks that the coolest thing that you can be, is yourself.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Eddie Woo is a mathematics teacher and host of ABC Me's 'Teenage Boss', who thinks 12 year old Eddie would be pretty surprised to see where life has taken him so far!

title: Hey You, What If?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: The good news is that levitation is possible - you just need an incredibly strong magnetic field. The bad news is that any magnetic field strong enough to make you levitate would have some pretty big side-effects!

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Find the time to make a rock clock and change the way you see the day.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Ethiopian refugee becomes Hobart school captain
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: To escape conflict in Ethiopia, Ahmed made a perilous journey to Egypt before coming to Australia as a refugee. He's now telling his story to others at his school in Hobart.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word VERY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Count up to the fabulous number 4.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy wishes he was just like his favourite super-hero. So he makes himself a costume and goes to find someone to rescue in town.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word BY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Zero Waste Family: Make Your Own Toothpaste And Deodorant
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig visits an inspirational family in Tasmania who live completely waste free and learns some handy take-home tips for reducing your waste at home and when you go shopping.

title: Coastal Processes And Land Forms
description: What happens when you take away a village's natural sea defences? Filmed along the Dorset coastline, this film provides up-to-date explanations and examples of the processes and landforms that shape coastal environments. Stages 5-6 Science and Geography
description2: What happens when you take away a village's natural sea defences? Filmed along the Dorset coastline, this film provides up-to-date explanations and examples of the processes and landforms that shape coastal environments. Stages 5-6 Science and Geography

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: What makes boats float? Tinfoil doesn't float, but a boat made of tinfoil does. It's all about how you build it. Watch as Phil builds his human-sized tinfoil boat several times before he figures it out.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Life can be complicated when we think about all the things we don't have. Here's a way to reset your brain: say thank you for all the wonderful things you already have and feel yourself becoming more motivated and optimistic.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: What's with all the 'isms? When Art fan Rich explains to Art noob Matt that Impressionism, Futurism and Cubism are all art movements, Matt wants to come up with his own art movement, about Fluff.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: We must try to eat lots of different colours at every meal. You can also try to get this song out of your head once you've heard it, but I doubt you will.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie finds out how wallpaper is made. Maddie heads to a wallpaper factory to learn how a repeat pattern is designed and the different colours are printed.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Bri and Dr Emma Duncan explain what's going on under your skin, and where you'll find the smallest bones in your body!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Fitting Lines To Data
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Winter snowpack in the Colorado Rockies can predict spring water supply. Plotting annual measurements in a scatterplot lets resource managers draw a regression line that helps them forecast water availability.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: While her home city, Stalingrad, is under attack, Vera arrives at an orphanage in Kazakhstan. Everything is strange, she misses her family. When she gets offered the opportunity to be adopted by new parents, she hesitates.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: Roh has made a tricky maze! Boxy and Tri must learn about directions to reach the other side.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet an Aquarist.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: San Dar is a girl from Myanmar who lives in a house on stilts in the middle of Inle lake. She wants to know where the water in her lake comes from, why you can't drink it & which fun experiments can be done with water.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Why China wants a baby boom
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: For over 35 years, China had the world's strictest family planning regulations, designed to curb overpopulation. Now, China wants more babies and has announced a 3-child policy.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Minna and her friends start a game of who can scare each other the most. However, one night, Minna goes too far.

title: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
series: Lest We Forget What? Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 Australians On The Western Front
description: A young woman investigates Australia's remembrance and forgetting of WWI. Stage 5 History, English.
description2: Kate Aubusson takes a thought provoking look at the battles of the Western Front, and identifies key sites where the AIF fought - why have they been so forgotten?

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Bunda tries everything to get his older brothers' attention but all Bunda gets is his brothers' anger and contempt. They need to learn to stop teasing each other and become friends as well as brothers.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 The Elements Of Music
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: The elements or basic ingredients of music are defined. Morton Subotnick's Silver Apples of the Moon - as well as a bit of humor - are all used to refine these definitions.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a meringue factory where she discovers how the proteins in egg whites work to make the meringue.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello little Pangolin! I really would like to pet you, but your body is covered in scales  you'd think it was a real suit of armour! You live in the tropical regions of Africa and Asia, in forests and savannahs.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Well now, this fabulous little lady could only be a carpetbeetle. Now that she and her girls are all grown up they can stop munching on your carpet, leather, rugs, and other furniture.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Amanda lives in Sweden, a country where the sun almost never sets in the summer. Amanda wants to know why Swedish summers are always so light and the winters so dark.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello Mr. Croco! You are a large, green, or grey animal with a long tail and an elongated jaw. You walk on all fours, dragging your belly on the ground. But you are a rather aquatic animal and you swim very well!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Ziggy orders a special magic coat so that he can learn a new trick. The magic coat works and Ziggy makes his friends' things disappear, but he cannot make them re-appear.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Turtle - Pingin.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One and chums carefully cross the pattern puzzle paths over the magic moats to get to the Pattern Palace.

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Hai-Yan has always wanted to be a Detective, and today she gets her chance! Will she help solve a case of dognapping?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Meet Extreme Fourteen, the plucky skateboarder with a clever way of getting out of trouble.

title: Rhymes And Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 The Song of the Bee
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Explore pitch and the expressive quality of voices, using movement to represent sound.

title: JUNK: Flying Fruit Fly Circus
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Play Across The Generations
description: See Australia's world famous circus for young people transform a 1940's rural junkyard into a magical landscape. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, Drama, English
description2: We meet some of the elder Australian's who helped inspire the show, and learn about the games they played as children.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada help Vincent recapture a little cloud that escaped from one of his paintings.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop can't sleep because he's sure he heard a monster outside his workshop. Zap suggests they catch the monster and all their friends agree to help.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids explore experiments in how gravity and force interact with tools found in your shed, a simple trick using heat conduction in metal, how soap molecules bond to form bubbles and much more.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: It's wet-suits on for the Fierce Earth team as they hit the surf to unlock the secrets of king-sized waves and fast rising tides.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: A bad case of hiccups takes Mati and Dada into the abstract Supremacist art work of Malevich.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
