description2: Sally is baking bread today. She goes to get Possum's help but he is upset because his boots don't fit him anymore. Possum thinks they've shrunk but Sally explains that Possum has just grown bigger.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is telling Possum a story. When Possum wants to hear another one, Sally suggests he write his own story to tell. Sally helps Possum learn sequencing and other tips on how to construct a good story.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is at home to show us how a refrigerator works. Maddie explains how the pump and the long pipes inside a fridge change a cooling liquid into a gas to help the food inside stay cold.

title: War On Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig Reucassel is on a mission to uncover how much waste we produce as a nation and learn what we can about it. In episode one he focuses on food waste as a staggering amount ends up in landfill every year.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a factory where hand wash is made and uses her special camera to see inside a big vat to see the colour being mixed.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Nadia's place and her Polish Vegetarian family. Join them as they hunt, gather and create their polish feast. There's also a surprise visit from her grandparents.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko discovers that playing a new game isn't easy if you don't know the rules. Can Dog and Bird find a way to help Keeko join in with their new game?

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Frizzy and Neville check over a list of things to prepare before a day in the water. And don't forget your fabulous swimsuit!

title: Weirdy Rhymes
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Grunt Grunt Green Gleek
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: The Green Gleek has a number of ginger hairs and is so very proud that it sings and dances about them. Unfortunately, it has rather disturbing dance moves and is more grunty than singy.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn about Swing Dancing

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The warm hearted Moon Fish shows us that they can dive much deeper than any other fish and it's all thanks to this warm heart.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn about Jazz style

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Butterfly conservationist data to be used to track climate change
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Scientist Dr Trevor Lambkin's labour of love documenting butterflies over 40 years could provide a key indicator of climate change impact on the Torres Strait islands.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode, Stefan vists a brand new hospital in London where he learns about measuring and controlling temperature and visits a school that uses data collection to run an energy saving campaign.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Ever wanted to create your own mini world in a jar? In this episode of Create you will find out exactly what you will need to make your very own mini self-sustaining garden.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: You won't need 8 tentacles to make a clay octopus, just a few materials and your two hands!

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: The Internet today has an infinite number of data, but where do they come from? How are they used and how to navigate them?

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Farming family makes switch to edible flowers
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A Queensland farming family has switched from tomatoes to pansies and violets as demand for edible flowers grows.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1998 - Mohammed is a keen bowler and is desperate to join the cricket team at his new school. But there are no places and so he ends up playing with the girls - who prove to be the better side.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
episode_name: Series 1 Discusssing How to Stay Healthy
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Charlotte and Lawrence meet after their evening workout and discuss the benefits of staying healthy.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features James Scullin.

title: Smart Materials
description: With extraordinary access to the latest research and development, the show explores cutting edge smart materials finding out how they are made, how they work and what their potential applications are now and in the future. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: With extraordinary access to the latest research & development, this resource explores cutting edge smart materials finding out how they are made, how they work & what their potential applications are both now and the future.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: With a few simple ingredients and some jars from around the house, make a school snack that looks as great as it tastes!

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Today as long as we have the network or the battery we are no longer afraid of getting lost. But how does our smartphone always know where it is?

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features John Gorton.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Cockatoo tells a story about a lonely goose who is looking for a friend, but can't find anyone whose name rhymes, as the Pencil Pals learn about word families.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Red Lipped Batfish likes to dangle their lure to attract their dinner to them they can't really swim but they'll cha cha cha their way along the sea floor with the use of their fins.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: In this STEM episode Eric learns that anything can float if it is the right shape. Even pumpkins and concrete! It's not magic, it's science!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Queensland state library restoring videos from 1930s
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: State Library of Queensland is restoring home movies of people and places dating back tot he 1930s, but it is a race against time to save them.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Rowley longs for his father to come home. Convinced that good deeds will be rewarded, he'll do anything to help his mother and the other residents in the boarding house they live in. It's 1898.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Optical Illusion, My Eye!
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Optical illusion, my eye! In this STEM episode Eric learns how our brain connects separate images together to create the illusion of movement. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Author, broadcaster and award winning writer Jane Caro has some words of wisdom for girls today. "Getting approval is not the point of life!"

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza thinks finding his way around is easu...until his smart phone breaks. Uh oh. Now he needs to use maps to get where he's going. Along the way, Hamza forms a marching band and gets travel tips from a gargoyle.

title: Maddie, The Plants And You
description: Maddie explores the exciting world of plants, how they grow and survive, how we use them in our everyday lives and how it's important we look after them, and our planet.
description2: Join Maddie as she finds out about trees and how the roots, leaves and bark work.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what its like to be adopted.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate where delicious dairy products like milk and yoghurt really come from.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Rosie Batty is an anti-domestic violence campaigner and the 2015 Australian of the Year.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: A cube is sort of like a square but has a bigger personality...just like Hamza! In this episode, we'll meet cubist Pablo Picasso, find out why ice cubes make an awful necklace, and face the legendary Hound of Doom.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to find and use base words and suffixes. Tahlia demonstrates how to find suffixes in a book, and she provides opportunities for you to build new words using suffixes at home.

title: Create
episode_name: Trash To Treasure: Cardboard Roll Stationary Holder
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Clear some space on your desk with this awesome forest stationary holder!

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Oyster shows us how their shape forms and how they produce pearls from their slimey mother of pearl.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Tom's family get right behind him as the Teenage Boss with mum deciding to give up her beloved take-away coffees for the month, while Papa, who lives next door, teaches him to make pasta from scratch.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: A collective noun is a word for a group of people, animals or things. Zoey wrote this song for you, her audience!

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: In this episode, Rachael is feeling 'Anxious', she uses a candle breathing exercise to help her through the storm.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
episode_name: Series 2 When We Two Parted By Lord Byron
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star Akala discusses with poet, Mark Grist, the ideas and emotions in Byron's poem, 'When We Two Parted'. Byron's feelings of bitterness and sorrow towards his former partner are explored.

title: Poetry: Between The Lines
episode_name: Series 2 Ozymandias By Percy Bysshe Shelley
description: Presented by hip-hop star Akala, this series features contemporary poets including Jackie Kay, Gillian Clarke and Ciaran Carson in conversation with Akala about some of their best-loved poems.
description2: Hip-Hop star, Akala meets the poet, Hannah Lowe, to explore Shelley's poem 'Ozymandias' and how it illustrates the transitory nature of power. The themes of creating and controlling life, e.g Frankenstein are also explored.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 The Future of Energy
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Dr Lara Dungan takes a look at the technologies that could enable us to eliminate fossil fuels and pollution while growing our economy and improving our lifestyles. From electric cars to ocean energy and new solar panels.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: This hungry lady is a sandfly, a parasite on the look out for food any place warm, like Africa or Australia. She needs the food to help her with her eggs but it's not very pleasant to get bitten by one of these guys.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Some adjectives, like the word small, can be turned into whole new words when we want to describe how things compare to each other. Zoey wrote the coolest song about that!

title: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
series: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
description: Focussing on marine life, interconnectedness of land and sea, and ocean protection and restoration, this series is hosted by Rad Yeo and combines segments from Australia's Ocean Odyssey alongside interviews with experts.
description2: Director of Australia's Ocean Odyssey Nick Robinson talks about clown fish life cycle and their relationship with anemones. He then explains how hundreds of turtles are born but only a lucky few survive to return years later.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: The Right Tool For The Job
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: A spade is very useful, but not for every job. Skip and Sally help Possum to find out about many other tools. What would you use to get Sally's bike standing up again?

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: While she is waiting for a mouse to fall into her trap, we meet the biggest spider in the world, the tarantula. With that big hairy body and some scary poison fangs, it's a wonder anybody would ever want to keep her as a pet.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: What makes things move? Sometimes we push and sometimes we pull. And then sometimes things just seem to fall. There is a lot for Possum to learn about pushes and pulls.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Tyrone used to be an angry, alienated kid who found it was easier to spend time on the streets. That all changed when he was offered a full scholarship at a prestigious private school. That day was his MY:24.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: When there's nothing there to count and none is the amount, nobody does it better than Zero.

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Une Souris Verte is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Join Maddie on an adventure to discover how we can build houses in different ways.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Harry was a regular Melbourne kid when his baby sister Millie was born three months prematurely and was later diagnosed with Down syndrome.The wonderful new addition to the family has largely shaped Harry's future goals.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 1 11 February 1990: Liberation of Nelson Mandela
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: This series tells world history through a few major dates. Driven by the delivery of historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life in an accessible and lively manner.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Does Music Make You Buy More?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: What's the art behind a supermarket playlist? We look at how music influences our behaviours in gyms, shops and pubs and we put it to the test in a French vs Italian wine experiment.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: When Nine needs a helping hand, he turns into a talented trio of circus blocks, the Three Threes. Learn how to share 9 into equal parts with the Numberblocks.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mo has been ghosted by his gamer buds and he's pretty bummed out, but Mikki is too busy to understand, she's trying to put together an audition tape for a reality show! Mikki decides to find out what allyship is all about.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric builds a super cool boat that uses dish soap to propel itself through water. It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki is confused...is she having a crush on Mo? And "The Feels", a 60s doo whoop group, keeps popping up everywhere. What's that about? Luckily, she has her bestie TV personality, Osher Gunsberg, to talk it over with.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric the mathemagician knows a trick that is sure to blow your mind! No matter what number you choose, you'll always wind up with the same result. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: My Life in Hitler's Germany
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 The Bringing Into Line
description: Told only with archival documents, this is a deeply moving account of stories from people of all walks of life and faiths who fled Hitler's Germany, into exile, before the seizure of absolute power by the Third Reich. Stages 5-6 Modern History.
description2: Through events such as book burnings in 1933 and Kristallnacht in 1938, we look at how daily life in Germany changed as Hitler was proclaimed Fuhrer.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A young giant goes to school for the first time, but finds it hard to make friends.

title: Many Lands, Many Seasons
description: This series explores six Aboriginal seasonal calendars to find out how the unique knowledge they contain helps the traditional owners to hunt, fish and collect bush tucker at the best time!
description2: Host Rulla Kelly-Mansell travels to Milikapiti on the Tiwi Islands in the Northern Territory to discover how the students mark the Tiwi seasons.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A shoemaker and his wife discover they have secret helpers.

title: What It's Like
episode_name: Series 3 Living on the Autism Spectrum
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like living on the Autism Spectrum.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric is racking his brain to figure out how best to place four apple trees so that they are equally far apart. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza wants to measure everything about Koolkatt that has changed since he was a teeny-weeny little robot-kitten - but how? Hamza finds out there are a lot of different ways to measure the world around us.

title: Everyday English
episode_name: Episode 17 Winning And Losing In Sport
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Many Australians enjoy watching and playing sport so how do you talk about a recent game you've watched? Jack and Sarah explore this in this episode of Everyday English.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville belong to Creature Campers - a scouting group for kids and their pet critters. Bobgoblin wants to join too, so he borrows his uncle's misbehaving dragon Hortis.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Katya reviews 'Friday Barnes, Girl Detective' by R A Spratt.

title: Back Roads Kids
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: Dunalley is in southern Tasmania, an hour from Hobart. The locals enjoy living close to the beach and the bush.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Share the love with the help of ABC ME and create lifelike roses out of only a few materials...they will also last a lot longer than the real thing!

title: Titch And Ted Do Maths
description: This live action comedy series introduces odd couple Titch and Ted. Perennially fired and always on the lookout for work, their next three jobs will unwittingly teach them about Measurement, Fractions and Geometry.
description2: Titch and Ted complete a series of odd jobs, learning all about fractions as they go.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 2 Antony And Cleopatra With Kim Cattrall
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Kim Catrall discusses William Shakespeare's Anthony and Cleopatra with Janet Suzman, Harriet Walker and Vanessa Redgrave.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko is playing alone and discovers a great new game. Can Keeko find a way to show the others so they can all have even more fun playing it together?

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Building a boat that propels itself with the spring tension of a mousetrap is just the start. How about a long line of rat traps? Propulsion and inertia are powering this episode as Phil explores how to make things go.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil builds a maxxed out Rube Goldberg machine and learns a lot about different kinds of forces. Gravity, potential energy, kinetic energy, chemical, electrical  you name the force, we've got it in this episode!

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: If you're thrown off by how to spell and use threw, through and thorough correctly, we take a thorough look in this video.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Talking about your family members? Learn how to use the appropriate adjectives and prepositions to talk about your family.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: When Anchor hurts herself while playing, she learns that she can brave at the hospital... and even around crocodiles!

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A colourfully illustrated book of the alphabet featuring Australian animals.

title: Seeking Refuge
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: When Navid's father's life was in danger, he fled their home in Iran to the UK.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SKIP. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The House In Session
description: Your host Annabel Crabb shows you her favourite bits of Parliament House in Canberra. Come and see why! Stages 3-4 History and English.
description2: The Australian Parliament has two chambers. The House of Representatives, which makes laws and votes on them. And the Senate, whose job it is to check the work of the House of Representatives. Learn more about the Senate.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
episode_name: Molly The Grey Kangaroo And The Bush Cleanup Crew
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: This is a delightful story about where people go at weekends to have a barbecue and how the bush has to be looked after at all times.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Fierce Earth travels to the Philippines to discover why the Islands are right in the middle of Typhoon Alley. Leah and Mike explore how typhoons create havoc for the millions of people living in the country's capital Manila.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: With mud or clay become an engineer and create a carport for the mini van.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Vincent lives in Ebensee on The Feuerkogel, a mountain in Austria. His family runs a ski resort and hotel. Each day he skis down the mountain with his father, to attend school in the valley below.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WHEN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Meet Eighteen - the super speedy super-rectangle who was born to ride the rays.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Author Tim Winton tells us his top tips for boys today, and shares his views on what being brave really means.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Can One and friends escape the Lair of Shares?

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: When Cris and Crat's frisbee ends up in the curmudgeon Captain Crankypants' yard, Crat gets taken inside his house! Cris finds a way inside to save him but perhaps he didn't need saving after all.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is having a day out and first she's travelling on a tram.  She finds out how the tram moves along using electricity from wire cables above.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: The old 'vinegar and baking soda volcano' needs an overhaul. What happens if we use 60 times as much? What about using 100% acid? What about even more reactive chemicals?

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Tyrone likes dirt bike riding and spending money as soon as he gets it. But as Teenage Boss, he has to lead by example and pack his own lunch so the family can reduce their takeaway and canteen expenses.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 A Slice is a Fraction
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava uses slices of pizza to illustrate her song about fractions.

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: The Institute for Urban Indigenous Health is increasing access to tailored health services, especially for First Nations mums and bubs.

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Renae from Wirrabara, SA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: My world shattered the day ambulance lights cast flickers across the apricot trees.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Goulburn Landfill: Where Does Landfill End Up?
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig wants to find out what happens to our general waste once it leaves the kerb and goes to the largest landfill site in NSW.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Artist Julie Gough uses her art to bring to life people, places and events from Tasmanian colonial history and gives her viewers a chance to delve deeper and experience the past differently.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: It's the unbelievable letter U.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Lawrence is a TV host and presenter. His advice starts with being open minded and remembering to try out new experiences!

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Tyra, Hamza and Liza. Makes Blueberry Pancakes
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Russia, Liza picks blueberries with her grandma in Ghana Tyra goes to the market with her grandma and in Jordan, Hamza has a day out in town with his dad.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word IS. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Primary
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Years 5-6: Earth and Space - The Solar System
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn about the planets in our solar system, how they orbit the Sun and where the Earth is positioned. Mrs Carmeli will also show you how to make a scale drawing of a planet.

title: So You Want To Be A Designer?
series: So You Want To Be A Designer?
description: See how designers create products that meet user need and are inclusive. We see how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs, and respond to the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: We talk to one of the world's leading architects who shows us round the UK's first zero carbon housing project and visit the Smile plastics factory where anything from old mobile phones is turned into building materials.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Petrol Prices, Sydney Harbour Bridge Birthday, Aussie Astronauts, AFL Science and Nancy Bird Walton for Women's History Month.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode explores an alternate way to communicate numbers using the anchor numbers 5 and 10 and the ancient counting system based on letters from the Roman alphabet.

title: Maddie, The Home And You
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 The Things We Buy
description: Maddie visits an Eco Village where people live in ways that help look after our planet and learns about the small things we can all do in our everyday lives.
description2: Maddie shops for a camping trip and discovers how what we buy travels from different places to the shops.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 2 The Foundation of Rome - 21 April -753
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The Roman world had been certain of the day of its foundation for more than 1000 years. The mythical tale was based on the struggle of its founding twins: sons to a god, Mars, and a virgin, Rhea Silvia.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Our origami expert shows how to make a pretty lily and add a few more for a bunch of colour!

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Pick A Block Of Dates, Any Block
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: A trick you can do by calculating the sum of a 3 by 3 block of dates on a calendar without using a calculator.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Matteo's place, where he and his family show us that courage, determination and a good manager make all the difference when it comes to making your own Italian pasta sauce from scratch!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word It. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: High five for the number 5.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Costume Kit by Cara
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Need a Book Week costume idea? This is Cara's guide to dressing up like 'A Princess in Black'.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Mirror mirror on the wall, who's the best painter of them all? This simple technique can create cool shapes that you can easily turn into art!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Marvel at the mystery as mathemagician Eric turns a bird into a fish! What's the secret to his shape-shifting trick? It's not magic...it's math!

title: Physics House
episode_name: Series 1 Can I Bend Spoons With My Mind?
description: Join Yanick in the Physics House to take a look at the physics behind everyday phenomena we encounter in our homes.
description2: Are people really capable of bending spoons with their minds? Will Yanick be able to work out the physics behind metal fatigue before he breaks every spoon in the Physics House kitchen?

title: Maddie, Space And You
description: Maddie takes us on a journey into space to explore the planets in our solar system, astronauts, rockets and robots.
description2: Join Maddie in space as she explores a spacecraft called the International Space Station.

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Carnaby Cockatoo has best breeding season yet
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: One of Western Australia's most threatened native birds has had its best breeding season yet with many hatching in artificial nests.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Joseph Lyons.

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Archie and Charlie are ten-year-old twins with cerebral palsy. Archie plays wheelchair basketball which gives him a chance to socialise and be part of a team. Archie sees his coach as a role model who inspires him.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Labor politician Penny Wong would tell her 12 year old self that it's ok to be different, that it's okay to be you.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The territorial Garibaldi Fish lets us into his home to see his tidy nest full of eggs and to tell us how he got his mate through his tidiness and mating dance.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Crazy Craters Eric discovers what happens when meteors collide with the earth at many kilometres per second! It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 12 The Battle of Borodino - 7 September 1812
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Apart from Tolstoy's readers, few people actually know about the battle of Borodino, fought some 100 km from Moscow. Even today it remains a landmark and symbol of the Russian resistance to the invader Napoleon Bonaparte.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Superstar Fifty rocks out the Numberland stadium with her shining gold guitar.

description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Shark shows us they're harmless to Humans mostly, but their excellent sense of smell helps them find other food sources to use their many rows of sharp teeth on.

title: MathXplosion

description2: This episode shows how an artist can determine the accurate placement of eyes, ears, nose, chin and lips on the portrait of a face by applying some special body ratios, and using proportions.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Is the metaverse China's chance to outpace the West?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Imagine a world where the internet and reality merge. That's the future being imagined by many in the tech industry. It's called the Metaverse and China Tonight’s Angarad Yeo explains where China fits in the tech race.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Electromagnetic Attraction Eric makes his own magnet with a nail, a battery and a wire. Let's go! It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!

title: The Wacky Word Show

description2: There's ooey gooey, scrumptious, yummy fun in this episode, as Zoey and Lukas explore the power of sensory words.

title: Hey You, What If?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: The good news is that levitation is possible - you just need an incredibly strong magnetic field. The bad news is that any magnetic field strong enough to make you levitate would have some pretty big side-effects!

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Zoey and Lukas explore "twin" words - homonyms and homophones - and host real twins in studio.

description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: A selection of inspirational women offer some words of advice and encouragement to girls today.

description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.

description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Olivia's Dad is a firefighter and she wants to be one too. She is spending the day with Firefighter Kate Evans to learn more about keeping fit, station duties and saving lives.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 12 Years 3-4: Our Place Value System
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Ms Kirszman demonstrates how to measure using 10 as a unit to iterate, rather than using a smaller unit. You will also explore how renaming, using place value parts, can help you when working with numbers.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Years F-1: Addition using a Number Line
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson Miss James teaches the valuable "counting on" strategy to help solve tricky addition problems using number lines. She demonstrates how to use a number line, and provides opportunities to have a go at home.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ever notice that some pairs of words always go together in the same order? Find out in Zoey's song about irreversible word pairs.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: We're listening to the letter G.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Socially aware, Emelie has already set up an ethical sewing business using recycled materials, and now as Teenage Boss her family are worried she will give all their money away to charity and make them go vegetarian.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Here's a song Zoey wrote about different points of view, from her point of view of course!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Artists transforming Northern Territory towns with colour
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: From a concrete jungle to a playground of colour and creation - the street art scene is transforming NT towns. Peter Lacey reports.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actress Aimee Kelly reads extracts from 'My Naughty Little Sister' by Dorothy Edwards, explaining why she loves the book, how it captured her imagination as a child and why she loves to read.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: The Brewery using algae to capture carbon dioxide
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A Sydney craft brewery has teamed up with scientists to try and fix the planet. Harriet Tatham reports.

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: Take A Line For A Walk
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Some artists talk about "taking a line for a walk" when they draw, and Possum likes this idea. He starts with a long rope and it becomes a great picture in the yard, but what will they use to colour in the shapes?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: What is Possum so excited about? He is usually careful, but today he is knocking things over. Wait till you see what he makes when he does slow down and take care.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine sing outside the bistro to attract customers and pay their bill.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. And in this episode we meet a chef who shares a few industry secrets!

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Symbols are shortcuts and are quicker than writing words. Ava shows us some cool tricks to help remember which symbol to use when comparing the value of numbers.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The world is a dark and scary place for this little worm. Even though he's cold and slimey he's still got an awful lot of creatures out to eat him, it's really no wonder he stays underground all the time.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: You can do a survey with any kind of question you want and use a chart to compare the results. Try it out with Ava!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: The Challenger space shuttle disaster was blamed on faulty O-rings. How can probability calculations on random variables help predict the chances of this kind of failure?

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode Maddie is up high! She finds out how really tall buildings are made out of steel and concrete.

title: Play School Story Time: Languages

description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: Ready to go on a bear hunt? Join Osamah Sami and the Play School toys as they read Michael Rosen's classic picture book "We're going on a Bear Hunt" in Arabic!

description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode it's playtime! Maddie is finding out about wind-up toys and how they move along.

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 What is Opportunity Cost?
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: What is the true cost of buying something?  Gen Fricker explains that it's more than just money. Learn about opportunity cost  what it is, why it's a helpful tool and when to use it.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a firefighter.

description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Following 14-year-old Peter, who is the youngest motorbike stunt rider in Europe, as he navigates life in a travelling circus and the daily challenges that entails.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Did you see that? You've got to look really hard to find this walking stick, because he looks just like a stick! This bug tells us that when he's not hiding from everyone that want to eat him, he relaxes and soaks up the sun.

description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THERE. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: In the Black Forest ranges of Germany, Annalena and her younger sister walk through the woods on their way to school. Annalena shares why her walk to school is so magical.

description2: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school?

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Plotting annual numbers of Florida powerboat registrations and manatee killings suggests an uncomfortable relationship for the marine mammals.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Quantifying Chemical Reactions: Stoichimetry And Moles
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Elements combine in definite ratios. The results of a chemical reaction can be predicted using balanced chemical formulas. In this unit, we explore atomic mass, the limiting reactant & the yield of a reaction.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Mr Billy's goat was hungry and when Mr Billy goes to town to buy new trousers, he fed all the animals except the goat with disastrous consequences.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team explore the phenomenon of the earthquake. Clare and Mike train with one of the top international rescue teams Leo takes on a dangerous cliff climb with a very special partner.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Find the strength to be kind to yourself when you're feeling challenged.

title: Play School Story Time: Languages
episode_name: Osamah Sami: We're Going On A Bear Hunt (Arabic)
description: Snuggle up with Big Ted and the gang as Emma Alberici, Kumi Taguchi, Karen Pang, Adam Liaw and Osamah Sami read beloved children's stories in Italian, Japanese, Cantonese, Mandarin and Arabic.
description2: Ready to go on a bear hunt? Join Osamah Sami and the Play School toys as they read Michael Rosen's classic picture book "We're going on a Bear Hunt" in Arabic!

title: Mumbai - Urbanisation and Megacities
description: Using Mumbai as a case study the reasons for rapid urbanisation and the emergence of megacities are explored including the location and importance of Mumbai. Stage 5 Geography and Maths
description2: Using Mumbai as a case study the reasons for rapid urbanisation and the emergence of megacities are explored including the location and importance of Mumbai. Stage 5 Geography and Maths

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids master experiments in forced perspective in trick photography learning about acids in food, pH testing and what happens when acids and alkalis interact and much more.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids try experiments in detecting lies using body signals, how salt creates buoyancy in bodies of water due to density, trick photography using forced perspective, granular convection in a container of nuts and much more.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada see and hear the story of St. Francis as they rescue a bird that has flown through time.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word DOG. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada find themselves in Fontanellato and discover the charming myth of Diana and Atteone directly from the tale of the young painter Parmigianino.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: A shepherd from South Tyrol is forced to guide Italian soldiers, who are attacking his homeland, through the Alps. With talent, luck and teamwork they survive the dangers of the high mountains and even an avalanche.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum wants to do something special and surprise Sally. Digging Sally's garden Possum finds Sally's ring and plans to surprise her with it later. Sally and Possum watch as children visit a wildlife zoo.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word NEED. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Secondary
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn about a property of matter called density. Diana will conduct experiments to answer the question 'Why do things sink and float?', and she will teach you how to calculate the density of objects.

title: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
series: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 Humans Working To Protect And Regenerate Marine Environments
description: Focussing on marine life, interconnectedness of land and sea, and ocean protection and restoration, this series is hosted by Rad Yeo and combines segments from Australia's Ocean Odyssey alongside interviews with experts.
description2: Drs Adriana Verges and Ziggy Marzinelli discuss segments from Australia's Ocean Odyssey on how important kelp forests are for pulling carbon and the work they are doing to reforest crayweed in Sydney in Operation Crayweed.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is baking cookies while Possum clears out things from his tree. Sally gets Possum to help share out the cookies by dividing them into equal piles.

title: BTN Specials
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 4 The Future of Transport
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This BTN special looks at the future of transport. We find out more about electric cars, take a ride on a train that travels at super-high speeds and check out what the cars of the future might look like.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Agriculture is facing huge shocks from climate change and the world's agri-food system is also one of the biggest causes of climate change. How can our food practices become more resilient in the face of climate change?

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make teeny, tiny, totally adorable ladybird crackers, all while learning about counting in groups. 'Bug' your friends with the cutest canapes ever!

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
