description2: Need to multiply a number by 10? By 100? Zero the Hero is at your service!

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Code like a bee. The waggle dance is a nature code that bees know. Learn the code to find the flowers.

title: storyTree
episode_name: The Princess Who Liked To Climb
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Princess Anna is stubborn, so her parents lock her into a tower to be rescued by a prince.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You look so soft and you are very pretty! You are a little fox from the cold countries... its you, the arctic fox! They say that you're the one who has the warmest fur in the whole animal kingdom! Wow!

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Peter Singer, Katie Steele question if the environment has its own ethical interests which overshadow those of humans.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A duckling is teased by his siblings as he looks different, until some beautiful swans see him.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: The stories of the oldest living culture on Earth
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: The ABC's Australia Day special featured vibrant scenes from the spectacular Red Centre. Saskia Mabin reports.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Triple J newsreader Brooke Boney is a Gamilaroi Gomeroi woman who always wanted to tell stories.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Canberra suburbs chosen to trial food recycling program
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: It's called FOGO, and the program gives residents extra bins for food and organic waste from the garden. Harry Frost reports.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Double trouble as Four splits and a pair of tricky twins turn up, the Terrible Twos, who decide it's time to tickle their friends to pieces. Learn that numbers are all made of ones (sometimes twos) with the Numberblocks.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees John Tasioulas, Christian Barry and Peter Singer unpack the rights of an individual and explore intended and unintended consequences.

title: What Makes Me Me?
description: What Makes Me Me? And Other Interesting Questions is an engaging series of short films voiced by Robert Webb, exploring everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Stages 2-3 PDHPE, English.
description2: We explore everyday questions that children ask, and adults often struggle to answer. Today we answer What's Fair?

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word ON. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: What happens when you change the shape of a shape?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Ben and Liam are the hilarious hosts of Triple Js Breakfast radio show. They share their top tips for boys today, and try to figure out what it means to 'be a man'.

title: The Russian Revolution
description: Learn about the downfall of the Romanov dynasty and the evolution of Lenin's Ulyanov family, the Bolsheviks, communism, the notorious Rasputin, rumors of cannibalism and acute poverty during the Russian Revolution. Stages 5-6 History, English.
description2: Learn about the downfall of the Romanov dynasty and the evolution of Lenin's Ulyanov family, the Bolsheviks, communism, the notorious Rasputin, rumors of cannibalism and acute poverty during the Russian Revolution. Stages 5-6 History, English.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WHICH. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: Have you ever wondered what makes news news? We look at the news values that determine which stories we see and hear about and which ones we don't and how those new values can subtly shape the way we see the world.

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: Former world record holder Wilhelmina "Mina" Wylie, along with friend Fanny Durack, were Australia's first female Olympians, swimming their way to victory at the 1912 Stockholm Games. Can Sienna and Paige beat Mina's time?

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Defying gravity is Phil's mission, but maxing out a hoop glider proves to be harder than it seems. Plus: an egg drop with a pumpkin, hovering helium balloons and more anti-gravity fun!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Bouncing around happily on a small dog, is an even smaller flea. Born among thousands of brothers and sisters, this little guy has been making pets itchy for more than 100 million years.

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: 199 to go...it's a challenging but rewarding day in the shearing shed.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Found on the US west coast and Mexico is this cool potato bug. Even though he doesn't have ears, this chill dude dispels some rumours about him, saying he's not poisonous, he's not an invasive pest and he's a vegetarian.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 16 Don't Cook The Cook
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: It's time to dance a dance and rhyme some rhymes with Zoey.

title: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
series: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
description: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Big Weather (and how to survive it) is an emotionally gripping series filmed over one intense summer.
description2: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Craig Reucassel joins fire chiefs and emergency commissioners as they plan for an ominous summer ahead.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Two finds a pair of magic dancing shoes and shows One that everything is better with two, singing and counting things that belong in pairs. Learn all about the number 2 with Numberblock Two.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Tyrone likes dirt bike riding and spending money as soon as he gets it. But as Teenage Boss, he has to lead by example and pack his own lunch so the family can reduce their takeaway and canteen expenses.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: The School Sleepover is exciting...and challenging. Little Js scared of the dark and Big Cuz still sleeps with her teddy. Can they get through the night? Spoken in the Indigenous language of Torres Strait Creole.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Mind How You Go
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Charlotte is an Irish dance champion who isn't planning to make drastic cuts to the family budget - rather, she will earn money by busking, cleaning bins, recycling cans and selling an old Irish dance dress.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Jango dresses up as a king and his friends mistake him for a king visiting Hoopla, so Jango decides to trick them into preparing a King sized feast.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Two. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Number 2 is twice as nice.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How is it Made? Stop Frame Animation
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to an animation studio to see how a special type of film called a stop frame animation film is made using puppets.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Matilda's legend, Kyah Simon remembers her 12 year old self who was always outside, and wanted to play with the boys.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Girl. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 17 Year 2: Decoding Words Using Segmenting and Blending
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: You will learn how to segment words into smaller parts to decode unfamiliar words. Ms McAlister demonstrates how to segment using blends, diagraphs and compound words blend the segments and re-read while enjoying a book.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: They may look small but Pufferfish are actually pretty tough. Nobody should try to eat them as they are one of the most poisonous fish in the sea and they have a few other tricks up their...fins...

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Dinosaur tells a story about a group of space kids living on an asteroid together and the Pencil Pals learn the difference between personal and collective.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Sawfish wakes up from his sleep to show us all of the uses for his saw shaped nose, including catching food, digging and defending himself.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Years F-1: Writing a Procedural Text
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to write a type of procedural text about making a truck out of vegetables. Annaka demonstrates the important features of a recipe.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Marine Biology is the science of life under the oceans. From seaweed to sea lions, all life in the deep blue sea is marine biology.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: "Do eggs grow on trees like apples? Do you dig them up like potatoes?" Sally explains that they come from chickens, but Possum wonders, "What comes first Sally, the chicken or the egg?"

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, La Poulette Beige is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Host of ABC ME, Pip Rasmussen discusses the importance of standing up for other girls, and why she is so proud now.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua, Amalia and Nayan meet children who have been given a unique opportunity to escape poverty and receive a first class education. They meet Puneeth, Vijayalakshmi and James.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Book Report by William
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Williams loves 'Spy Toys' by Mark Powers. Let's find out why!

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Sophie is a nine-year-old girl who has dyslexia and struggles with reading and spelling. She talks about how she feels about the condition and how she finds ways to do things differently.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Tyra, Mario and Anushka. Goes Shopping for Eggs
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Ghana,Tyra is scrubbed from head to toe by her mum for church in India Anushka goes shopping for eggs with her grandad and in Italy, Mario is put through a gruelling workout at his kick-boxing class.

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: This series tells world history through a few major dates. Driven by the delivery of historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life in an accessible and lively manner.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: In this episode, Rachael teaches a special silent lion roar to help everyone when they are feeling 'Angry'.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 12 Angel, Liza and Anushka. Makes Ice Cream
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Peru, Angel picks fruit and turns it into homemade ice cream, in India Anushka works hard in school, speaking two different languages. And in Russia, Liza helps her toy elephant, celebrate a very special birthday.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki and Mo are having a great morning until Mo spills water on his pants and it looks like he's wet himself. Cue the SHAME PAPARAZZI! Mikki and Mo remember every shameful experience they have ever had.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: Minibeast Heroes
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing superpower. Learn fun facts about this hungry bug whose cute appearance disguises a lethal appetite. They're a farmer's best friend!

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: COVID catch-up, Djokovic Drama, Tonga Volcano, Free The Flag and James Webb Telescope.

title: storyTree
episode_name: A Dog For Mrs Muddle Mud-Puddle
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Mrs. Muddle Mud-Puddle is looking forward to buying a dog, but she gets in a muddle!

title: Mumbai - Slum Redevelopment Challenge
description: This programme evaluates the different strategies used in this megacity to improve the lives of its slum dwellers. Stage 5 Geography and Commerce
description2: This programme evaluates the different strategies used in this megacity to improve the lives of its slum dwellers. Stage 5 Geography and Commerce

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a K-Pop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville investigate who is taking Gina Giant's stuff, and their suspect is a flouse - a clever, mouse-like creature. They must solve the mystery of why the flouse is taking things, and where he's stashing them.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric uses a drawer full of socks to demonstrate the theory of probability, showing off an astonishing mathemagical trick while he's at it! You won't believe your eyes! It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a Bollywood-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Storybuilding Superfan Scarlett reviews 'Gangsta Granny' by David Walliams.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Do you ever like to just think about nothing? Hamza does - he's been thinking about the number zero. For a number with absolutely nothing to it, it's awfully important and Hamza investigates why...

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Thinking of doing a daredevil stunt? You'll need to know your angles!

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like not being in charge.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Van Gogh's Chair' by Vincent Van Gogh. Inside the painting she explores Van Gogh's use of colour and light to express feelings.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Mimi is unaware she has broken some old eggs in her apron pocket and wonders what is making such a terrible smell. She asks her friends to help find where the smell is coming from.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in filming a home-made horror movie mixing up lipstick in the kitchen horror-themed photography using inertia in a magic trick how the shape of an aerofoil's wings create lift and lots more.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada visit the incredible Temple of Horiu-Ji in Japan and discover how it is built and how it can face even terrible earthquake!

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 6 Science Years 3-4: Transfer of Heat
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: Investigate how heat energy can be transferred through conduction. Mrs Bhardwaj explains what conduction is and demonstrates an investigation to show which spoon is the best conductor of heat.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: How to paint the very first impression of everything...Berthe Morisot explains to Mati and Dada the Impressionism's segrets... with some tea and croissant!

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to be queer.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Something is missing from the yard. When Possum works out what it is, he starts a new learning adventure. Don't give up, Possum this will be fun!

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: New technology and processes are combining with traditional textiles to create a new generation of smarter, more technical products than ever before.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Sebestian hikes through Chilean mountains where he lives and passes by some small streams with steam and snow fields. How is it possible that water turns into steam? Sebastian investigates further with some fun experiments.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are part of the feline family, the same family as cats. You look like them, but much bigger! The black panther is also a leopard with very dark fur, but if you look closely, you will see that it too, is spotted!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make a print of your house or favourite place with this easy printing project!

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: How do you max out an egg drop? With pumpkins, of course! Material science is the focus of this episode: nitinol, ulexite, carbon nanotubes, hagfish slime, aerogel and a great deal of squashed pumpkins.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Bertie steals his friend's pet rabbit for his magic show. He wants to raise money to buy a present for his brother Eddie who's coming home from the war. It's 1918.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a very original animal! You live in the fresh water of the mountain lakes of Mexico. And you have super powers: if you injure yourself, you can make your damaged organs grow back!

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: An eight-year-old boy is expelled from Germany to Poland in the middle of the night in the so-called Polkenation. He escapes to England on the Kindertransport, only to experience the worst of the Blitz in Coventry.

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Cockatoo shares a story about Baker Mole who wanted to make the best loaf of bread in the whole world, and the Pencil Pals learn a trick to help with descriptive writing.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: Whilst getting a snack at the local corner store, The Stickie Gang explore the days in the week and try not to get confused talking about yesterday, today and tomorrow.

title: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
series: You Can't Ask That In The Classroom
description: Tailored for a younger audience, these special classroom editions of YCAT provide unique insights into the lives of diverse Australians. Stage 5 Geography, English, PDHPE.
description2: What does being deaf feel like? What do deaf people wish they could hear? Through sign and speech, eight profoundly deaf Australians give a unique insight into their lives in this special classroom edition of YCAT.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer, Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to plate journey of the humble potato at Farmer Tim's farm in South Australia.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Comparing the activity and calorie expenditure levels of Western office workers and African hunter gatherers adds some surprising new data to the science of obesity.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Are you ready for the big dance number? Numberblock Twenty struts his stuff and dances the Two Tens Tango.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Sarah Hanson Young is a Greens party senator for South Australia, and was named a World Economic Forum, Young Global Leader in 2016.

title: Mini Lessons
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: With a torch, Mrs Bhardwaj explains how shadows can change in direction and size. She encourages you to complete an investigation into how tree shadows change in length and direction during the day.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: If your neighbour is being too noisy, what can you do and what should you say?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks put on a talent show full of terrific number tricks - but it doesn't quite go according to plan.

title: Smart Materials
description: With extraordinary access to the latest research and development, the show explores cutting edge smart materials finding out how they are made, how they work and what their potential applications are now and in the future. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: This episode examines the properties, characteristics & applications of some of the smart materials used in the graphics industry. Including labels & packaging that use thermochromic inks, emergency & safety signage & more.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Starfish shows us how they walk, see, and eat, and all without bones to hold them up.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Journalist Jan Fran offers her 12 year old self some advice - "Trust your instinct!"

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actress and comedian Nina Wadia reads extracts from 'Lizzie Zipmouth' by Jacqueline Wilson and explains why she loves the book.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: You've got to be quick if you want to catch the grown up Junebug, he'll only be an adult for 3 weeks during the month of, you guessed it, June! This clumsy little fellow had to hide underground for the last 9 months.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Feeling a little itchy? It could mean you're sharing a bed with this little guy, the bed bug. Actually you're probably sharing your bed with a lot of bed bugs, because they really like to share.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: I want to make a spaceship but grandpa does not have the tools for that. Where to go and how to make my creative project a reality?

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Elvis memorabilia makes it way from Graceland to Bendigo
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Hundreds of items owned by Elvis Presley are on show at an exhibition in Bendigo launched by his former wife Priscilla Presley.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Guys with short locks, never fear! There are still a lot of looks you can try and we've got 5 to help you mix it up!

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Sailfish explains how they swim so fast and how they put up a fight against predators, especially humans.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Reflections are remarkable. Possum enjoys learning about mirrors. But what is going on in the yard? Is this a reflection too?

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Age no barrier for teenage medical student
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Darwin teenager Peter Susanto, 15, is studying to become a doctor, and if all goes to plan he'll be fully qualified by the time he's 21. Nibir Khan reports.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get my job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. And in this episode, we get to meet a police officer on duty!

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey wrote a song about abbreviations, a shortened way to write a word.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Commas can really change the meaning of a sentence. Find out how with Zoey's new song!

title: China Tonight
episode_name: The death of street food in China?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Once common, street food is becoming a rarity in China these days, with vendors being run out of town by city management.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Sing along to the Numberblobs counting song with the Numberblocks' favourite friends.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza is looking at and through lenses today on his quest for a perfect pair of glasses. He wants glasses that will let him see all the way to Mars as well as see microscopic stuff.

title: George The Farmer
description: Do you know where your food and fibre comes from? Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate the paddock to product journey of some of Australia's favourite foods.
description2: Join George the Farmer and his mates Simone and Ben as they investigate how apples are grown! You'll be amazed at the incredible technology used to ensure we have access to delicious, crispy apples year round.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Years 3-6: Subtraction with Regrouping
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss White teaches you how to complete formal subtraction problems involving regrouping. She will introduce you to a helpful rhyme, which will assist you with solving tricky subtraction questions.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One finds a friendly furball, two of them tickle Two and soon Numberland is full of fun and fluffies! Have fun counting and learning how to make sevens with the Numberblocks.

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Gemma and Neville explain how waves are formed, the fun things you can do with them, and how to use them to take you back to the beach.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: When two police officers return Sally's missing handbag, Possum gets a chance to learn about how the police help us. Now ready to help solve any mystery, what will Police Officer Possum solve today?

title: JUNK: Flying Fruit Fly Circus
description: See Australia's world famous circus for young people transform a 1940's rural junkyard into a magical landscape. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, Drama, English
description2: The live performance of JUNK by the Flying Fruit Circus at the Sydney Opera House.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make an adorable and frosty Frozen Yoghurt Snowman, all while learning about temperature and time. This treat keeps you busy and cool on those long summer days!

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids undertake experiments in how forms of animation including Thaumatropes and stop motion use persistence of vision, creating movie effects using the illusion of forced perspective and much more.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Surya Deva works with the UN Working Group on Business and Human Rights. He chats to Stan Grant about the alleged persecution of the Uyghur people in north western China.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Zoey and Lukas explore some of the persuasive techniques and language used in advertising and how they're similar to magic tricks.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a canal lock to find out how canal boats travel up and down hill.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in trick photography using forced perspective, buoyant force captured in a bottle, using balloons to experiment with static electricity and electric charges and lots more.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Fierce Earth team travel to Morocco, North Africa and to the Sahara Desert - the biggest hot desert in the world. Leo is put to the test as he finds out how to escape the deadly grip of quicksand.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Create
episode_name: Trash To Treasure: Plastic Bottle Pot Planters
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create a family of pot planters out of old plastic bottles to hang around your home and garden!

title: Rhymes And Songs
description: Presented by lead mentors from the National Music Teacher Mentoring Program, Rhymes and Songs explores material from the much-loved book and music resources by the late Richard Gill AO.
description2: Move and chant along with this quirky arrangement that features wind and percussion instruments, exploring self-expression.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: The outlandish Arcimboldo dazzles Mati and Dada with his fantastic multiple image paintings.

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 40 Don't Worry, Keep Writing
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Spelling mistakes, weird sentences, wrong punctuation, rhymes that don't really rhyme... it's all okay because you can rewrite it a bunch of times!

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: A little boy and a game of hide and seek bring Mati and Dada to the atelier of one of the world's greatest artists.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Thi Yain Da is 11 years old & lives as a monk in Yangon, a city in Myanmar. Every day he strikes a big clock in his monastery & starts to meditate. But meditating can be quite difficult when you hear a lot of noise around you

title: Fall In Love With Music
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2:
Listeners are encouraged to grasp larger chunks or "paragraphs" of musical information. Mozart's clever Variations on Ah! vous dirai-je Maman, K. 265/300e also for piano solo, reinforces the concept of open-minded
listening.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Ethan Hawke looks at the greatest productions of Shakespeare's Macbeth as he uncovers the true story behind the cursed 'Scottish Play'.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: The Hoopla cafe door is stuck, Mimi is inside and everybody else is outside. All her friends try to help fix the door and rescue Mimi in time for morning tea.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Petra gathers lots of berries & wants to know what makes the berries sour & what sourness actually is. She does all kinds of experiments to find out more but the best experiment can only be seen when it's dark.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Anish lives in the mountains of Ganesh, in Nepal. He travels to school through the jungle, but has no fear of the bears and tigers he could meet along the way.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Ah, wolf, I know you well. I've heard many stories about you - it was you that wanted to eat the three little pigs, right?! You're part of the same family as dogs and foxes... and by the way, you're very similar!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop is fixing Mimi's teapot with very sticky glue, it's so sticky that everyone in Hoopla gets stuck together. How are they going to get unstuck?

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Dolphin - Gowonda.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is outdoors finding out about things that use the wind. She finds out how a kite works when it flies high in the sky and uses a special device to measure the wind speed.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 3 Much Ado About Nothing with Helen Hunt
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Much Ado About Nothing is one of 13 plays that Shakespeare set in Italy, a country that was warm, sensuous and inviting for any 16th-century Englishmen writing about lovers.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Twelve and friends go on a spectacular space mission to save Numberland from the mysterious Block Star.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is sorting plant pots from the garden. She asks Possum to help but Possum ends up sorting the pots by colour instead of size. They head inside so Sally can teach Possum to sort things by colour, size and shape.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Zacheo lives with his family on a wildlife farm east of the Namibian capital, Windhoek. Each day, Zacheo leaves the lions, leopards and monkeys and travels to the noisy and lively capital to attend school.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: One city surveyed the happiness of its residents. Two-way tables help organise the data and tease out relationships between happiness levels and opinions about aspects of the city itself.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Not having clients is really getting Mikki down and she might have to give up her psychology practice. Can she learn how to be resilient during tough times with a little help from gymnast and Ninja Warrior, Olivia Vivian?
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: It is of course important we all learn to go to the toilet... on the toilet. Is there a more important lesson in life? We don't think so.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Waruwi discovers a platoon of marines led by a young drummer boy coming though the bush. The cow they're after has wandered into her camp and she has to find a way to put them off the track.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: One of life's great pleasures is watching our kids learn everything from scratch.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: A powerful and beautifully animated documentary that uses the first-person testimony of Summer, a 12 year-old living with epilepsy.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: What's your favourite colour? It's an easy question...isn't it? Unfortunately for Rich, Matt doesn't think so.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: It's Round Day! Roh teaches Boxy and Tri about the calendar.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode targeted at the Primary maths curriculum Stefan visits an organic farm in Devon to uncover how ordering events, patterns and measuring can help work out what's good for the environment.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Ew, what's that smell? Meet the greenbottle fly, a lover of all things gross and smelly. No matter where you are in the world, if you've got something smelly around, you can bet the greenbottle fly will show up to eat it.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The number friends all want to do different things today, so rocket Ten finds a clever way to do them all.

title: Deadly Family Portraits: Electric Mimili
description: Robert Fielding and Zaachariaha Fielding tell their story about reconnecting to culture and identity in their home of Mimili, in the far north-west of South Australia.
description2: Robert Fielding and Zaachariaha Fielding tell their story about reconnecting to culture and identity in their home of Mimili, in the far north-west of South Australia.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Calum doesn't care about the war and won't practise boring air raid drills. While he is off on his bike, German bombers fly over the city. Clydebank is attacked, and Calum must get to his mother quickly...

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: In this mindfulness practice, we learn how to lead our minds back to the present moment.

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: Come and visit a home from the 80s - Some familiar technology is starting to appear in homes microwaves, computers and mobile phones, but they all look much bigger than what we use today!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
episode_name: Series 1 How We Change The World
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: How do these amazing women change the world? In so many ways!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Meteorologists use histograms to map when lightning strikes and this visualisation technique helps them understand the data in new ways.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The sporty Football Fish shows us how they lure in food and lets us take a peak at their personal life with their much smaller mate.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko isn't listening to some important information and ends up taking a tumble. Can Bird, Dog and Keeko come up with a way to keep each other safe?

title: Hey You, What If?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: In this episode we flatten the earth like a pancake to find out just how bonkers a flat earth would be. Gravity would be completely different with everything pulled towards the centre.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will lean how to Jive and perform their routine on a breezy tropical island.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Muhammad's place, where we go on a journey through Pakistan. Have you even seen a curry made with over 13 different herbs and spices? Well, buckle in for this taste sensation!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: It's always lucky with the number 7.

title: China Tonight
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: The Lunar New Year is a time of celebration, red envelopes and wishes for the future. For many Chinese people, it's also a time to visit Feng Shui masters and fortune tellers to find out what’s in store for the year ahead, a practice that's now banned in mainland China. Annie Louey has more.

title: War On Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: In Part 3, Craig Reucassel explores the impact that coffee cups & fast fashion have on our environment. He examines our obsession with fast fashion - an issue causing an environmental crisis globally. #WarOnWasteAU

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: It's a world full of W.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Artist Vernon Ah Kee paints larger than life portraits of his family members to create contemporary images of Aboriginal people rooted in real life. Follow him as he prepares to paint his grandmother's portrait and revisits the people and places that shaped him.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will be mashing up Ballet and Tutting and show their balancing skills on floating rocks.

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: At Aunt Delilah's performance where she plays the big bad wolf, Oleander mollycoddles Baby Massimo. She tries to protect him, but he keeps wriggling away! He gets on stage and even stops the wolf!

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Brielle from Dunsborough, WA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: A year ago I could hear everything, now I hear nothing.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: If you promise not to be too distracting, you can witness the world high-jump champion, the froghopper. With big eyes, like a frog, and incredibly powerful back legs, this olympian can leap up to 71 centimeters.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Magnets have poles - when you put opposite ones together, they attract.  But when you put the same ones together, they repel. Could we find magnets powerful enough to repel each other and float Phil off the ground?

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Cookie Cutter Shark will eat anything and he has light emitting organs to look like smaller fish to lure any prospective fish so he can feast on them.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Tony Coady, Monima Chadha and Bronwyn Finnigan show how we can live in a society with competing moral codes and differing religious views.

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: One Culture Football provides a community for young people from migrant and refugee backgrounds to build friendships through the world game.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Norfolk Island community embark on woodland restoration project
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: On Norfolk Island, work is underway to restore woodlands and grasslands that existed before Europeans arrived, to provide habitat for threatened and unique species.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word GOOD. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: What happened in the year 1000? Nothing: this date does not correspond to any major event. The passage from the first to the second millennium was not really an event for those who lived through it.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: The 'setting' is an important story writing tool. Learn how it can help you to be more creative!

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Peter Singer, Katie Steele question if the environment has its own ethical interests which overshadow those of humans.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks present their very own, very numbery version of the classic tale The Three Little Pigs and the Big Bad Square.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WE. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Storing energy is how a home-made spool racer works. But can Phil build one out of a giant cable spool!? Plus: a run of giant dominoes, a maxed out craft stick chain reaction, mouse-traps and ping pong balls.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Did numbers always look the way they do now? Ava explores the history of numbers from around the world.

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1940s Melbourne, teenage milkman Conway Tighe got up in the early hours every morning to harness his horse and complete his milk deliveries on time. Will Jeffrin and Harry match his dedication and get the job done?

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric learns how yeast makes bread rise and how it can even inflate a balloon! It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: When Fitina and her family fled war in the Congo for the safety of Shepparton, they were separated from her twin sister Neema.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Paul Keating.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric learns how to make butter from cream. Let's explore the process. It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Phoebe is a seven-year-old girl with type 1 diabetes. Although she has this condition, she wants to be treated as a normal girl. She has to resist eating sweets, difficult at times like Halloween.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Putting It All Together
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: The members of the Amphion String Quartet join Maestro Maull for this opportunity to experience an entire movement of classical music.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Numberland is rocked by the arrival of superblock Eight, known to his friends and fans as Octoblock. Learn all about the number 8 with Numberblock Eight!

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 This With That And That
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Using clothes to make different pairs, this episode introduces the concept of possibilities (possible outcomes) and combinations (different combinations and total outfit combinations).

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Luther: The Monk Who Changed The Church
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Now over 500 years since Martin Luther's challenge to the Catholic Church, Pocket Compass explores the relevance of the event that kickstarted a revolution that continues to resonate in Australian lives today.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
