description2: Intercep a secret message. Eric cracks the code to decrypting the ancient cipher box used by  Roman Emperor, Julius Caesar over 2000 years ago!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Who would have thought you could make a cute bunny rabbit from a square piece of paper... hop to it!

description2: Use watercolours to recreate your favourite beach waves! Surf's Up!

title: Everyday English
episode_name: Episode 15 Social Media And The Internet
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: We use the internet and social media sites all the time to stay connected and understand what's happening around us. In this episode, learn the vocabulary you need to know to talk about this topic.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Cleaner air travel solutions and hydrogen fuelled planes
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Europe correspondent Nick Dole looks at one possible solution to cleaner air travel: hydrogen fuelled planes.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Stan of the Swamp's home is overrun by honkweeds - annoying plants that can't stop honking. Wally, Libby Light Sprite, and Stan embark on a journey to find the one bug that can make the weeds go away: the humbug.

title: Many Lands, Many Seasons
description: This series explores six Aboriginal seasonal calendars to find out how the unique knowledge they contain helps the traditional owners to hunt, fish and collect bush tucker at the best time!
description2: Come visit Nauiyu, Daly River in the top end of the Northern Territory and discover the thirteen seasons of the Ngan'gi Seasons calendar.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Again. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: What happens when you put your characters in challenging situations?

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Gina Giant is throwing an "Act Like Your Hat" party. Each friend has to pick a hat from Gina's trunk and act like it. The fun escalates when Wally makes the hats magic - suddenly everyone has the power of their hats!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: Learn more about travel options, tenses and idioms in this episode of Everyday English.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Today Maddie is using her senses to see and hear! She visits a speaker factory to understand what happens when we listen to music from a speaker.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.

title: Create
episode_name: Back To School: Pencil Case Decoration: Pom Pom
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Add a personal touch to your pencil case by creating your own pom pom decoration! Follow the steps and make them for your friends as a great back to school pressie!

title: China Tonight
episode_name: What do Pacific countries want, when it comes to China?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Australia's long had a close relationship with the nations of the Pacific, but increasingly there's a third wheel – China.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mikki is having a great day until she arrives at her psychology practice and has a visit from an old toxic friend, Scarlett. Mikki needs to understand how to talk to a toxic friend and how to stand up for herself.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like being Muslim.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a hula and cha-cha-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Does Classical Music Make You Smarter?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Does listening to Mozart as a baby help you become a genius? No. We bust that myth and ask experts about the legit ways music improves brain power.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: Do We Even Need Instruments Anymore?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Can instruments be anything? We look at history of instruments, see if people can tell the difference between a 'real' and 'virtual' clarinet, and Linda and Dan challenge each other to a $20 DIY instrument build off.

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Office pet, Marjory Mofax, has been ill for a while. When her sudden death really upsets Mo, he gets a visit from the Sad Panda. Mikki needs to cheer up her bestie but first she must understand what being sad is all about.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: A gingerbread man who thinks he can avoid being eaten meets a sly fox.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Love. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Put on your mathemagicianal glasses and tag along with Eric! He shows us that math can be found everywhere! From pineapples to pine cones, we explore how math applies to living objects and natural structures alike.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Just because this robot has a heart of steel doesn't mean he is any less fond of Valentine's Day and our ABC ME artist is here to create one for you to love!

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Christians believe Jesus is a man who preached and performed miracles and died on the cross but was resurrected. But for historians, the crucifixion is the least unreliable indicator of the Jesus' existence.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Rachael is feeling 'Sad', like she is carrying a big grey cloud full of rain, but we all know that if you share your sadness the cloud may become a little lighter to carry.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: Science is how we try to get to the truth of the matter. How do we learn? Question what you think you know and have an open mind. Experiment, record results did you discover something new? That's science, that's beautiful.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 9 Anushka, Hamza and Liza. Picks Cucumbers with Grandma
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In India, Anushka is getting ready for school - but running late in Jordan, Hamza is helping out at his dad's barbershop and in Russia, Liza is picking cucumbers in her grandma's greenhouse and learning how to pickle them.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: American-style rodeo group launches to help women crack into the sport
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A new American-style rodeo group has launched in the central highlands to help women crack the male-dominated sport.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Cody has so much fun with an old boomerang that has amazing powers so legends say.

title: Weirdy Rhymes
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 The Gasset Had A Little Flot
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: The patient Gasset eventually deals some justice on his little snotty friend the Flot.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: In this episode of Everyday English, learn to talk about food and meals from a restaurant.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 19 Tyra, Liza and Mario. Goes to Choir Practice
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Ghana Tyra learns English at school, in Russia Liza spends the morning at the playground trying to beat her twin brother at standing on one leg. And in Italy, Mario sings a song in front of a whole choir.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Student creates life saving bushfire app during lockdown
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A Year 12 student has created a life saving bushfire app during lockdown that uses artificial intelligence to map out which areas are safe once a bushfire starts. Ursula Malone reports.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Diet cola and mints! A fun experiment that's even more awesome when maxxed out. Air pressure bubbles through this episode, including marshmallows in a vacuum chamber, pulling an egg into a flask and carbonating pickle juice!

title: Bug Technology
description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: See how a bug that can syphon water up it's legs is inspiring scientists looking to move water up high rise buildings without requiring a power source.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family travel back to the 1910s when the first census of the Commonwealth was released, World War One broke out and the end of the war introduced the observation of Remembrance Day.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Uncle Tobias is joined on the beach by two young boys for a day of hunting, fishing and stories of the old days.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WILL. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: What happens when we take a moment to let our mind settle?

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Learn about rain, rein and reign - some of the most commonly confused homophones in the English language.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: When Hazy is feeling unwell, her friend Hazel cares for her, and together they go on a magical adventure to learn about kindness.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out about books! First, she visits a library to learn how all the different types of books are stored in different sections.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HOT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Starting with a small, syringe powered hydraulic arm, Phil maxxes things out by learning how to use the mechanical advantage of hydraulics to crush stuff!!! Plus: Filtering water, the Archimedes screw, hydro dipping and more!

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 4 Organising Atoms And Electrons: The Periodic Table
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: As scientists discovered more and more chemical elements, they began developing systems to organise the elements by their chemical properties, leading to the modern periodic table.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: Filmed in Bangladesh, one of the world's largest textile manufacturers, this resource explores the social cost of our cheap textiles. With footage filmed inside textile factories, it explores the issues of sweatshop labour.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth special team take on one of the most feared forces on the planet - the Volcano. Dougal explores the secret lava tubes of Etna and climbs Stromboli for a face-to-face encounter with an erupting volcano.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Colourful Weather
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: What's red, wide, high, travels long distances and can move really fast? And it's really, really dusty. A dust storm! The outback is a huge source of dust, so unsurprisingly, dust storms are common. But why are they red?

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: When you're in the kitchen, dont forget the most important ingredient - math!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: On his birthday, Zap decides to deliver his parcels quickly by going down his slide with all the parcels. With so many parcels Zap gets stuck. His friends must come to the rescue so his birthday party will be saved.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: In this episode of Create you can mix and match your decorations to give your plants a unique home with these easy to create planter pot design ideas!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: With a square nose and wide wings, this paper plane is something different. But don't worry this glider will keep going and going through the air. Check out this episode!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: It's a rainy old day and everything is getting wet. Sally puts on her gumboots and gets her umbrella. Meanwhile, Possum stays dry underneath a branch until it breaks, getting him all wet.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The team explores the threat of landslides in the UK. Leah travels to the Isle of Wight to discover why it's under the constant threat of eroding rocks. Dougal explores the biggest sinkhole in Britain.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Spinach & Feta Dino Puffs
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make delicious prehistoric dino treats, all while learning about time and fractions. Serve up these delicious snacks and impress your friends with all your dinosaur knowledge!

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: Many farming properties across southern Australia have dry-stone walls. Constructed mostly during the the 19th century, they were built to clear land and define boundaries, but their history precedes European settlement.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie has a bad cold and her sneezes and coughs sound like animal noises. Her friends think there are wild animals in her garden and try to rescue her.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Sam, a child convict, is working for a man who's never there. He's on his own in the bush and in charge of a villainous goat. When the goat disappears Sam spends a night in the scary bush to get her back.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Thousands of children call Kibera home, living by their wits everyday. Some of them sleep rough while others live in orphanages, but life here really takes place on the streets.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word BUS. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: All aboard! In this episode we meet a Train Driver, and learn some tips to help get you on track for becoming a train driver one day.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Viola lives in Vienna, the capital of Austria. She rides her scooter through the city to school with her friends and younger brother, Joachim. Viola cares about social issues, such as the environment and poverty.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Artist Ai Weiwei on the real cost of activism
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Ai Weiwei was once described as the ‘most influential artist of our time’. In recent years, his criticism of the Chinese government has put him at odds with authorities - and out of his home country.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word TALL. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello mister Japanese macaque!! Youre a very special monkey! Youre the only one in the world that lives in such a cold place... you're a snow monkey! Luckily, your nice beige fur is very warm!

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Lifeguard.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a bird with short legs, webbed feet and a flat bill. You are part of the same family as swans and geese. You live in marshes, ponds, lakes or rivers. Your plumage changes a lot according to the periods of the year.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Li Memgke lives near Sandouping in the shadow of the Three Gorges Dam.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: The Bodacious Box Buddies are putting on a fabulous acrobatic circus show.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally and Possum play cricket in the backyard. Possum hits the ball under the bench and then over the fence. Sally shows Possum the difference between over and under and then they watch school kids doing an obstacle course.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: A song to remind us all that deep down people are all the same and there is no such thing as a boy or girl colour. 'Colours' is everyone's game!

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: In this episode targeted at Key Stage 3 Stefan visits a snail farm in Dorset and compares lamb and snail meat by looking at area, fractions and ratios.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: When Rose was eight her mother developed a spinal nerve condition that resulted in paralysis. Rose suddenly had to manage the household and take on adult responsibilities. Becoming the carer required her to grow up fast.

title: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
series: Deep Dive Into Australia's Ocean Odyssey
description: Focussing on marine life, interconnectedness of land and sea, and ocean protection and restoration, this series is hosted by Rad Yeo and combines segments from Australia's Ocean Odyssey alongside interviews with experts.
description2: Director of Australia's Ocean Odyssey Nick Robinson talks about clown fish life cycle and their relationship with anemones. He then explains how hundreds of turtles are born but only a lucky few survive to return years later.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out about the life cycle of plants! She visits a gigantic tomato growing farm.

title: Pip's Tips
description: Our very own Pip Rasmussen will give us her take on how to tackle everything in life - from bouncing back from online bullying, to bagging the best bargains when thrift shopping. If you need a tip, hit up Pip! Stages 2-4 PDHPE
description2: The online world can be an amazing place! But it can also be unsafe. Pip has some tips on how to enjoy being online whilst staying safe!

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: BIG introduces us to his friend Small. They find ways to play despite their size difference and show us how small friends can be a big help.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Secondary
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Years 7-8: Day and Night
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, Diana will teach you how the Earth rotates and revolves in space, and then she'll show you how to make your own model to answer the question: "How do day and night occur?"

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Ogre Doug start a club for explorers and set out to find the rare Chickephant. But trouble brews when Bobgoblin starts a rival club with Hattie the Witch.

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: This Online Safety special looks at how your digital footprint might affect you later in life. Learn about some rules that help keep kids safe online and find out more about online trolls.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Training for the next diving competition, we meet the water beetle. Named for her love of water, she can conserve air beneath her wings to help her stay underwater for a really long time.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: In today's episode, Maddie is finding out where our food comes from. She visits a cereal factory to see how wheat biscuits are made.

title: storyTree
episode_name: Papaka And Koura: A Maori Folk Tale
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: The story of why Papaka the Crab and Koura the Crayfish started to live in the sea.

title: Atom Bond
description: Shrouded in the mysterious world of espionage, Agent Gold is on a mission exploring the complex world of chemical bonds. This reimagining of a classic animation takes a comprehensive look at covalent, ionic and metallic bonding. Secondary Science.
description2: In the hideout, Chlorine is trapped in Carbon's buckyball & Gold is put behind bars. When released, Ethanol takes him on a guided tour of the completed Project D. It's giant DNA molecule which will bring Planet Earth to life.

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Plight of the Bumblebee
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Ecologist Anja Murray meets with scientists and citizen scientists to try and understand why pollinator numbers including wild Irish bees are falling so rapidly.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In the warm shallow waters of the West Coast of America we meet the Halibut and he shows us that they have both eyes on the camouflaged side of the body, so they can see above while they hide in the sand.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1928 - Bridie just wants to hang out with her big sister Kath and best friend Lorna, and be in on their secrets. Talking her way into tagging along, Bridie sets off for what is meant to be a day of harmless fun.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Hackers are specialists in detecting computer vulnerabilities. Improvement or diversion, how do their actions advance system security?

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Circle of Life Eric uses a hula-hoop to mark out an area in the grass. Now Eric can find, count and catalog all the creatures he finds in that space! Wow, there are so many! It's not magic, it's science... it's STEM!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Alfred Deakin.

title: Water Wisdom
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 The Coorong And Lower Lakes
description: Fresh water systems are fundamental to Australia's first people who have nurtured a deep understanding of water. The Water Wisdom series shares this knowledge through the voice of Aboriginal communities.
description2: This episode of the Water Wisdom series shares the knowledge of fresh water systems through the voice of the Ngarrindjeri people who have managed water in the Coorong and Lower lakes region for thousands of years.

title: Maddie, Space And You
description: Maddie takes us on a journey into space to explore the planets in our solar system, astronauts, rockets and robots.
description2: Maddie finds out how space rockets work and how they take astronauts into space.

title: Physics House
episode_name: Series 1 Why Does My Toast Land Buttered Side Down?
description: Join Yanick in the Physics House to take a look at the physics behind everyday phenomena we encounter in our homes.
description2: Why is it that toast usually seems to land buttered-side down? Is it the weight of the butter? Or are there other forces at work? Join Yanick in the Physics House and get to the physics behind your ruined breakfast.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: In Africa there lived a father who sent his daughters on a quest to find and marry the Chief.

title: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
series: Doing It In Public: The Kaldor Projects Education Shorts
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 6 Michael Landy's Unrealised Projects
description: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.
description2: Weaving together past and present stories of ephemeral works, the narrative unfolds across many of the Kaldor projects, revelling in the public moments of John Kaldor's and shares the delights of his private passion for art.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: It's cray what you can make from clay! Our artist shows how you can make a feathered friend who won't fly away!

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Eric makes an anemometer to determine the speed of the wind. You can make one, too! It's not magic, it's science, it's STEM!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: One has found a way to keep adding Ones all the way to Ninety-Nine. But what on Earth comes next?

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Add some twists to your ponytail to create a new look from an old favourite!

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actors Scott Haran & Percelle Ascott read extracts from 'The Falcon's Malteser' by Anthony Horowitz. They explain why they love the book and share how it captured their imaginations.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: What's the most powerful number in the universe? One billion? One trillion? One googol? It's zero! There's nothing to it! It's not magic...it's math!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Find out how to create a special occasion look by twisting your hair into a beautiful braid! It's also the perfect opportunity to accessorise!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: In this episode, we see how accurate estimates are arrived at by using information about many things in our everyday lives, in logical ways.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Emotion sometimes pushes us to share information on the Internet without having checked it beforehand. Info or intox, how to know the truth?

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Robert Menzies.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Twelve-year-old, Chelsea saw the Teenage Boss experiment as a once in a lifetime opportunity to buy as much junk food as possible so her first grocery shop does not go down well with the family.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word FOR. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 24 The Ruler of All I Survey
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Queen Ava explores a variety of tools to measure really small things and really big things!

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Determined country girl, Molly, 12 years is keeping a tight budget when a large bill to fix the brakes on the horse float comes in, so she decides to earn some money making the horse treats she's famous for.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally has hurt her foot playing sport and Possum is concerned when he wakes up and finds a note on his door. When she returns with crutches to help her walk, he learns more about how doctors help people.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava made a computer game! IF you like her song about it THEN sing along!

title: Convict Kids
description: Australia was a British penal colony between 1788 and 1868 and over 160,000 convicts were 'transported' here. Learn about these child convicts, why they were transported, how they lived in the colony and what became of them.
description2: As a convict kid, once you served your usual sentence of 7 or 14 years, you would still have had the majority of your life ahead of you to make a fresh start.

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Pounce and Gemma tell us about their heroes, lifeguards - what they do, how they train, and how you can participate at your own beach.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Get to know the letter O.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You live in cold regions where it snows in winter time. During the warmer seasons, you are brown on top and white underneath. And then, during winter, your fur turns totally white!

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A six-year-old girl is violently separated from her parents during Nazi occupied Paris, and how she was kept in hiding throughout the war working in an isolated rural farm.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word THEN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: It's carnival time and Zoey and Lukas discover the many ways you can say things without saying a word.

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Tyrone used to be an angry, alienated kid who found it was easier to spend time on the streets. That all changed when he was offered a full scholarship at a prestigious private school. That day was his MY:24.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: E is everywhere.

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Years 3-6: Calculating Change using Vertical Subtraction
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss White teaches you how to complete formal subtraction problems involving regrouping. She will teach you how to regroup multiple times, and help to calculate how much change you would receive while shopping

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Mylie loves animals and growing trees. She is spending the day with Katie Finlay, a successful orchardist to learn more about Mother Nature and how to run a productive farm.

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Trois Petits Chats is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Truc, Rhys and Anushka. Plays Hide and Seek
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Vietnam, Truc, is having a special breakfast with her mum in Canada, Rhys is helping his pet dog Diva celebrate her birthday. And in India, Anushka is playing hide and seek with her brother Akhilesh.

title: My Little Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Dans La Foret Lointaine
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, Dans La Foret Lointaine is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a disco-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Koolkatt tries to hypnotize Hamza with spirals. Why are spirals so captivating? To find out, Hamza meets a rebellious snail, shakes his crazy helix hair, and finds the biggest spiral around, The Milky Way galaxy.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: What's your favourite time of day? Play time? Snack time? Reading time? The Stickie Gang enjoy talking about what they like to do at their favourite times of day.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn about grooving in a fun routine with Miss Kylie.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Taiwan preparing for war with China, says country’s Foreign Minister
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Taiwanese Foreign Minister Joseph Wu has urged Australia to increase intelligence sharing and security cooperation.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: In this episode, Rachael is feeling 'Anxious', she uses a candle breathing exercise to help her through the storm.

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Chayenne lives near the beach, loves to surf & wants to find out what a wave is. She makes a wave in a bottle, a wave from marbles, one from candy & lets candles move like a wave, all to prepare her for her final experiment.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: I'm off to the great plains of America to meet a legendary animal... Hello bison! You look so strong! You are from the same family as the cows and the oxen. But you are their big wild cousin...

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word SUN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: How wonderful is Rome! And how amazing is having a guide like Apollodoro of Damascus explaining the ingenious architecture of Pantheon!

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 4 Maths Years 3-4: Equivalent Fractions
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to recognise and use equivalent fractions. Ms Szalek explains how you can write and name equivalent fractions, and then she uses this knowledge to solve a problem about sharing cake equally.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Victor Gao on Australia’s nuclear submarines deal
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: What does China make of Australia’s nuclear subs deal with the US and UK? VP of the Centre for China and Globalisation Victor Gao joins us to discuss.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Rocket Ten and friends blast off into space for a rhyming adventure to visit planets 11 to 20.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, cook, and work in the 1930s? The Great Depression had a significant impact on daily life. Families had to make do with less and couldn't be picky with what they ate or wore.

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids test out experiments in using pulley systems to redistribute weight how boomerangs alter wind resistance in order to return chemical reactions that create pressure-based propulsion and lots more.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: Inside the painting she explores Rego's inspirations and her desire to have viewers make up stories about her works. We explore the techniques Rego used to create her works, and her placement within the artistic world.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Today, we fly away to meet a beautiful bird... A very large bird with a long, pink neck... Did you guess who it is? But yes, the flamingo, of course! Dad and mum feed their little one... with milk!

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: Is a newly-discovered poem really written by William Shakespeare? Using statistical analysis of his known word use, researchers set up null and alternative hypotheses to investigate.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word CAR. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Welcome to Ten's Place, where trainer Ten puts her friends through their paces with a high-energy number workout.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create an indigenous necklace using some of your favourite Australian plants and flowers.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally and Possum are enjoying looking at the night sky. If only they could make it look closer. Skip has just what they need and just the right place to do it from.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: Whether you're dividing up lollies with your friends or dividing up the solar system with aliens, fractions are important!

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Big Cuz is excited - Nannas taking the class out bush to gather pandanus for weaving. But Nanna is called in to work so Big Cuz takes over, with comically chaotic results. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Djambarrpuyngu.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Skip has been working on something amazing and now it is time to see it in action. But Possum has been busy too. Watch carefully!

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Have you ever wondered what video game graphics have in common with broccoli? Fractals, of course. Hamza learns that we can understand the shapes and patterns of nature using math.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza is packing for a vacation, but he can't fit all of his stuff in his suitcase. Origami to the rescue - he takes a nod from the art of Japanese paper folding to make things with a lot of surface area take up less space.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: As lead designers for Finisterre, Tom and Debbie are on a mission - to create the most eco-friendly surf-wear brand in the world. From their HQ in Cornwall to fabric suppliers in Japan.

title: Heywire
episode_name: Series 2020 Heywire winner Brianna from Broome, WA
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Nineteen eye operations to be able to see the world.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: All the clutter around Hoopla gives Zap a great idea, he will organise a swap market so everyone can swap stuff they don't need for things they really want.

title: Hey You, What If?
episode_name: Series 1 You Could Take A Lift To Space?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: In theory it's possible to build a lift into space - but if you took that lift: while you could get to space in a few hours, if you wanted to get weightless you'd have to stay in that lift for about 5 months!

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: Freddie's little brother asks to play with his brand-new toy car, and together they go on a delicious journey to learn that it's more fun to share.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: It is autumn in Hoopla and Jango is having trouble sweeping up all the leaves. So Bop turns Jango's vacuum cleaner into a leaf blower which accidentally blows leaves and dirt all over Jango's friends.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Taking pictures without a camera? Weird? It was Man Ray's method for Rayography and Solarisation. Mati and Dada are taught about these amazing techniques.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: In their musical House of Sound, Greg Foot and Fran Scott explore how brass instruments work and show viewers how easy it is to make a bugle from a piece of hosepipe and a funnel.

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Saya utilises the resources of the eco village where she lives to save money, and her budget is tracking well, until Mum brings home a welcome but expensive surprise!

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Nanna is unwell so Little J and Big Cuz eagerly take over running the house  their way! Fun ways to do housework soon descend into slapstick chaos. Spoken in the Indigenous language of Noongar.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada are transported into a marvellous journey in Venice, on a Gondola together with Canaletto in person!

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: Fake news is big news at the moment! Many experts are worried about the effect that fake stories are having on the media and democracy, but did you know that fake news isn't new?

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop has a lot of things to fix, but today he decides to make things even better than they were before.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Phil tries to build a tower strong enough to not fall apart when shaken in a massive earthquake. Plus: balancing on wood, getting sucked into sand, cookie towers and a table made of people!

title: Wacky Word Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 14 The Curious Question Mark
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ready for another song? This one is all about question marks.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Weave a spider web and explore pattern and symmetry along the way.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Russia Media Freedom, Coral Bleaching, Daylight Saving, Goldilocks Birds, Evonne Goolagong Cawley for Women's History Month

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: The word that makes Chloe's skin crawl is 'midget'.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet the moth, a voiceless critter that dreams of one day being in the spotlight. She tells us about how she loves the light and flower necter but it's a shame she doesn't get more attention like her relative, the butterfly!

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: What if Blake and Mortimer had been right in the Mystery of the Great Pyramid? The history of the seventeen-year reign of Akhenaten, the tenth pharaoh of the 18th dynasty, sometimes still seems to be a historical mystery.

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: I can tell that you are no ordinary fish! You have all sorts of nicknames: the frogfish, the walking Gobi or the mudskipper. You get around by lifting your body with your fins in fact, you use them as feet, and you crawl!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Nayuka Gorrie is a Kurnai/Gunai, Gunditjmara, Wiradjuri and Yorta Yorta woman who lives her dream writing for TV and online.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: School Hours, Indigenous War Cry, Peanut Allergy Treatment, ISS Crash Plan and BTN Investigates: Why do we have names?

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua, Amalia and Nayan explore city life in Bangalore, India. Bangalore is known as the Silicon Valley of India and it attracts young Indian people to seek work and careers there.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Jiewuh Song, Serene Khader, Christian Barry, John Thrasher and Tony Coady examine the nature of borders and how we view migration.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Hanging out wherever there are grazing animals, is the tick. This little guy shares with us all his cool design features that have been helping him suck blood for 146 million years.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Journalist Stan Grant is a Wiradjuri/Kamilaroi man who learnt from his father the importance of being responsible for yourself.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, Mrs Jegers teaches you how to make connections when reading. She demonstrates how to use prior knowledge and clues from her character clue bag to make an inference.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: A little block falls out of the sky, meets her numberling and discovers one wonderful world, singing and counting to one. Learn all about the number 1 with Numberblock One!

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Five and friends set off on a rhyming romp through field and forest but they keep getting mixed up! Learn how to keep numbers in order and find missing numbers with the Numberblocks.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: A mirror reflects everything in front of it. If you place two mirrors at an angle, you will see an ever increasing number of objects as you move the mirrors closer together if the two are parallel, you can see infinity.

title: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
series: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
description: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Big Weather (and how to survive it) is an emotionally gripping series filmed over one intense summer.
description2: After three years of brutal drought and the hottest summer on record, Craig finds himself facing floodwaters as two months of rain falls in just two days, Sydney's heaviest rainfall in 20 years. (Final)

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville are playing superheroes and invite Ogre Doug to join them, but Ogre Doug doesn't know how. Together they come up with the perfect super-persona for Ogre Doug: Captain Animal!

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Peter Bennett was sent to Australia from England under the child migration scheme of the 1950s. He retells of his journey across the seas and of his experiences living and working at Fairbridge Farm School in Molong, NSW.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Wanna know how to build the world's strongest fort? Eric shows us how to build a fort like no other. Get your cushions ready! It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Drisana Levitzke-Gray is a campaigner for deaf people, and was 2015's Young Australian of the year. She promotes the culture and rights of deaf Australians.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The shy Stingray shows us how she hides to catch her food. She tells us that they are related to sharks but very different all the same.

title: I'm A Fish
episode_name: Series 1 I'm A Blue Dragon Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The strange Blue Dragon Fish uses the colours of its' body to hide from predators above and below.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: We meet Goldfish in his tank, where he shows us where he came from and he explains their three month memory and unique ability to see in colour. Goldfish explains they are social animals who love much bigger spaces.
