title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 15 Year 2: Decoding Unfamiliar Words Using Onset and Rime
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to decode unfamiliar words by breaking them up into onset (the starting sound) and rime (the ending of words). Leanne demonstrates how to build and read new words by changing the onset.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum's obstacle run was great fun and he wants to make it again. Sally says he looked like a circus performer and suggests something grander. When guests arrive, will Possum be able to perform as star of his own show?

title: Eco Eye: Sustainable Solutions
description: We investigate the critical environmental issues affecting our world as well as the impact our surroundings have on our physical and mental wellbeing.
description2: Anja explores how nature can be rebalanced with human intervention and why intervention is needed in the first place. Humans have changed nature for a millennia but now we must step in to manage the balance of our habitats.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Allie and her teddy George are lying in bed when they hear a big thunder-storm coming.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum's friend Jay, brings a special surprise for Possum. What has Sally and Jay set up for him in the yard? Jay stays to have fun with Possum pretending they are classmates at school, and who will be the teacher?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: ABC ME's Grace Koh talks about authenticity, and how proud her 12 year old self would be.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Monster has a tummy ache from doing mischief, can the doctor cure her completely?

title: BTN Specials
description: This collection of BTN Specials has been curated to target key areas of the Australian curriculum. They cover a range of learning areas including humanities and social sciences, science and design and technologies.
description2: In this special we find out about native title, learn more about Welcome to Country ceremonies and take a look at the importance of the names of places for our First Nations people.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: In their musical House of Sound, Greg Foot and Fran Scott explore how brass instruments work and show viewers how easy it is to make a bugle from a piece of hosepipe and a funnel.

title: Ecomaths
description: A new way of showing how maths is used in the real world to help create a sustainable future. Stefan Gates meets people using maths to find innovative solutions to the ecological challenges of our age. Stages 3-4 Maths and Science.
description2: Stefan explores the maths of scientific discovery using concentrations in standard form, cumulative frequency graphs and interpreting longitudinal data in a unique trial of fungus at Swansea University.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Building tiny homes to help save threatened species
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Tiny homes are the next big thing in housing design, but for microbats, the could be the key to survival. Inga Stunzner reports.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: The Fierce Earth team travel to Iceland to explore a country created by volcanoes. Dougal dives into the sea and touches the two tectonic plates of Europe and America.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Colourful Weather
description: Colourful Weather brings you the fun and fascinating science behind five very colourful weather events. Hosted by Nate Byrne, this is weather for kids, presented in a way they can understand and get excited about. Stages 3-5 Science and Geography
description2: Sunrise and sunset can be incredibly colourful, with vivid red, gold, orange, purple and pink colours. But you'll never see a blue or green sunset. Do you know why?

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Lobster shows off their large claws, speedy swimming, and good smell to make up for their poor eye sight for when they find themselves in a pinch.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is learning about colours and how by mixing the primary colours red, blue and yellow together, we can make new colours called secondary colours!

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Sophie is a nine-year-old girl who has dyslexia and struggles with reading and spelling. She talks about how she feels about the condition and how she finds ways to do things differently.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Watch our artist mould a face out of clay and see if you can create a 3D portrait of your family and friends!

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Everyone in Hoopla is cleaning out junk when Mimi finds her old ski outfit. She decides she wants to go skiing, but it isn't going to be easy on a summer's day with no snow at all.

title: Chemistry: Challenges And Solutions
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Making Molecules: Lewis Structures And Molecular Geometrics
description: Teaches concepts of general chemistry by presenting real challenges in energy production, materials development, biochemistry & environmental protection. The course zeroes in on core topics taught in introductory chemistry. Stages 4-6 Science
description2: Molecules form when individual atoms create bonds by sharing electrons. Understanding how atoms combine to make molecules allows scientists to predict many of the physical and chemical properties of substances.

title: First Nation Farmers
description: For millennia Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples have harvested Australian flora and fauna for food. Landline presents stories from its archive exploring the past and future of Australia's First Nation Farmers.
description2: After World War I, a grateful nation granted land to tens-of-thousands of returned Australian soldiers, but not to nearly all of the 800 Indigenous men who also fought for their country. Their fight for equality continues.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Spooky Brains And Eyeballs
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make Spooky Brains and Eyeballs (spooked out spaghetti and meatballs), all while learning about fractions and counting in groups.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: A song to help children understand the importance of a good night's sleep.

title: Small Hands In A Big War
series: Small Hands In A Big War
description: This series gives young viewers an exciting insight into the era of the First World War. Every episode unfolds in a different country and has one child as protagonist, whose story represents the story of the First World War.
description2: A ten-year old boy loses his parents in the war. The only thing left to him is his belief in the power of Czarist Russia. He finds refuge in the Russian army and comes to the Eastern Front.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: The first tomato of the season is so delicious that Squidgie grows more and more and more until her friends are sick of eating them. No one wants to tell Squidgie because they don't want to hurt her feelings.

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 How does Income Tax Work?
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: Learn about income tax - what it is, how it works and when you have to pay it.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How is it Made? Cricket Bat
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a factory where cricket bats are made from willow trees, because it's bouncy and strong.

title: In My Shoes: China
description: A unique child-led view looking at how the geographical features of three diverse countries have shaped the way people live and work. Stages 2-3 Geography, History, English.
description2: Zhe Wen lives in Shanghai, a bustling and energetic city with a population of over 23 million people.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. And in this episode we meet a Journalist at Triple J who shares a few industry secrets!

title: Titch And Ted Do Maths
description: This live action comedy series introduces odd couple Titch and Ted. Perennially fired and always on the lookout for work, their next three jobs will unwittingly teach them about Measurement, Fractions and Geometry.
description2: Titch and Ted learn about Geometry on their day out at the beach and on the job at the sweet store.

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: Tri and Roh are racing to get concert tickets, but Boxy is rolling themselves as a dice to decide how many steps they will take.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: All female crew navigates a sea of change
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: With women making up an estimated 1 to 2 per cent in seafaring roles, Alies van Driel is steering change, becoming the first woman to become a ferry master in Newcastle. Kerrin Thomas reports

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: In the middle of one disgusting meal, the woodlouse introduces himself. He reveals some disgusting things that his crab relatives would be ashamed of, like the fact that he drinks with his bottom!

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Sarah works as a servant for the cold and demanding Mrs Owen and her daughter Alice. Alice sets out to make Sarah's life a misery, but the two girls have more in common than they realise.

title: Get My Job
description: A fast-paced introduction into a range of fascinating careers. From animators to wildlife carers to musicians, find out how successful people got their dream jobs, and hear their advice to you! Stage 5 Careers
description2: Get My Job explores the day in the life of different professions around Australia. In this episode we meet a Wildlife Carer.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: A beautifully illustrated story about a Tawny Frogmouth trying to find her home.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Koolee is 10-years-old and lives in the small outback town of Winton in Central Western Queensland. Koolee is from the Waluwarra and Yirendali people. She loves to play sport, especially rugby league and running.

title: My Life
description: Documentary series following the highs and lows of children across the world, each with a unique story to tell. Stages 4-5 PDHPE
description2: Six children learn how to beat their speech impediments by practising their fluency in busy London marketplaces. They also meet presenter Michael Palin, whose own father struggles with a stammer.

title: Bistro Escargot
description: Join Chef Escargot and waitress Suzette as they attend to Jasmine and Daniel, who have become lost on a school trip with their French class, at Le Bistro Escargot. Stages 4-5 French
description2: Daniel and Jasmine are two students on a class trip to a French speaking city. They become lost and stumble upon Bistro Escargot.

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: At any one time it is estimated that 2000 thunderstorms are happening across the world. The team investigate what makes the thundercloud so feared and Leo faces some giant hailstones.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie is finding out how birds fly and visits a bird sanctuary.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Like all rays, you have a very flat body, like a kite  but you are a giant ray, the biggest in the world even! In Spanish, manta means "blanket or coat". It's true that you look like you've put on a big cape!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum decides he wants a pet. Sally suggests lots of pet ideas including a fish but Possum thinks fish are boring. To see how exciting fish really are, Sally and Possum watch a school excursion to Underwater World.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Presenter and comedian Ed Petrie reads extracts from 'Cosmic' by Frank Cottrell Boyce as part of the 'Bringing Books to Life' series. He explains why he loves the book and shares how it captured his imagination.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word FLY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Apart from the sun and water, plants need other nutrients to grow and be healthy. One of the best ways to get these nutrients to the plants is through fertiliser. In this episode we show you how to make plant fertilisers.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a mollusc without a shell. Sea slugs are found in all seas and at all depths... And the little feather dusters there, sticking out? These are your gills it is thanks to them that you breathe!

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school?

title: Sally & Possum
episode_name: What Can You Do With A Pumpkin?
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum's playing soccer and Sally's in the vegetable garden. Sally joins Possum before going inside to make pumpkin soup. Hungry, Possum goes inside too. Possum learns about putting things in the pot.

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 35 Hey! That's a Pattern!
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Look around, patterns are everywhere!

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In the early 1900s, teenage Afghan Aboriginal cameleer, William Satour, guided his father's camel train through some of Australia's toughest country. Can Ezekiel and Nathaniel deliver their cargo safely and on time?

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word ZOO. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Teenage Boss
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Alex uses his entrepreneurial skills to deal with a pile of unexpected bills by earning money with a car wash and selling unused items from the family's shed.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Playing a medieval queen and knight, Zoey and Lukas look into fancy versus simple language and the poetry of old books and plays.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Ava uses a scale to compare the mass of different objects, from feathers to a watermelon!

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Zoey and Lukas play pirates in this episode about words that don't follow the rules. Yarrrr!

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WHY. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Seeking Refuge
episode_name: Series 1 Please Don't Let Me Go
description: A compelling and moving series of short animated documentaries portraying the real-life stories of young people who have sought asylum. Stages 3-5 History, Civics and PDHPE
description2: Juliane spent years in a Zimbabwean orphanage before being reunited with her mother.

title: What's For Dinner? Lunar New Year (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
episode_name: What's For Dinner? Lunar New Year (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Welcome to Penny's place for Lunar New Year! It starts with a race around the seafood markets for the freshest fish and veggies and ends with homemade dumplings, a colourful salad tossing tradition and some very cute dragons!
description2: Welcome to Penny's place for Lunar New Year! It starts with a race around the seafood markets for the freshest fish and veggies and ends with homemade dumplings, a colourful salad tossing tradition and some very cute dragons!

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 Years 3-4: Minute to win it: Quantifying Collections
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Ms Kirszman teaches you how to play Minute To Win It, and she explores how we can quantify collections without needing to count but by looking and thinking instead.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Let's see what D can do.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word DOWN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: To find out why some shapes go through air better than others, the gang is going to make a rocket with an astronaut, put bicycle "test pilots" to the test, and meet a rocket scientist who swims better than he walks.

title: Create
episode_name: Indigenous Art Experiences - Collage on Bark
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create an interesting piece of art using materials from all over your garden!

episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Years F-1: Addition using Concrete and Pictorial Strategies
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson Miss James teaches how to solve addition problems using counters and pictures. She demonstrates how to set up and solve the addition questions correctly, and provides opportunities for you to have a go at home.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create a beautiful braid perfect for a special occassion but be prepared to help out by holding some lengths of hair!

title: Water Wisdom
description: Fresh water systems are fundamental to Australia's first people who have nurtured a deep understanding of water. The Water Wisdom series shares this knowledge through the voice of Aboriginal communities.
description2: This episode of the Water Wisdom series shares the knowledge of fresh water systems through the voice of the Adnyamathanha people who have managed water in the Northern Flinders Ranges for thousands of years.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 10 Spooky Brains And Eyeballs
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make Spooky Brains and Eyeballs (spooked out spaghetti and meatballs), all while learning about fractions and counting in groups.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: This is the big day! Sally is going to show Possum not just how to make pancakes, but how to flip them. If Possum is flipping pancakes, where will they land?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: It's what is inside that's important, but the outside of a present may look good too. Possum learns more about wrapping things up nicely. Now, what is he going to do with Sally's spanner?

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1938 - Colum has two big ambitions to stop his best mate Thommo's family from being kicked out of their house next door to his and to get up the nerve to ride his billy cart down Brickpits Hill.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: This is the letter N, my friends.

title: So You Want To Be A Designer?
series: So You Want To Be A Designer?
description: See how designers create products that meet user need and are inclusive. We see how designers determine their market, consider users' values and needs, and respond to the challenges of demographic change and inclusive design. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: We talk to one of the world's leading architects who shows us round the UK's first zero carbon housing project and visit the Smile plastics factory where anything from old mobile phones is turned into building materials.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: You don't even need to press the brush to cardboard to create a piece of art with the splatter effect!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Arthur Fadden.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: We are not the only ones communicating with the internet, objects are also connected but how can the data impact them directly?

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Internet, facilitation tool or object of fascination? How not to flutter or become dependent?

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 The Power Of The Power Of 2!
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Mathemagician Eric demonstrates the amazing power of two that can turn one gold coin into over one billion coins in one month. It's not magic...it's math!

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features John Christian Watson.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 The Buzz On Bugs
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6! Did you know that not all bugs are insects, and that all insects have six legs? In this STEM episode Eric learns more about the bodies of these little creatures. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's time to meet Sixty and friends in a rocket-powered game of How Many Tens.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Friction and Reality rub... rub... rub... Can you feel the heat? Yes? It's friction! In this STEM episode Eric learns how friction creates heat and can slow down moving objects. It's not magic, it's science!

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: Daily Life In The Past
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Lower Primary Humanities and Social Sciences students are invited on a virtual excursion to see how people lived, from Federation to the 1940s.
description2: How did people dress, cook, and work in the 1940s? This decade commences with the world at war. Daily life on the home front changed significantly.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 25 Small Sample Inference For One Mean
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: A brewer uses this technique to monitor quality differences in multiple batches of the same beer.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Stories of shared histories for Chinese Australians: Craig and Jason
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Talks of tensions in China often happen at a macro level – governments, geopolitical terms. But for many people, including Jason Yat-Sen Li and Craig Chung, it’s much more personal, and complicated.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode demonstrates how following a specific sequence of arithmetic steps and the special properties of 9 will always result in the same answer, in this case the number 4.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Friends are very important and a surprise party is a good way to thank them. But who is going to be surprised at this party?

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: You are a cetacean which means that you belong to the same family as dolphins and whales. But you are recognised immediately thanks to your long defense on the front of your head.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Is China's economic miracle all that it appears?
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: COVID-19 has caused massive damage to the global economy – but China's economy has bounced back fast, after apparently avoiding the recession that hit so many other countries. David Chau takes a look.

title: The Stickie Gang
description: Angie, Eddie and Mia are best friends who live on Stickie Street. Their lovable dog, Ruffles, is always nearby wanting to join in! They love learning, playing and solving problems together, and having fun while they do it.
description2: As the gang help Eddie prepare for his dad's birthday, Mia drops her calendar and it becomes mixed up! Mia, Eddie and Angie figure out the months of the year as they talk about birthdays, celebrations and holidays.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Can singing and playing an instrument improve your health?
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Music therapy is becoming more popular than ever, and is having life-changing effects on one Adelaide man. Charles Brice reports.

title: Mini Lessons
episode_name: Series 2021 Episode 5 Maths Years 3-4: Fractions of Collection
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in maths and science.
description2: In this lesson, you will be exploring fractions of collections. Ms Szalek demonstrates how you can write a fraction, and then she shows you the best way to fairly share biscuits using your knowledge of fractions.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word FUN. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Time to get the party started by counting from sixteen to twenty!

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Mona lives in Amsterdam and is worried about the plastic waste in her city. She finds plastic bottles and bags floating in the canals. She wants to find out what plastic is and why it shouldn't end up in the environment.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Something amazing is hanging from Possum's tree. And what is that beautiful thing flying around? And these things on leaves? Could they all be one animal?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: When their numberlings fall off, the Numberblocks have to work out who they are and how numbers work.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: My dear Platypus, you are an extraordinary animal who is unlike any other! Or rather... yes, you look like many different animals! As birds do, you lay eggs - and males have a poisonous hook behind the hind leg.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Full interview with journalist Ahmed Rashid
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: What’s China's role now as a neighbour to the Taliban-run Afghanistan? Journalist and author Ahmed Rashid joins Stan Grant to discuss.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: One a hot day, Elijah and his brother want to go swimming in the pool, but first they must help their Grandad to clean out the leaves and get rid of a cheeky cane toad.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: What is a structure and how do you make it sturdy? Hamza wants a new bookcase. He enlists help to build it and learns that there are three forms that make the basis of all structures, frames, shells, and solids.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Move in another apartment could be very tiresome but if you are the great Amedeo Modigliani and have two passionate admirers like Mati and Dada, you will come out of this!

title: Get Into Textiles
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Recycled And Sustainable Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource shows how textile designers are meeting the challenge from government and consumers to meet the 6Rs. Case studies include: shoes made from old tyres and seatbelts bags made from recycled materials.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This episode looks at how companies in the UK are working to meet government targets to reduce their environmental impact, by using state of the art water recycling plants and by making better use of their waste streams.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Bop wants to see a real dinosaur so he decides to look for one in the town square. He is disappointed he can't find a single one so his friends come up with a clever plan to help Bop see a dinosaur.

title: Mixed Up Maths
description: Join our host, Ed, as he finds himself in all types of situations where only his knowledge of maths can help him.
description2: No one likes being late. Knowing the difference in time systems will make all the difference, especially if your train is leaving at 3:30...or is it leaving at 15:30?

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Join in the fun as Rachael explores what it means to feel 'Happy'!

title: BTN: Antarctica Special
description: A BTN Special all about Antarctica; from the people who live and work there to the important scientific research going on at the moment. All filmed at Casey Station, a research base on the Antarctic mainland. Stage 3-4 HSIE and Science
description2: A BTN Special all about Antarctica from the people who live and work there to the important scientific research going on at the moment. All filmed at Casey Station, a research base on the Antarctic mainland. Stage 3-4 HSIE and Science

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn about tutting in a street dance-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Jango's nap is disturbed by Zap's loud mail delivery whistle, so he secretly swaps it for a quieter one.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word ANT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Can a mirror double Dada? Sure, in Mati and Dada world! But thanks to that, the art of Vermeer and his portraits inside mirrors seem all so clear now!

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids explore experiments in trick photography that requires a balancing act the components of everyday sand an optical illusion based on convex and concave imagery and lots more.

title: Exploration India
description: Three 13 year olds are going on a trip of a lifetime - to discover the geography of India. The teenagers find out what life is really like for the people of India. Stage 4-5 Geography.
description2: Dua and Amalia explore the impact of urbanisation on Bangalore, India. They meet Chandra, a local geographer who shows them how urbanisation has engulfed villages and created narrow streets and densely built housing.

title: My Little Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 IL Pleut, IL Mouille
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, IL Pleut, IL Mouille is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 11 Angel, Tyra and Mario. Takes Care of an Injured Pigeon
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: On a hot day in Peru, Angel is checking on the recovery of an injured pigeon in Ghana, Tyra is at nursery school, singing and dancing. And in Italy, Mario lives in Sicily, enjoys a family walk up Europe's tallest volcano.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Critically endangered sawfish given a helping hand to ensure survival
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Sawfish stranded in the drying Daly river have caught the attention of a team of Indigenous rangers and a researcher.

title: My Little Songs
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, 1Km A Pied is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Your Paintings
description: Looks into the world of an oil painting; the ten paintings have been selected from a range of eras and art movements and can be found in galleries across the UK. Stages 4-6 Visual Arts
description2: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting 'Bride of the Sea' by Eileen Agar. Inside the painting she explores Agar's use of collage techniques as well as looking at surrealism.

title: Minibeast Heroes
episode_name: Series 1 Meet The Germinator: Meat Ant
description: Minibeasts Heroes is an animated series that takes you up close and personal with six Aussie bugs to show you how they save the world. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Science and Technology
description2: Minibeast heroes each have an amazing super power. Follow the stinky pheromone trail for fun facts about this hard-working bug who helps grow hundreds of species of Australian plants.

title: BTN
description: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.
description2: Ukraine Tension, Inland Floods, COVID Waste, Safer Internet Day 2022 and Frozen Iguanas.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Artist Julie Gough uses her art to bring to life people, places and events from Tasmanian colonial history and gives her viewers a chance to delve deeper and experience the past differently.

title: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
series: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
description: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Big Weather (and how to survive it) is an emotionally gripping series filmed over one intense summer.
description2: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Craig Reucassel joins fire chiefs and emergency commissioners as they plan for an ominous summer ahead.

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The defeat of Alesia, in 52 BC, marked the end of the well-known "Gallic War", immortalised by its winner, Julius Caesar. Year zero of our French national history, Alesia became the founding act of an improbable Gallic unit.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Susie Youssef is a comedian, improviser, and actress who changes the world by making people laugh.

title: MathXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Take Note Of Musical Fractions
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: This episode is about patterns in rhythms and musical notes, and the role of fractions in denoting whole, half, and quarter notes, and creating distinct sounds.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a planetarium to learn how stars work. She discovers that stars are made in space by dust and gas and when they press together, they get really hot - and light up!

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 Tyra, Hamza and Liza. Makes Blueberry Pancakes
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Russia, Liza picks blueberries with her grandma in Ghana Tyra goes to the market with her grandma and in Jordan, Hamza has a day out in town with his dad.

title: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
series: Big Weather (and how to survive it)
description: With unique access to Australia's emergency services, first responders and local communities, Big Weather (and how to survive it) is an emotionally gripping series filmed over one intense summer.
description2: Australia experiences the largest peacetime evacuation in its history. Craig learns what's required to become a volunteer firefighter as he undertakes training before heading to the fire front.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The nocturnal Pineapple fish shows us how they glow in the dark to attract their pray and also to communicate with other pineapple fish.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Spawn Point's Rad Yeo discusses boys' toys, girls' toys and being true to yourself.

title: ABC Education Good Mornings
description: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.
description2: How would you greet someone in the language of the land on which you live? Children from around Australia encourage you to join them as they share greetings in their Indigenous languages.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Jellyfish shows us how they catch their prey and fend off predators using their stinging tentacles and can see their food after they eat it because of their see-through bodies.

title: BTN: Media Literacy
description: In a time of information overload, understanding the news has become more important than ever. This series helps to navigate the news, sort fact from fiction, and recognise how their world views can be shaped by the media. Stage 5 English
description2: Sources are a key ingredient to any news story but their quality can vary a lot! This episode looks at different types of sources and gives advice on how to find reliable information.

title: Mini Lessons: English
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, Mrs Jegers teaches you how to make predictions about the content of a text. She demonstrates five simple prediction steps you can take as a text detective.

title: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
series: Little J And Big Cuz Indigenous Languages
description: Little J and Big Cuz are Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog, the dog. Spoken in the Indigenous languages of Gija, Noongar, Torres Strait Creole, Palawa Kani, Warlpiri and Djambarrpuyngu.
description2: Little J and Big Cuz are worried when Old Dog goes missing. Surely with Uncle Mick they'll find him. Meanwhile, Old Dog is safe - causing havoc in Big Cuz's bed! Spoken in the Indigenous language of Torres Strait Creole.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is excited about seeing kangaroos from the top of his tree. He is fascinated to learn more about other Australian animals and particularly interested in how kangaroos move.

title: Creating A Nation
description: Australia is a multicultural country, people from all over the world have made their homes here. Hear the stories of diverse Australians as they share the journeys they or their ancestors have taken to make Australia home.
description2: Hale Adasal's parents migrated to Australia under the Australia-Turkish migration agreement. It was the first such agreement between Australia and a Muslim country and signalled the end of the White Australia Policy.

title: House Of Sound
description: We explore the science of sound, music and musical instruments in this series of short films. Drawing inspiration from Beethoven's Fifth Symphony and others, we discover that vibration is responsible for everything we hear.
description2: In their musical House of Sound, Fran Scott and Greg Foot explore string instruments and how they work. From the piano to the violin and everything else in between it's all about vibration.

title: Mini Lessons: English
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 14 Year F: Decoding Unfamiliar Words Using Context
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in literacy.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn how to use context to decode the meaning of unfamiliar words. Leanne demonstrates how to use clues in the text and illustrations make connections and ask questions when reading.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Peter Singer, Bronwyn Finnigan and Julian Savulescu ask if animals have the same interests as humans and how we should ethically treat them.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Oh, no! Would you leave Possum in charge of the house? Will Possum understand all the instructions? Is everything going to be fine when Sally gets home?

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Nakkiah Lui is a writer, actor and a Gamilaroi/Torres Strait Islander woman who discovered being an outsider made her who she is today.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Everyone in Hoopla loves the dragon boat festival, especially Jango who loves it because Mimi makes delicious sticky rice dumplings. Jango sneakily eats all the dumplings and pretends that there is a hungry dragon in Hoopla.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Dr Karl Kruszelnicki is a walking encyclopaedia of knowledge. He tells his 12 year old self to keep making mistakes, because if you're not making mistakes you're not making anything!

title: Hey You, What If?
episode_name: Series 1 You Fell Into A Black Hole?
description: Have you ever wondered what would happen if the Earth was flat? Or if the moon was made of cheese or you could time travel? This clever factual series plunges us into parallel worlds where anything can and does happen.
description2: Given the nearest black hole would take thousands of years to get to, you don't have to worry about falling into one. But we're going to do it anyway and experience a mind-bending ride where space and time get distorted.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey is on the hunt for a hidden treasure and could sure use some prepositions to help her.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Words can be split into beats just like music. The beats in words are called syllables. Splitting words into syllables really helps with spelling and pronouncing words. Time to break it down with Zoey!

title: Teenage Boss (Simplified Chinese Subtitles)
description: Hosted by Australia's star mathematics teacher, Eddie Woo, follow 15 teenagers from across Australia, as they take charge of the family budget.
description2: Charlie is a focussed teen who makes plans and sticks to them. In this family, it's Charlie's parents who like to spend, and hope Charlie will learn to loosen up a bit as the boss and spend more.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: It's a lovely day for a picnic but one of the flapjacks is missing! Is there a Flapjack-snaffler on the loose or has Three forgotten what Numberblocks do best? Learn how to count and get it right with the number friends.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: How China is winning the race to 6G
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: 6G technology might not exist just yet, but the race to develop it is well and truly underway - and China is powering full-steam ahead. Samuel Yang takes a look.

title: Go Wild For Maths
description: Step into the wild with dirtgirl and Costa the Garden Gnome and find that maths is hiding around every corner. These interstitials are a launching pad for maths at home or at school; an invitation to find numeracy in nature.
description2: Think like a bird and use what you find around you to weave a nest.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Peter Singer and Caroline West explore consequentialism and ask would you, could you kill to save others?

title: Heywire
description: Heywire is young regional Australians telling it like it is. They share candid and courageous stories about life outside the big cities.
description2: Ivan thinks dancing is not just for girls - anyone can do it.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Here I am, off to explore the Andes in South America - and to find one of their most famous residents! You are a big animal with a long neck and a small head you look a lot like a camel with no hump!

title: Life In Medieval Europe
description: Set in 1350, this medieval drama unfolds through a number of village characters telling their stories of life in the middle ages. We meet the baker, the herbalist, the landless labourer, the medicus and the Lord of the Manor. Stage 4 History.
description2: Set in 1350, this medieval drama unfolds through a number of village characters telling their stories of life in the middle ages. We meet the baker, the herbalist, the landless labourer, the medicus and the Lord of the Manor. Stage 4 History.

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1898 13 year old Cornish miner Robert Richards worked full time, attended night school, did chores and raced billy carts! Can Jack and Makayla finish all his jobs and still make it to the Moonta Goat Cart championships?

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Oh no! A fly is about to eat your food! With 4000 lenses in each eye, this guy can brag about how well he detects movement, making it hard to swat him. Plus he's a great flier, able to land almost anywhere, even ceilings.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Extended interview with activist, Ted Hui
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Stan Grant interviews pro-democracy activist in exile Ted Hui.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Insulted by the salt left in the garden, this slug begins to tell us how wrong we are about him. With his 25,000 teeth he eats things like dead leaves, fungus, and dog poo all over the world.

title: Montserrat: Living With Volcanoes
description: This program deals with the impacts of the volcanic eruption that began in Montserrat in July 1995, resulting in a major eruption in 1997, and which has never fully settled since. Stages 4-5 Geography, Science
description2: This program deals with the impacts of the volcanic eruption that began in Montserrat in July 1995, resulting in a major eruption in 1997, and which has never fully settled since. Stages 4-5 Geography, Science

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet a tiny little worker ant. He takes a quick break from his duties to tell us about his colony, in an ant hill. This heavy lifter can pick up 20 times his own body weight, plus he's got the largest brain among insects.

title: Bringing Books to Life
description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Paralympic basketball player & sports presenter Ade Adepitan reads extracts from 'Tom's Midnight Garden' by Philippa Pearce. He shares why he loves the book, how it captured his imagination and why he loves to read.

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features Edmund Barton.

title: The Wacky Word Show
description: The Wacky Word Show features skits, songs, animations, special guests and real-kid competitions in a zany variety show that inspires kids to have fun with words and language.
description2: Cowpokes Zoey and Lukas explore onomatopoeia and silent letters in this rodeo-themed episode.

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Where is that wheelbarrow? If only there was a way of showing where it is. Possum and Sally find a great way to locate the wheelbarrow and everything else in the yard.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: WooHoo! This fun loving guy is the Water Strider. If he senses movement on top the water he can float over the surface to get it, without sinking!

title: Mini Lessons: Maths
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Years 3-6: Subtraction without Regrouping
description: Australian teachers teach important numeracy skills in these ten minute lessons.
description2: In this lesson, Miss White teaches how to complete formal subtraction problems without regrouping. She demonstrates how to set up and solve the subtraction questions correctly, and provides opportunities to have a go at home

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Ou Hongyi, China's lonely climate crusader
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Ou Hongyi (she/they), or Howie Ou, is a Chinese environmental activist from Southern China. When she was 16, she started protesting alone, as part of Fridays for Future, the climate strike movement started by Greta Thunberg.

title: Numberblocks
episode_name: Now We Are Six To Ten
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Are you sitting comfortably? Then we'll begin a bedtime story all about Numberblocks Six to Ten.

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Hamza has a very special guest host today... Benny, the Egg. Why is an egg so strong when Hamza squeezes it, but so smashable if he drops it? Because it's a dome on both the top and bottom!

title: Look Kool
description: Using songs, skits, and wacky challenges our host Hamza and his mischievous robot cat find the answers to mathematical mysteries. Hamza is helped by kids who hunt for shapes and solve brain-bending puzzles. Stages 2-4 Maths
description2: Bubbles, bubbles everywhere! Hamza wonders why bubbles are always round. Is there something special about a spherical shape? To find out, we make a bubble explosion and throw water into outer space.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Adding fun words to a sentence can make it all your own. Zoey wrote a song about it.

title: Wacky Word Songs
description: Wacky Word Songs inspires kids to have fun with words and language while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Zoey sings a song about how stories always have a beginning, middle, and end.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Flying Fish leads a faulous life out of the waters soaring in the air and dancing upon the waves all while dodging hungry Dolphins.

title: Children of the Holocaust
description: Six remarkable stories of survival from eyewitnesses of Nazi atrocities during World War 2, brought to life for a young audience through animation and a series of follow-on interviews to camera. Stage 5 History, English and Geography.
description2: A young jewish girl who witnesses the Nazi Occupation of Bratislava Czechoslovakia, escapes to Britain on the Kindertransport, her struggle to settle living in Britain & her ongoing search for information about her parents.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Scarlett is the guitarist for the band "Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers". Her advice is to start playing music young!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make someone this special bush bouquet and everyone will want one!

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 1908 - Evelyn can't wait for cracker night. This year, for the first time, the family has their own box of fireworks. Unfortunately Evelyn shows the box to her disbelieving neighbour Freddie.

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences in their own words  both good and challenging.

title: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
series: Advice To My 12 Year Old Self
description: A range of talented Australians, including some of our most well-known Indigenous stars, offer advice to their 12-year-old selves. Stages 4-5 PDHPE.
description2: Fran Kelly is a journalist, political correspondent and a long-serving radio presenter.

title: Smart Materials
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Interactive, Smart and Modern Textiles
description: With extraordinary access to the latest research and development, the show explores cutting edge smart materials finding out how they are made, how they work and what their potential applications are now and in the future. Stage 5 Design & Technology
description2: Wearable electronics, textiles that generate power and smart and modern materials like Kevlar, Nomex and D30 are all covered in this resource that looks at their characteristics, functions and applications.

title: Weirdy Rhymes
description: Inspired by the world of nursery rhyme, myth and mischief this is a series of animated adventures featuring some strange creatures. The sort you might find somewhere deep inside an old dusty cupboard.
description2: The Nipth sets out to see its friend the Plubbily when everything is turned on its head. However, not everything was on the right way round to begin with.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: 10-year-old Laura can't own up and find a way to say sorry for a misadventure.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The Numberblocks play an exciting game of bounceball - and it's the Even Tops versus the Odd Blocks. Learn about odd and even numbers with the Numberblocks.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Take a plain ponytail and turn it into a bubble bonanza! All you will need is a few extra hair ties!

title: Pencil Pals
description: Pencil Pals follows the adventures of Alien, Bee, Cockatoo and Dinosaur, four pencil topper friends who learn about language, literacy and storytelling through stories they read, write and share together.
description2: Alien tries to tell a story about pirates who sail the seven seas but keeps getting their, there and they're confused, so his friends help him to understand the difference.

title: Life Chat With Learn English
description: Life Chat with Learn English, featuring Charlotte Batty and Lawrence Gunatilaka, explains common words and phrases through role-plays based on daily life situations in Australia. Stage 4-6 English EALD
description2: Confused about which bins to use in Australia? Lawrence finds himself in that position and calls the local council.

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: My computer keeps track of my Internet browsing in "cookies". What is this "cookie" story and how does it work?

title: Citizen Code
description: A video series that goes behind the scenes of digital culture.
description2: Since the 1960s, the world of video games has continued to evolve. What are the features and how is a video game created today?

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is keeping an eye on the timber on Amanda's ute for a while, and considers it a good time to make a cubby house. Possum feels he knows enough to make one - not for himself, but so Sally can live closer to him!

title: Bringing Books to Life
