description: Ten short films aimed at getting 7-11 year-old children interested in books. Stages 2-4 English.
description2: Actors Scott Haran & Percelle Ascott read extracts from 'The Falcon's Malteser' by Anthony Horowitz. They explain why they love the book and share how it captured their imaginations.

title: I Can't Go To School Today
series: I Can't Go To School Today
description: A series of animated documentaries exploring the experiences of children living with different illnesses and conditions. Using the testimonies of six young people, animations are used to tell their story visually.
description2: Naomi is now in remission she talks about her diagnosis, chemotherapy, radiation therapy and recovery. We also hear about her life before and after the diagnosis, discussing the emotional impact of cancer.

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Charlie's place, where her indigenous Yorta Yorta roots mean that what they eat is sourced from the land around them. See how Charlie uses native plants and big flavours to take you on an indigenous food journey.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Group of gardeners create new community to save prized plants
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Beautiful backyard gardens don't just grow, they're lovingly curated often for many decades by the owners who create them.

title: War On Waste
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: In the second episode Craig Reucassel dives underwater to discover the shocking amount of plastic waste that ends up in our oceans, which in turn becomes ingested by our marine life. #WarOnWasteAU

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Salmon loves to travel. She explains their long journey growing from tiny tadpoles to adult fish and making the journey back upstream themselves to lay eggs of their own.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Today we're going to learn about Jazz and Groves mash up

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Washing machines, dryers and hot water help eradicate life threatening conditions
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Washing machines, dryers and hot water have helped eradicate life threatening conditions in remote communities in the Northern Territory. Roxanne Fitzgerald reports.

title: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
series: Back In Time For Dinner: Education Shorts
description: In this series we explore a home from a dfferent decade in each episode. For use in Stage 1 History, students gain an insight into how their parents, grandparents and even great grandparents may have lived. Stages 1-3 HSIE, English
description2: The 1990s - Technology continues to transform homes in the 90s as we see the impact of CD's, dishwashers becoming commonplace, and most revolutionary of all - the internet arrives in homes.

title: Keeko
description: Keeko lives in a beautiful forest with playmates Bird and Dog. Together they find fun activities and new games to play. Along the way they discover how to interact, solve problems, and show their care for each other.
description2: Keeko is confused when Dog and Bird don't seem to want to play. Can Keeko show Dog and Bird that they are important friends so they can all play together?

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada run smack into a Futurist Banquet of the senses.

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Squid tells us all about how they get around using propulsion, how they communicate with other squids and how they are very placid animals unless you get between a Squid and its dinner!

title: Fierce Earth
description: Hurricanes, earthquakes, tsunamis, lightning strikes: Fierce Earth shows what it would be like to experience some of nature's most destructive forces.
description2: Fierce Earth travels to the Philippines to discover why the Islands are right in the middle of Typhoon Alley. Leah and Mike explore how typhoons create havoc for the millions of people living in the country's capital Manila.
more: Hosts Leah Gooding, Leo Houlding, Dougal Jerram, Clare Nasir, Zoe Palmer

title: I'm A Fish
description: I'm a Fish features a variety of sea creatures who invite us into their underwater world. They tell us all sorts of fun and interesting facts about where they live, what they do and how they survive in such deep places! Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: The Cuttlefish reveals to us how they hide from others by changing their colour and if that doesn't work how they squirt ink to get away. Their unique bodies also help them catch prey that are further up.

title: Art With Mati And Dada
description: An artistic animated series about Mati, a cheerful little girl with a passion for art, who is transported into the lives of famous artists from the past by her eccentric, magical sidekick Dada. Early Stage 1- Stage 1 Art.
description2: Mati and Dada action paint with Jackson Pollock and end up deep inside a swirling action painting!

title: If You See It, You Can Be It
series: If You See It, You Can Be It
description: What do you want to be when you grow up? No matter what the profession, if you see it - you can be it! Stage 4-5 Careers.
description2: Ruby has a passion for making things with her hands, and in this episode she gets tips on how to hammer, sand and saw with a Carpenter.

title: hoopla doopla! (Mandarin)
description: hoopla doopla! is a live action preschool show that is inspired by circus and physical comedy. The show features 6 characters and is set in the colourful town of Hoopla. (Mandarin)
description2: Squidgie's garden looks so beautiful she decides to have a picnic for her friends but a big wind sweeps through Hoopla turning her garden into a mess and breaking her rake. How is she going to clean it in time for the picnic?

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: In todays class we're going to learn how to mash up Swing and KPOP

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids undertake experiments in juggling balls using the Bernoulli principle, exploring the oscillation of pendulums with stuffed animals, a crash course in basic astronomy and lots more.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Turning tonnes of textile waste into employment opportunity
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: An upcycling project in Perth's north is helping create training and employment opportunities for vulnerable groups in the community.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: A look at China's rich musical history
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: In Mao’s China, pianos were destroyed as despised symbols of the bourgeoisie, but now an estimated 40 million children are learning the instrument. China Tonight’s Annie Louey has more.

title: How To Make: Brainy Bites
description: How To Make: Brainy Bites is a bright and fun educational series that incorporates numeracy elements all through stop motion magic and healthy, delicious recipes.
description2: In this episode of How To Make: Brainy Bites, we make a super cute, fresh and summery Toadstool Salad, all while learning about time and fractions. It's the healthiest snack this side of the forest!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Sally is sorting plant pots from the garden. She asks Possum to help but Possum ends up sorting the pots by colour instead of size. They head inside so Sally can teach Possum to sort things by colour, size and shape.

title: Kids of Courage
description: What does it mean to be a war child? This sensitive drama series tells a young and family audience the stories of children who lived through a most difficult era in recent history - and who grew with its challenges. Stage 5 History
description2: Romek and his parents live in a Jewish ghetto. He is a smuggler boy. From his last run he brings not only a few potatoes, but also disturbing news: The ghetto is to be closed and the inhabitants deported to a labour camp.

title: Water Safety with Kangaroo Beach
description: In this series of live action specials, the Kangaroo Beach cadets offer vital water safety messages to help you stay safe while making a splash. Learn about waves, floating, rip currents, and what to do if caught in one.
description2: Frizzy and Neville tell us what to look out for before venturing into the ocean.

title: Create
episode_name: Paper Planes: Ace Of The Air
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Find out how to make the Ace of the Air a wonderful glider that will have you flying all around your home!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: It's time for lift-off as Maddie heads to a space museum. We see how a space suit is made from lots of different layers of special material to keep astronauts safe.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: Build up the courage to do things you feel nervous about and you'll feel as light as a bubble!

title: Sally & Possum
description: Filled with fun new adventures, follow Sally and Possum as they explore, discover, and learn about the world around them using Australian Sign Language (Auslan). Early Stage 1 English
description2: Possum is at the the top of his tree watching birds flying. Sally receives an Air Mail letter which Possum thinks flew there. Sally explains that it arrived by plane.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: This Mossarium is the perfect way to create a low maintenance and beautiful mini moss garden that you can keep in the house. Check out this episode to find out how to create your very own!

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet the mud wasp. He not only looks different from other wasps, but he's also less likely to sting humans. He is not very sociable but would you socialise with a critter that froze you with a stinger and fed you to his kids?

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids take on experiments in using centre of gravity to create the illusion of an object rolling uphill, the way bodies shrink and grow throughout the day due to spinal compression and much more.

title: The Mindfulness Tool Kit
description: In this series, we take a good look at the parts of the brain that relate to mindfulness and practice mindful techniques that help us to feel happier, reflective and more productive. Stage 3 PDHPE
description2: Find out how to use empathy and feel more connected to your friends and family.

title: Art Blast
description: Join The Listies on a surprisingly silly journey through the world of art! Boffin Rich supplies the arts and art noob Matt brings the farts. Together they blast their way on a mind-bending journey to the gallery and beyond!
description2: Artists try and trick our eyes using visual illusions. This is called 'Trompe L'oeil', French for 'trick the eye'. However, Matt decides to make up his own term for the illusion...

title: One, Two, Threebies!
description: Join Boxy, Tri and Roh as they dance and bounce around discovering shapes, numbers, and fractions! There's always a new puzzle, and maybe even a watermelon slice or two, when you come to play with the Threebies!
description2: The Threebies learn about 2D shapes as they try to out-do each other in an art competition.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a cutlery workshop to see how sheets of metal are made into forks.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: It's helpful to know the centre of a distribution - which is what the clerical workers in Colorado Springs found out in the 1980s when they campaigned for comparable wages for comparable work.

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Derek Jacobi revisits the role of Richard II which he played in 1978 for the BBC. He reveals why it might have cost Shakespeare his life, and shares some of the political parallels within the play that still resonate today.

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Perla and her younger sister travel to school along an ocean, in Southern Iceland. She tells us about volcanic eruptions, and why she feels family is the most important thing in the world.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Dan is a drummer boy with the marines and his commander asks him to capture a native dog to bring back to the colony's Governor. The only trouble is the dog in question belongs to Waruwi.

title: I'm A Creepy Crawly
description: Creepy Crawlies are slimy, squashy, stingy little pests. Or so we all think but they've got a thing or two to say about that. In I'm a Creepy Crawly, the insects invite us into their alien world to set the record straight. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 Science and Technology.
description2: Meet the millipede. Despite his name, this scaredy cat doesn't have anywhere near 1,000 legs. Even with the legs he does have, he admits to us that he's really slow.

title: My Place
description: Continuing the story of one spot in Australia told by the children who live there over 260 years. Series 2 tells their tales from 1878 to before European settlement.
description2: Henry believes he's a brilliant inventor. When he accidently blows up the school house he's expelled and has to find a way to get back in. The trouble is, his plan involves more inventions.

title: Imagine This
description: A podcast for kids with big questions.
description2: Bri and Professor Jonti Horner are back to help us answer a big space mystery.... what is a meteor?

title: 199 Little Heroes
description: The journey to school is a very special type of life experience shared by millions of children around the world but in different ways. What happens between the two most important places in a child's life, home and school? Stages 2-3 HSIE, Stages 3-4 Geography.
description2: Ignas lives in Vilnius, Lithuania. He has a short walk to school, through the busy city streets. Ignas loves computer games and robotics. He hopes to one day create a robot or game that helps people in their everyday lives.

title: Against All Odds: Inside Statistics
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 The Question Of Causation
description: This series maintains the same emphasis on doing statistics. Video modules take viewers on location to where people from all walks of life are using statistics in their work. Stages 4-6 Science and Geography
description2: This historical story describes how researchers untangled the relationship between smoking and lung cancer.

title: Languages Of Our Land
description: Languages of our Land is an active learning Interstitial series sharing the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh, located in South East Queensland.
description2: Jingeri, learn the Aboriginal language of Yugambeh word for Kangaroo - Muni.

title: Mini Lessons: Science Primary
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 2 Years 5-6: Material World - Slime
description: In these ten-minute lessons, Australian teachers teach fundamental skills in science.
description2: In this lesson, you will learn what happens when we combine different materials to make a new mixture or substance. Mrs Carmeli will show you some simple investigations, to determine which materials are best for making slime.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello, Mr hippo! You are a big animal, with skin that's gray or a bit brown. You eat grass or leaves, so you're a her-bi-vore! "Hippo" in Greek means "horse" and "po-ta-mus" means "river"! A hippopotamus is a river horse!

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Idil lives in Istanbul & loves to draw. She visits the mosque near her home very often. She wonders what makes the mosque so beautiful. Idil discovers that the beauty of the mosque has everything to do with mathematics.

title: Koumi's Animated Picture Book
description: Koumi, a 6-year-old playful girl, observes the animals of the world in her picture book and takes you to meet them on every continent! An edutainment program to satisfy the curiosity of all kids.
description2: Hello Giraffe!! You are a very big animal, the largest on the mainland, by the way! It's your big legs and your long neck that allow you to be so high! So, how's the view from up there?

title: Full Proof
description: This series drags science out of the classroom and takes experiments outdoors. Each episode is hosted by a different child from anywhere in the world, where they do a number of surprising experiments. Stage 1-6 Science, Maths, Stem, Geography.
description2: Iwan lives on Marken, a peninsula in a Dutch lake. Iwan wants to know what lightning is & does all kinds of experiments with static electricity.

title: Fall In Love With Music
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 7 Leave It To Beethoven
description: A fun exploration of the listening process, offering streamlined, effective pathways to musical understanding. The series invites viewers to solve musical problems. Stage 4 Music
description2: This episode provides an in-depth exploration of the 4th movement of Beethoven's String Quartet, Op. 18, No. 2. Concepts presented in the previous six episodes are revisited in this "new" context.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 1 The Trial of Socrates - 399BC
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: Why was Socrates condemned by the city of Athens? Was the figure of the master thinker, who could subvert the youth, really a danger to a Greek democracy that was more idealised than it was understood?

title: Australia's Prime Ministers
description: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. Stages 3-4 HSIE, English.
description2: This series profiles Australia's leaders, featuring career highlights and giving insights into the different eras in which they lead the nation. This episode features John Howard.

title: ScienceXplosion
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: Spy Vision! Are you a spy on a secret mission? In this STEM episode Eric makes his own periscope! It's not magic, it's science!

title: What's For Dinner?
description: With a big spoonful of creativity, a pinch of tradition and a dash of fun - these Australian families have all the ingredients they need to answer the all-important question...What's For Dinner? Early Stage 1 History
description2: Welcome to Nada and Mariam's place, as they hunt, gather and create their Middle-Eastern feast including their mum's famous chocolate baklava!

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Eric shares an amazing trick to show that heavy does not equal big. All you need is something heavy and a lot of something light and you'll be able to prove that weight is not the same as size.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Learning to lace and tie shoes is a hurdle that everybody has to overcome in the course of growing up. Have you ever wondered how many ways you can tie a shoelace? Eric shows us a couple of the 43,000 ways to tie shoelaces.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: The terribly naughty Terrible Twos are making custard pies and Octoblock is all tied up: can his friends save the day?

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: A fantastic treat awaits the Numberblocks if they can figure out how to ride the rays to the top of Ray Canyon.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Matt Stanton and James Foley share how they came up with the ideas for their characters.

title: ScienceXplosion
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 25 Stars In A Jar
description: The world of science, technology, engineering and mathematics affects the way we live every day. ScienceXplosion magician and scientist, Eric, helps to navigate our science-filled world - guided by his good friend VOX. Stages 3 and 4 Science, TAS, STEM
description2: The clear night sky is spectacular. In this STEM episode Eric makes a star projector for his room! You can, too! It's not magic, it's science!

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie heads to a beach to see how sand is made. She explains how a process called weathering breaks the rocks down and how all the tiny grains of rock make sand!

title: Same But Different
description: Short documentary portraits of primary children with a range of disabilities, learning differences and medical conditions.
description2: Rebecca is a ten-year-old girl who has a nut allergy. We see how this has an impact on Rebecca's diet and how she makes choices about where she buys things and what she eats.

title: Dates That Made History
episode_name: Series 2 Episode 11 Babur Takes Over India at Panipat  21 April 1526
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: On April 21, 1526, the little king of Kabul Babur boldly took northern India from the Sultan of Delhi, Ibrahim Lodi. With his victory, the time of the second Islamisation begins, which will spread to the shores of Indonesia.

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Belonging: The Migration Nation
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Pocket Compass explores migration to Australia and changing attitudes towards our newest citizens. Their stories reveal what contributes to a migrant's sense of belonging and how that enriches Australian society as a whole.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word Run. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word And. This series shows an easy way to learn the basic words used in English, based on the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Ever wanted to build a bridge out of pasta? It's not too hard and works better than you'd think. But what if we were to try to make a pasta bridge big enough for Phil to walk across?

title: Weather On The Go
description: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation. Stage 4 English, Science and Geography.
description2: Weather On The Go is a series that teaches you everything you need to know about Australian weather as well as weather idioms used in daily conversation.

title: War On Waste
episode_name: Series 2 Waste Free Street: Where Are They Now?
description: Craig Reucassel returns for a 2nd series of the landmark series that sparked action across the nation. Craig targets plastic water bottles, straws, e-waste, fast furniture, food waste and the recycling crisis. #WarOnWasteAU
description2: Craig visits some of the families from series 1 to find out where are they now with their waste and recycling?

title: Managing Populations
description: A series looking at two case studies into the causes, impacts and challenges presented by large youthful populations in the Gambia, and a large ageing population in the UK. Stage 5 Geography
description2: Examines the issues surrounding an ageing population in the UK, using East Devon as a case study, illustrating the causes, impacts and management of the UK's ageing population and changing dependency ration.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Watch as our artist adds some realistic depth by adding shadows to your painted objects.

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Noosa café offers support for those living with dementia
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: A café in Noosa is offering a stigma-free social setting for people living with dementia, reducing isolation and supporting their carers.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Moving Air! A home-made stomp rocket gets maxed out into a giant version. Plus: Phil uses air pressure to break a piece of wood, makes a vortex cannon and vacuum-seals himself to the wall!

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Fold a flock of cooing pigeons in no time with the help of our origami artist!

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Get your kicks from number 6.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: A short history of the invention of plastic, why we started using it and how it's now gotten a little out of hand. Let's all do what we can to leave less plastic lying around.

title: Wacky Number Songs
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: 5, 10, 15, 20! Ava learns how to count to really high numbers as fast as she can by skip counting.

title: My Little Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 13 IL Pleut, IL Mouille
description: A series of short French folk songs, performed in French and with explanatory graphics, to delight young language students. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 Languages (French).
description2: French folk song, IL Pleut, IL Mouille is performed in French and with explanatory graphics in today's lesson.

title: Ethics Matters
description: Presenter Dr Dan Halliday talks with philosophers, and helps place the ideas in each episode in a real world context. Stages 4-5 Civics, Geography and History
description2: Interviewees Janna Thompson, Marcia Langton and Mick Dodson explore the effect past injustices have on present generations.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Five and friends set off on a rhyming romp through field and forest but they keep getting mixed up! Learn how to keep numbers in order and find missing numbers with the Numberblocks.

title: Census 2021: Why We Count
description: The 2021 Australian Census is on Tuesday 10 August. In this special program we look at how the information is collected, what it reveals about who we are, how we are changing and the planning decisions it helps inform.
description2: With a growing number of Australians experiencing homelessness each Census night, this social enterprise aims to restore respect and dignity.

title: Big Words Small Stories
description: Big Words, Small Stories slides one big word into each silly episode in a laugh-out loud way! Our four main kid characters and their anthropomorphic animal friends provide education and entertainment for children at home.
description2: When Grandpa Rex's corn crops vanish, Cris and Crat are perplexed. They investigate clues, question suspects, and call out Aunt Delilah! She told Rex about the corn in a postcard that he couldn't read.

title: Numberblocks
description: Follow the adventures of the Numbers and learn through animation, fun songs and games! Early Stage 1 Maths
description2: Numberblock Nine arrives in Numberland, finds a friend in Four, sings a song about squares and sneezes! Learn all about the number 9 with Numberblock Nine!

title: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
series: Are You Tougher Than Your Ancestors?
description: Disgusting chores, mind-bending challenges and incredible feats of ingenuity await as Australian kids of today take on a day in the life of their ancestors. Will they have what it takes to be tougher?
description2: In 1832, 13 year old Kadli was chosen as the best player of the match during a Kaurna game of Parntu. Can our modern footballers Ray Ray and Jaikye match his skills to win the best and fairest title?

title: Wacky Number Songs
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 3 How to Defeat a Math Troll
description: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.
description2: Wacky Number Songs inspires kids to get curious about math all while singing along to the catchiest, coolest tunes.

title: ABC SingSong
description: Each episode of this captivating music video series features a song about one letter of the alphabet. Vibrant animation accompanies toe-tapping tunes for a unique and alluring experience that young viewers will love.
description2: Letter V sounds good to me.

title: This Place: Artist Series
description: Six Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander artists from the National Gallery of Australia share their connection to country, how it inspires their art and identity, and take us to the places across Australia where their artmaking begins.
description2: Senior Gija artist Mabel Juli captures nature, creation stories and history of the Darrajayin country in her traditional paintings.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a wellie factory to see how wellies are made. She uses her special cameras to see how the PVC material is injected into the wellie moulds - a bit like making a jelly!

title: Shakespeare Uncovered
episode_name: Series 2 The Taming Of The Shrew With Morgan Freeman
description: In this critically acclaimed exploration of Shakespeare's most cherished plays, each episode features an actor who has a special relationship with a particular play.
description2: Morgan Freeman discusses William Shakespeare's The Taming of the Shrew with Tracey Ullman, Sinead Cusack and Julia Stiles.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word HAD. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: Crow flies away to seek her destiny, hoping to become as wonderful as Crow-in-the-waterhole.

title: Get Into Textiles
description: Using case studies from top fashion houses, textile designers and the world's most innovative companies, this series showcases textiles in the 21st century. Stage 5 Design & Technology, Science
description2: This resource looks at the different types of industrial finishes available and their applications. It explores the reasons for finishing, and when and why different processes might be used.

title: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime
episode_name: My Mob Going To The Beach
description: Grandpa Honeyant Storytime is a 25 episode series comprising of narrated stories told by an indigenous character named Grandpa Honeyant. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 English.
description2: This is a delightful story about the freedom of childhood within the security of a big family.

title: Titch And Ted Do Maths
description: This live action comedy series introduces odd couple Titch and Ted. Perennially fired and always on the lookout for work, their next three jobs will unwittingly teach them about Measurement, Fractions and Geometry.
description2: Titch and Ted undergo a series of mishaps in a restaurant, learning all about measurements on the job.

title: Summer's Day
description: A film about the transition into womanhood when Summer gets her period for the first time and tries to make sense of her blooming body. Stage 4 PDHPE
description2: A film about the transition into womanhood when Summer gets her period for the first time and tries to make sense of her blooming body. Stage 4 PDHPE

title: Pip's Tips
description: Our very own Pip Rasmussen will give us her take on how to tackle everything in life - from bouncing back from online bullying, to bagging the best bargains when thrift shopping. If you need a tip, hit up Pip! Stages 2-4 PDHPE
description2: Pip offers her best advice on how to score a bargain in a 2nd hand store.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word WENT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Maddie's Do You Know?
episode_name: How is it Made? Ice Cream
description: Learn new things with Maddie as she explores the world and discovers how stuff works.
description2: Maddie visits a dairy farm and finds out how milk from cows is made into ice cream.

title: Bug Technology
description: Join us as we take a look at the amazing mechanisms hidden inside the bodies of insects and the new man-made technologies they have inspired. Stages 4-5 Science, Maths, D&T
description2: All the episodes from this series, looking at the amazing bodies of insects.

title: English On The Go
description: English On The Go is a series that explains commonly misused and misspelt words in everyday life. Stages 2-4 English, EALD
description2: Are you lost when it comes to the differences between lose and loose? Don't lose out! We explain the differences and provide some handy hints.

title: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
series: Further Back In Time For Dinner: The Development Of A Nation
description: An ordinary family go back in time to immerse themselves in Australian history. Upper Primary Humanities and Social Sciences studies students will learn about the key events that shaped Australia in each decade.
description2: Our family travel back to the 1920s when many changes for women began to take place. Australia's first female member of Parliament, Edith Cowan, was elected into Parliament and Parliament House in Canberra opened.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word NOW. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: My Five Cents
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 What is Compound Interest?
description: Five short, easy and entertaining explainers about important financial concepts. Presented by Australian comedian, Gen Fricker. Stage 5 Maths and Commerce.
description2: Compound interest will be one of the most important things you ever learn. Don't believe it? Gen Fricker will explain why. Learn how compound interest works and why saving now can help you later.

title: Learn A Word
description: Learn a Word Series 2 demonstrates fun ways and range of strategies for early readers to learn basic words in English. Learn a Word is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.
description2: Learn to spell and write the word CAT. This series demonstrates some fun ways to learn common words in English. 'Learn a Word' is informed by the Australian National Curriculum.

title: Tell Me A Tale
description: Tell Me A Tale is a series of interstitials which explore wellbeing and emotional intelligence using the voices of real, Aussie kids, with animation based on their very own drawings.
description2: When taking part in a fun run, Lily gets tired. In a show of determination, she keeps going and ends up with a magical reward!

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: Air is a fluid, just like water. That means you can surf it if you make a tumblewing. Phil explores lots of different methods of flight all while maxxing out the tumblewing.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Learn a cha-cha-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

title: What Is Music?
episode_name: How Can Music Bring Us Together?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: Can we make friends using music? Linda and Dan see if chanting and drum circles help them bond with strangers, and test their teamwork with synthpop band Froyo in our hardest challenge to date - building IKEA furniture.

title: Pocket Compass
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 5 Belonging: The Migration Nation
description: Study editions of the popular ABC Religion and Ethics series 'Compass'. Stages 4-5 History.
description2: Pocket Compass explores migration to Australia and changing attitudes towards our newest citizens. Their stories reveal what contributes to a migrant's sense of belonging and how that enriches Australian society as a whole.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: Three little pigs decide to build their own houses near a wood where a big bad wolf lives.

title: Science Max! Experiments At Large
description: Have you ever done a science experiment and wondered "What would this be like if it were HUGE?" Welcome to Science Max, the exciting series that turbocharges all the science experiments you've done at home.
description2: A Trebuchet is a giant, lever-based catapult. Phil uses it to hurl pumpkins! Mechanical advantage and the history of the trebuchet are what's being tossed your way on this episode, along with a lot of pumpkins, heads up!

title: What It's Like
description: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. It's a chance for them to share their experiences. Stages 3-5 PDHPE, English
description2: A show for young people in our community whose voices, stories and perspectives aren't often seen or heard. In this episode we hear what it's like to change the world!

title: What Is Music?
description: Why do we love a good beat? Does classical music really make you smarter? Join triple j's Linda Marigliano and composer Dan Golding as they explore the electrifying fusion of emotion and science in music.
description2: It's more then just pressing a button right? We give a quick history of the disc jockey in various forms, and DJ and music producer Nina Las Vegas shows us how she uses the decks.

title: The Storybuilding Tool Kit
description: Unlock the secrets of your favourite story genres. Create your own fantastic characters and send them on epic journeys! Stages 3-4 English
description2: Create a story world and send your hero on an adventure!

title: The Bright Side
episode_name: Goats team up with Rural Fire Service to reduce fire hazard reduction
description: Sabra Lane brings you a collection of stories that aim to inspire, engage and create hope where there is uncertainty. A look at the positive, solutions-based reporting from across the ABC.
description2: Goats are being used in a trial with the Rural Fire Service after an independent inquiry into the Black Summer fires called for grazing to be used for hazard reduction. Joanna Woodburn reports.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: While outside skateboarding, Bobgoblin comes down with a goblin cold. Wally and Betty Yeti embark on a series of expeditions to gather the unusual components of the cold's cure.

title: Teeny Tiny Stevies
description: Teeny Tiny Stevies make content for children filled with cheerful folk-pop tunes covering topics that explore important social messages in a fun and relatable manner.
description2: No one learns the same way. Everyone does it differently, and that's what makes us fascinating! Celebrate your abilities and sing this one loud.

title: Dates That Made History
description: This series tells world history through a few major dates, revisited through the prism of memory. Driven by historian Patrick Boucheron, history comes to life under our eyes with bold and entertaining graphics.
description2: The eruption of the Vesuvio froze the town of Pompei forever. Volcanology reveals the force of the eruption, archeology and the uncover of daily life but can one be sure that these discoveries date back to the eruption?

title: Wow That's Amazing
description: A lively and informative show featuring a cast of feisty and charismatic 10 -13 years old kids, conducting fascinating experiments, solving mind-bending puzzles and performing magic tricks that children can then do at home. Stages 1-3 Science, Maths, Art.
description2: The kids tackle experiments in filming a home-made horror movie mixing up lipstick in the kitchen horror-themed photography using inertia in a magic trick how the shape of an aerofoil's wings create lift and lots more.

title: Let's Dance
description: Set in the inspiring studios of the National Ballet School of Canada, this high-energy series features ordinary kids with big personalities who just love to dance.
description2: Dancers will learn how to dance Country and perform it in the wild, wild west!

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: We are surrounded by technology but how do we use the right words to talk about it? In this episode of Everyday English, Sarah and Jack introduce some key vocabulary related to this topic.

title: Everyday English
description: Everyday English helps you learn English through commonly discussed topics as you navigate life in Australia. Stages 3-6 EALD classes
description2: What words do you need to know when you're in the kitchen? Find out in this episode of Everyday English.

title: Moodies
description: Led by Play School's Rachael Coopes, Moodies identifies big emotions in little people. Inspired by the powerful research around mindfulness for kids, it guides the audiences to name and understand emotions in different ways.
description2: Join Rachael as she wiggles and giggles her body, pulls funny faces and makes up her own language whilst exploring what it means to feel 'Silly'.

title: storyTree
description: Join storyteller, Miss Treeleaf, in an imaginary world with make-believe characters as she reads popular children's books. Early Stage 1 and Stage 1 English
description2: When Charlie plays hide and seek, he learns what really lurks in the closet under the stairs.

title: Create
episode_name: Valentine's Day: Flower And Heart Spoons
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Make your valentine's treats even more sweet with the help of some flower and heart decorated spoons! ABC ME will show you how!

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Madison's MY:24 occurred when she went on a night dive with her Dad and noticed a dramatic decline in shark numbers. Overnight she went from shark admirer to shark conservationist and filmmaker.

title: Back Roads Kids
description: We travel to Australia's remote towns and regions to talk to kids from some of this country's most remarkable and inspiring communities. Early Stage 1 - Stage 2 HSIE, English.
description2: On the boarder of New South Wales and Victoria, Corryong is in a valley surrounded by farms and lush green fields. It's a special place to grow up.

title: Wallykazam!
description: Wally Trollman is an adventurous 6-year-old troll with a power that lets him make words come to life using a magic stick. Wally uses those words to transform the world around him...
description2: Wally and Norville are playing superheroes and invite Ogre Doug to join them, but Ogre Doug doesn't know how. Together they come up with the perfect super-persona for Ogre Doug: Captain Animal!

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: Mo is finding it hard to get along with his mum, Mayor Pam Pamming, and everything she does annoys him. Mikki thinks she knows what he needs to do but it might just be the thing that drives them further apart.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas

title: MY:24
description: MY:24 features twenty-six young people chronicling the impact of a life-changing experience within a 24 hour period - expressed in their own words and using their own images.
description2: Before her MY:24, Sarai was an ordinary young girl from rural Queensland. Then, as a result of the extensive flooding in her state, Sarai came face to face with the agonising prospect of losing her home and everything in it.

title: China Tonight
episode_name: Ancient Chinese medicines in a modern era
description: Stan Grant and Yvonne Yong take a fresh look at news from inside China. We go beyond the headlines of trade wars and global posturing to bring you stories of China's rise in the world, and the changes and challenges at home.
description2: Nowhere does the combination of old and new seem more obvious in China than in medicine – Annie Louey takes a look at how this ancient practice works in the modern medical era.

title: Create
description: Release your inner artist with the help of our experts who will show you how to mould, fold, paint, braid, twirl and build. There's so many creative projects you can do at home with some simple materials and with your hands!
description2: Create a lunch that is sure to impress the playground and by changing one ingredient each time, you will keep your tastebuds happy every school day!

title: My Life in Hitler's Germany
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 1 The Conquest of Power
description: Told only with archival documents, this is a deeply moving account of stories from people of all walks of life and faiths who fled Hitler's Germany, into exile, before the seizure of absolute power by the Third Reich. Stages 5-6 Modern History.
description2: Through personal accounts and letters, Germans who fled the country share stories of arrests and daily indignities as Hitler came to power.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 8 Tyra, Mario and Rhys. Learns to Ice Skate
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Ghana, Tyra is helping her mum cook tea, along with little sister Tracy in Canada Rhys is learning how to ice skate and in Italy, Mario is escaping from the hot sun by playing a diving game in the swimming pool.

title: Where in the World?
episode_name: Series 1 Episode 18 Hamza, Truc and Anushka. Has a Little Sleep - at School
description: Follow the everyday lives of children living in eight different countries around the world, speaking a different language and having different customs, discoveries, thrills and challenges. Early Stage 1 - Stage 1 HSIE.
description2: In Jordan, Hamza has trouble getting up for school, at school in Vietnam, Truc plays lots of games and has a tasty lunch. And after school in India, Anushka learns how to draw patterns on the ground with her aunt.

title: MathXplosion
description: In each entertaining and funny math-short, 'mathemagician' Eric shares secrets from the not-so-hidden world of math, such as measuring the height of a tree using your thumb! But make no mistake, it's not magic, it's math! Stages 1-3 Maths
description2: Would you like to make a self-portrait? Eric knows how to make self-portraits that are perfectly at scale... even if they are tiny. It's Not Magic It's Math!

title: Mikki vs the World
description: Mikki vs the World explores the wonderful, on one hand, and confusing on the other, mental health and brain development of Australian adolescents.
description2: While Mikki is very excited by a new online purchase, Mo thinks she is taking lots of unnecessary risks and being reckless in the office. To get to the bottom of this Mikki talk to Extreme Games gold medallist Jackson Strong.
more: Cast Chika Ikogwe, Carlo Ritchie, Becky Lucas
